loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
Felipe started his business to help increase his income. In July and August there is a fair in Linares, and he wants to take the opportunity to install his taco stand at the entrance to the fair.

He started his business when his son was small and he was unemployed. He was desperate because he had to buy milk and diapers and his wife was also not working. They decided together to start to sell tacos, and for the last 1-1/2 years they have had a sales stand that they move to different locations.

He needs a loan of US$600, which he will repay in 6 months, to buy raw materials to sell every day during fair season, since now he only sells on weekends. He also needs to repair his meat cooker.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Felipe inició el negocio para ayudarse con un ingreso extra ademas que en estas fechas de julio y agosto se pone la feria en Linares y quiere aprovechar la ocasión para instalar su puesto de tacos a la entrada de la feria. Inicio su negocio cuando se quedo desempleado su hijo estaba pequeño y se desesperaba por que tenia que comprar leche y pañales ademas su esposa no trabajaba entre los 2 decidieron empezar a vender tacos y ahora ya tienen el carreton par las ventas y lo mueven a diferentes lugares desde hace aproximadamente 1 ½ años

El necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para la venta en la temporada de la feria todos los dias ya que actualmente solo vende en fines de semana ademas de la reparacion del comal donde se frie la carne.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Havila

texts.es:
Havila, 34 years of age, is a jovial and very active woman. She offers repair services for refrigerators and display cases in a particular way and also has contracts with some businesses that require her services. Señora Havila and her husband, who is in charge of repairs (technician), have three children who study and who are the motivation for them to move forward so that they can provide them with what is necessary to be professionals in the future. Among other things, Doña Havila has a chilled soft drink business that she would also like to expand. The loan that she requests is to build a store to give her clients better attention when they come to have their refrigerators repaired and to increase capital for the sale of her chilled drinks. Havila trusts that you will be able to support her and promises not to disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Havila, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer jovial y súper activa, ella brinda servicios de reparación de refrigeradoras y mostradores de manera particular y también hace contratos con algunas empresas que requieren de sus servicios. La señora Havila junto a su esposo Samuel quien es el encargado de reparar (Técnico) tienen 3 hijos que estudian, y quienes son el motivo para seguir adelante y desde luego entregarles todo lo necesario para que en un futuro sean profesionales. A la par doña Havila tiene un negocio de bebidas heladas, el cual también desea ver crecer. El préstamo que ella solicita es para construir un local apropiado para dar una mejor atención a los clientes que vienen a reparar sus refrigeradoras, y también incrementar el capital para la venta de sus bebidas heladas. Havila confía en que podrán apoyarla, y promete no defraudarlos.

loans.use: Build a shop for her business

loans.name: Juan Roney

texts.es:
Mr Juan lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood, is married, 26 years old and has two children of 2 and 4 years old. His wife washes and irons for private residences and helps with their homes. Mr Juan works as a welder and bricklayer and has nine years of experience doing this labor, which began with his own funds.

The loan he is asking for is in order to build a vertical structure where he can do welding work and in this way provide better quality for his customers. Future plans are to expand the business and gain more customers and teach his daughter this line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Juan habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado, tiene 26 años de edad, y le tienen dos hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad, su esposa lava y plancha a personas particulares y ayuda a su hogar. Don Juan trabaja como soldador y también es albañil tiene nueve años de estar laborando e inició con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para construir una estructura vertical donde relizar trabajos de soldadura y así brindar mejor calidad de trabajo a sus clientes. A futuro es expandirse y captar más clientes y formar a su hija en la educación.

loans.use: Vertical structure in order to do more welding work

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
For many years, Julián has been in the business of selling charcoal wholesale. His daily routine is to go to the market to sell and to deliver his clients' orders. Señor Julián is 43 year old and is the father of six marvelous and very caring children. He, with his wife, Roslava, who always supports him in everything, want to educate, love, and care for their children in good and bad. As always, señor Julián aspires to be a charcoal exporter on the national level. However, to realize this dream, he needs money. For the time being, he asks for this loan to increase the capital of his business and to buy a motorcycle to transport charcoal where his clients request it. Let's support this father who, with strength and dedication, continues working arduously for the prosperity of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julián se constituyó en el negocio de la venta de carbón al por mayor desde hace mucho tiempo, su rutina diaria es de ir cada día al mercado para vender y entregar los pedidos de sus clientes. El señor Julián tiene 43 años y es padre de 6 hijos maravillosos y súper cariñosos, él junto a su esposa Rosalva, quién siempre la apoya en todo, ellos desean educar, amar y querer a sus hijos en lo bueno y lo malo. Desde siempre el señor Julián aspira con ser un exportador a nivel nacional de carbón, sin embargo para la realización de este sueño, necesita dinero, por el momento el solicita este préstamo para aumentar el capital de su negocio y comprar un motocarro para transportar el carbón donde sus clientes lo pidan. Apoyemos a este padre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por la prosperidad de su familia.

loans.use: Increase his charcoal sale business and acquire a motorcycle to transport charcoal.

loans.name: Jerusalen Group

texts.es:
This is the Jerusalem community bank maD. up of 15 members, the 95% women from the same neighborhood. The neighborhood is called Villa Gadus, a humble neighborhood but with people of good heart. The meetings are held in the house of the President, Yolanda, who is a very responsible and punctual and a woman of strong character. The treasurer is Maria del Rosario and the secretary’s name is Reina. The great majority of the members work selling different lines of cosmetics house to house and the secretary makes homemaD. bread. All of the members have been awarded loans of 1.000Bs each in the first cycle to increase their working capital as each has her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Este es el Banco Comunal Jerusalen Conformado por 15 socias un 95% son mujeres D. la misma zona, El barrio se llama Villa Gadys, un barrio humilD. pero con gente D. gran corazon, las reuniones se llevan a cabo en la casa D. la Presidenta Sra. Yolanda una señora muy responsable, puntual, D. carácter fuerte, la Tesorera es la Señora Maria del Rosario , la Secretaria la Sra. Reina z, la gran mayoria D. las socias se dedican a ser Promotoras D. Cosméticos en diferentes líneas D. cosméticos, la Tesorera se dedica a la venta D. ropa, la Secretaria hace Pan Casero. A todas las socias se les ha otorgado un crédito como primer ciclo D. 1.000Bs a cada una, para el incremento D. su Capital, todas tienen negocio propio.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee is 41 years of age and is the mother of five children who are still in elementary school, one suffers from epilepsy. For Renee, her children are her daily motivation to work and to succeed in everything. She would like to make her business something bigger so that she can feel calm and secure. Currently, Señora Renee sells sweets and soft drinks, something that allows her to afford her household expenses and her children's studies. But, for the future, she would like for her business to grow more. Renee would like to continue with her sweets shop and to become a soft drink distributor, something that she sells now by the unit. It is for this reason that she needs a loan that will allow her to meet her goals. She trusts that you will be the tool for this and, for that, you will always be in her grateful heart.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Renee tiene 41 años de edad, es mamá de 5 hijos que aún están en el colegio, uno de ellos sufre de epilepsia, para Reene sus hijos son su motivación diaria para trabajar y prosperar en todo, ella desea convertir su negocio en algo más grande y así sentirse tranquila y segura. En la actualidad la señora Renee se dedica la venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, lo cual le permite sustentar los gastos de su casa y los estudios de sus hijos, pero para el futuro ella quiere que su negocio crezca mucho más. Renee quiere implementar su tienda de golosinas e incluso ser distribuidora de bebidas gaseosas, que ahora vende por unidad. Por ello es que Renee requiere de un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos. Confía en que ustedes serán la herramienta para ello y con lo que siempre estarán en su corazón agradecido.

loans.use: Continue her Business with Greater Merchandise.

loans.name: Corazón De Jesus Group

texts.es:
The Corazón de Jesús group meets on the Ayacucho Tejerina Street. The group has 16 members, 2 of whom are men. This group is on the bi-weekly plan and everyone met their commitments in the first repayment meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Este es el grupo Corazón de Jesús que se reune en la calle ayacucho tejerina. El grupo tiene 16 personas de las cuales 2 son varones, este grupo se encuentra en el plan catorcenal y en la primera reunión de recuperación cumplieron todas muy bien.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nicolaza Carolina

texts.es:
Nicolasa is a woman whom, due to the hard economic situation has had to search for various activities that could allower her to earn money for her family. He lives in the annex of Villa Libertad. Her husband is a photographer and they have five children, 4 of whom are dependent on their parents.

Nicolasa dedicates herself to the sale of tortillas and cell phone cards as well as managing a photography studio in which her husband is the photographer. She has 22 years of experience in business, during which she has acquired much knowledge of how to move forward her photography studio.

The loan is necessary in order to purchase contruction materials and build a home in order to improve her living conditions and at the same time provide better attention to her customers. Her plans are to continue to support her children in their studies in order to enable them to be useful contributors to society.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Nicolasa es una mujer que debido a la dura situación económica ha tenido que buscar varias actividades que puedan traerles ingresos a su familia. Habita en el anexo de Villa Libertad, su esposo es fotógrafo y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son aún dependientes de la pareja. Nicolasa se dedica a la venta de tortilla, venta de tarjetas celulares y también administra un estudio fotográfico en el cuál el marido es el fotógrafo. Tiene 22 años de experiencia en sus negocios en los cuales ha adquirido mucho conocimiento de como sacar adelante su estudio fotográfico. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materiales de construcción y hacer una habitación para así mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y al mismo tiempo poder darle una mejor atención a sus clientes. Sus planes son seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta convertirlos en personas útiles a la sociedad.

loans.use: Building a home

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana is 20 years old and is a teacher, work which she is very dedicated to because she likes to transmit and teach the knowledge she has acquired throughout her years.

Married and with two children who are students, her husbandworks as a network operator in an office in Managua. The constant rains of this past winter came into her home and the roof is now in very poor shape. This is why she is asking for a loan so she can repair part of the roof and in this way stop the rain from continuing to come into her home.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Diana tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la docencia, trabajo que realiza con mucha dedicación porque le gusta transmitir sus conocimientos adquiridos a través del tiempo. Es casada, tiene 2 hijos estudiantes, su esposo trabaja como operador de redes en una empresa de managua. Las constantes lluvias de este invierno están entrando en su casa debido a que el techo seencuentra en mal estado, por eso solicita el préstamo para reparar parte del techo y así evitar que el agua le siga entrando a suvivienda.

loans.use: Repairing the roof of her home

loans.name: Abejitas Group

texts.es:
In the photos of the following request you can observe the members on the day that their checks were distributed (July 8th, 2008). The disbursement was made is the Northern zone of Oruro. This is the first cycle of a biweekly plan and the members have experience with community banks. They are very solvent and the person in charge is Juan David.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

EN LAS FOTOS DE LA PRESENTE SOLICITUD SE PUEDE OBSERVAR A LAS INTEGRANTES EL DÍA DE LA ENTREGA DE CHEQUES (DIA 8 DE JULIO DE 2008). EN LA ZONA NORTE DE ORURO SE DESEMBOLSO SIN NOVEDAD ES 1er CICLO PLAN CATORCENAL SON SOCIAS QUE TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN BANCAS COMUNALES. SON MUY SOLVENTES EL ENCARGADO ES JUAN DAVID.

loans.use: Working Capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Villa Fatima Ii Group

texts.es:
The Villa Fatima II group is located in Villa Fatima Guabira. It is a group that had problems in its third loan cycle due to the departure of its president. This group has been working in the fourth cycle without any repayment delays. This is due to the support and collaboration of all of the 14 members who took responsibility and know how to work together as they are aware that it is a group guarantee. Maria Roxana J. works selling food and her home is on 21 de Julio Street.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo Villa Fatima II es un grupo que se encuentra en Villa Fatima Guabira , es un grupo que tubo problemas en el tercer ciclo, debido a la fuga de su presidenta. .Este grupo viene trabajando en el cuarto ciclo sin problemas de retraso. Gracias al apoyo y colaboración de todas las socias del grupo que son un numero de 14 personas que se responsabilizan y saben trabajar en grupo conociendo que es la garantía en grupo y no dejando atrasarse en ninguna de sus reuniones La Sra. Maria Roxana J. se dedica a la venta de comida y su domicilio es en la c/ 21 de julio.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mr. Ros S., 36, is a motorcycle taxi driver while his wife is a housewife. They have three children and live in Chamkar Samrong Village, Battambang Province. Two of their children are bricklayers and their income can help to defray the family’s iving expenses. Because his motorcycle is old, Ros S. cannot attract many customers, so now he is asking for a loan to change his motorcycle. The loan will allow him to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To change his motorcycle

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratha C. (shown in picture on the left with her group members) was selected by members to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are four families including hers. All the group members are living near National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Ratha C., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sokheang Mean, 34, were married in 1997 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are enrolled in local school. Ratha has been opening a laundry shop for two years. Mr. Sokheang has been a mason for ten years. Currently he does his work a bit far from home, so Ratha is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

2-Mrs. Sreynon P. and her husband, Mr. Sopheak Phan, were married in 2002 and have two sons. Sreynon is in the business of cutting grass to sell for cattle feed, while her husband has been a mason for ten years. Currently he does his work a bit far from home, so Sreynon is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

3-Mrs. Sinoun L. is a divorcee with six children: five sons and one daughter. Two of her sons are Moto-remorque taxi drivers. Her daughter is a garment factory worker and one son is enrolled in local school. Mrs. Sinoun has been in the business of cutting grass to sell for cattle feed for three years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase a new trailer to replace the old one for her son driving Moto-remorque taxi.

4-Mrs. Sreynet P. and her husband, Mr. Saray Saroeun, were married in 2003 and have one daughter. Sreynet is also in the business of cutting grass to sell for cattle feed, while her husband has been a mason for ten years. Currently he does his work a bit far from home so Sreynet is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycles to drive to work

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mr. Sitha S., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Sokvanna Phauk, 34, who live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are enrolled in a local school.

Mr. Sitha has been a hairdresser for eighteen years. He operates his shop in Kor Ky market, while his wife has been selling grocery items for two years. She buys her products from Kor Ky market for resale at her shop in front of the house. The couple is living with their parents and now they are in the process of building their own house but lack some money. So Sitha is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to add to his own money to build their new house.

loans.use: To add to his own money to build a new house

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun K., 60, and her husband, Mr. Poun Tum, 61, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1968 and have six children: five sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home. Two other sons are security guards in Phnom Penh.

Since 1980, Mrs. Yun has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Poun has been a farm guard for eight years.

Yun is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorcycle for her sons to drive to work in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her sons to drive to work

loans.name: Sokky

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokky S., 34, and her husband, Mr. Sok-An Chheng, 44, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One of their children is a silk weaver and two others are in school; the youngest one stays at home.

Since she was fourteen years old, Sokky has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sok-An has been a policeman for twenty years.

Sokky is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mr. Roeun H., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhen Chhoeun, 22, who live along National Road Number Five about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2007 and have one daughter.

Mr. Roeun has been a Moto-Remorque taxi driver for over one year. He carries people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh, while his wife stays at home to take of their small baby who is two months old. The couple is living with their parents and now they are in the process of building their own house but they lack some money. So Roeun is requesting a loan of $200 to add to his own money to build their new house.

loans.use: To add to his own money to build a new house

loans.name: Chinkiry

texts.en:
Mr. Chinkiry M. and his wife, Mrs. Sopheak Mak, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1989 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. All of them are in school.

Mr. Chinkiry has been driving a Moto-Remorque taxi (a motorcycle with a trailer at the back) for eighteen years. He carries people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh City. His wife has been a hairdresser for twelve years. His motorcycle is broken now and needs to be exchanged for a new one but he lacks some money to add to his own for buying a new one. So he is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one for running his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace their old one

loans.name: Sokhum's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhum U. (shown in picture on the right with her group members) was selected by members to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three families including hers. All the group members are living off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Sokhum U., 43, is a widow with one daughter and one son. Her daughter is a garment factory worker and her son is a construction worker. Mrs. Sokhum has been selling vegetables in Ta Khmao market for five years. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase more vegetables so as to expand her business.

2-Mrs. Sochea C., 39, is also a widow with one son and one daughter. Both of them are enrolled in a local school. Her husband died a few months ago. In addition to her children, her parents-in-law also live with her. Sochea has been in the business of cutting grass to sell for cattle feed. Sochea is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 for her mother-in-law who sells Khmer noodles.

3-Mrs. OeU. H. and her husband, Mr. Sophan Ban, were married in 1997 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are enrolled in a local school. OeU. has been in the business of making and selling papaya pickle for ten years, while her husband has been a mason for ten years as well. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale, expand Khmer noodle business, and buy construction materials

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthou N., 27, and his wife, Mrs. Sophois Chin, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 2005 and have one son.

Chanthou has been driving a Moto-Remorque taxi from his village to Phnom Penh for five years. His wife used to be a garment factory worker for seven years but now she has stopped for a while to take care of her little son. Chanthou needs some money to repair his trailer and get a new motorcycle to use for his business. So he is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one and to repair his trailer.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle and repair his trailer

loans.name: Phem

texts.en:
Mr. Phem M., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Savorn Chea, who live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1981 and have five children, four sons and one daughter.

Mr. Phem has been a wooden-house builder since 1981, while his wife has been a garment factory worker since 2006. The couple needs some money to build a restroom for the family's use. So Phem is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to build a restroom for his family.

loans.use: To build a restroom

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-Ol C., 28, and her husband, Mr. Kruy Bun, 39, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have two little daughters.

Since she was thirteen years old, Mrs. Sam-Ol C. has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She taught her husband to be a silk weaver in 2001. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sam-Ol is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Miss Mara C., 32, is single and lives with her elderly parents on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has three sisters who live in the same house; two of them are married and the other one is single and is a silk weaver.

Since she was sixteen years old, Miss Mara has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She and her sister sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mara is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T., 29, is married with five children. She has 3 years of experience in the chips business. She sells to the villagers and the public 2 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 Tala (~$41 USD).

SPBD loans are Mary's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use part of the loan for her children's education fees, school uniforms and lunches, and the remainder to pay the electric, telephone and water bills for her business.

loans.use: Mary would like to pay her children's school fees and for her chips business expenses.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
N. Muhabbat is 47 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Muhabbat is sells shoes for women and kids in the local market. She has been in this business for 3 years. Like any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need and dreams that all of them shall have a higher education.

Because goods such as shoes for women and kids have good demand regardless of the season of the year, Muhabbat's business is stable and generates considerable income, allowing Muhabbat to support her family. Now Muhabbat needs to increase her working capital to be able to purchase summer shoes. For this she requests 1000 USD for the term of 12 months. Muhabbat thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be timely in her loan payments.

loans.use: Increase working capital to purchase new shoes

loans.name: Chhoet

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoet C. is a rice farmer and his wife cooks and sells Cambodian cakes. Their combined income is $3 per day. The couple has three children, one of whom is married. They all live in Toul Vihear Village, Kampong Cham Province.

Mr. C. wants to increase his rice crop and is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to use on his farm. The fertilizer will increase his crop yield, and thereby enable him to sell more crops in the market. The loan will enable him to increase his family income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use on his farm

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Mrs. Um T. is a farmer and she lives with her husband in Toul Khsach Village, Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. T. grows rice on her large plot of farmland and earns about $1.50 per day from this activity. Her husband is a blacksmith and earns about $2.50 per day. T. cares for her family of five children and is responsible for paying for their study expenses.

She is now asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase fertilizer and seed for her farm. The loan will allow her to have enough capital to expand her crop and increase the yield from her farming efforts.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed for her farm

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of M. and they live in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Parveen baji is 4 years younger than her husband. She owns a two room brick house where she has lived for the past 25 years. She is the mother of six children: 2 daughters and four sons. Two of her sons are daily wage laborers. Her first daughter makes embroidered clothes, and the next daughter is enrolled in a local school near her neighborhood. Parveen baji’s husband works in a railway station. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her daughter to expand her decorative embroidery business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Khalida baji, Rukhsana baji and Zareena baji each also want loans for their own decorative embroidery businesses. Parveen baji wants a loan for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina baji is the wife of M. and they live in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Amina baji owns a two room brick house where she has lived with her family for the past 30 years. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her daughters make decoratively embroidered dresses. Her son works in a factory. She successfully completed loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) in the past, and she is now applying for a loan for her daughters to expand their embroidery business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zainab baji wants a loan for her milk shop. Suraiya baji wants a loan for her milk shop also. Hafizan baji wants a loan for her livestock business (buying and reselling animals).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San S., 44, is vegetable seller in the market and earns about $2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Dan Dun, is a fisherman and earns about $1.50 per day. The couple has five children, one of whom is married. One of her other children is a bricklayer, and the other three are in primary school. They all live Rokar Thom Village, Kampong Cham Province.

Because of her interest in growing her business, Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use to transport her vegetables and for her husband to use as a motorcycle taxi. The motorcycle will allow her to run her business more efficiently, and also allow her husband to make more money with an additional job as a motorcycle-taxi driver. The motorcycle can also be used for family purposes.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use to transport her vegetables and for her husband to use as a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Zaid's Group

texts.en:
Zaid baji is the wife of N. A. and they have lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the past 20 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her husband has a livestock business of buying and reselling animals for the sake of profit. She successfully completed loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) in the past, and she is now applying for another loan for her husband’s livestock business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bilquis baji wants a loan for her livestock business as well. Zubaida baji, Irshad baji and Sugran baji each want loans for their decorative embroidery businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is the wife of T. H. and they live in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house, and is the mother of three sons. Her first son works in a factory and her other two sons help their father in his tea shop. She successfully completed loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) in the past. Now she is applying for a loan for her husband’s tea shop business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bani baji wants a loan for her vegetable business. Sakina baji wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business. Shumaila baji wants a loan for her mobile phone repair shop. Nasreen baji wants a loan for her car workshop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of H. A. and they live in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She is the mother of eight children: five sons and two daughters. Her first two sons have a power loom business, and the other three are enrolled in a local school near her neighborhood. Her two daughters make decorative embroidery clothes, and her husband has a wood business. She successfully completed her loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and she is now applying for a loan for her husband’s wood business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Irshad baji wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business. Shakeela baji wants a loan for her meat business. Suraiya baji also wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business. Khalida baji wants a loan for her fruit business.

This is a group loan, and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Hamidan's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan baji is the wife of M. and they live in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. They have lived in this city for the last 16 years. She is the mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Both of her kids are enrolled in a local school near her neighborhood. Hamidan baji’s husband is a construction worker. She sells bangles in different areas, and also is efficient in domestic household work. She also takes care of her children. She successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and now she is applying for a loan to expand her bangle business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nusrat baji wants a loan for her wood business. Rani baji wants a loan for her shoe business.

This is a group loan, and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
Munira O. is married, she has a son and a daughter. She is 32 years old. During the past 10 years Munira has been selling on Fridays in the city and on Sundays in a large market place in Kairakkum. She used to sell small goods such as hair pins, jewelry and children's clothes. Now that she has received a loan from Kiva through Microinvest, she purchased a permanent selling location at a large market near the city. Many large retailers purchase goods there. Munira sells men's clothes and now is the season for summer clothes. In winter, she sells winter clothes for men (sweaters and trousers). Munira paid her previous loans on time and received new loans.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мунира Очилова замужем, имеет сына и дочь, ей 32 года. 10 лет как Мунира выходит на рынок только по пятницам в городе и воскресенье на большой базар в Кайраккуме. Она торговала мелочами: заколки и прочие бижутерии, и небольшой товар с детскими одеждами. Теперь получив кредит от кива в микроинвесте она приобрела постоянную точку в большом рынке не далеко от города, где многие оптовики оптом закупают товар. Её товар мужская одежда, в настоящее время летняя одежда. Зимой она продаёт зимнюю мужскую одежду(джемпер, брюки). Она своевременно погашает кредит и получала новые займы.

loans.use: To grow business by purchasing more goods

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Rustam K. is 31 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife does network marketing for Oriflame. Rustam has a college degree. Together with his brother he began a food retail business. They used to run one location at the market (selling cookies, sugar, bread, etc.). After gaining work experience, Rustam decided to separate his business from his brother. With the money he saved, Rustam rented a store at the market called Panshanbe and began selling drinks and alcoholic products. Producers deliver goods that Rustam carries in his store. Recently, Rustam found out that many businessmen increase their profits by offering a greater variety of goods in their stores through taking out loans. Rustam decided to try taking a loan in order to expand his business. This is why he came to Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Рустам молодой человек в возросте 31 года, женат имеет 2 детей ,жена занимается сетевым маркетингом орифлейм.Сам Рустам окончил высшее учебное заведение. Вместе с братом начал занимается бизнесом торговли продуктами питания .Они торговали на рынке в лорьке(печенье, сахар.,хлеб и.т.д.). Получив опыт работы Рустам решил отделить свой товарооборот от брата,и на свои средства взял в аренду магазин на рынке "Паншанбе" и начал продавать в розницу напитки и виноводочные товары. Товары ему доставляют поставщики с заводов по производству напитков. Рустам недавно узнал от своих друзей что многие бизнесмены увеличивают свой товарооборот при помощи кредитов, и решил тоже попробовать взять кредит на увеличение своего бизнеса. Для чего обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of goods for retail sale

loans.name: Muhsin

texts.ru:
Muhsin H. is married and has three children. His wife works at home. Muhsin trades children’s' and men's clothing and women's shoes. He used to trade only clothes, but now he has two selling locations. The second location is where Muhsin's sales person mostly sells shoes. Muhsin works for an Italian company called Katri that produces fabric for making clothes. However, his salary at Katri is insufficient for supporting his family.

His neighbor recommended that Muhsin apply for a loan at Microinvest in order to expand his business. Now is a season for summer clothes, and Muhsin needs to purchase goods for resale. He hopes to obtain a loan from Kiva via Microinvest in order to expand his business by purchasing seasonal men's and children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мухсинджон Хайдаров женат, имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка. Сам он торгует на рынке детской и мужской одеждой, а также женской обувью. Раньше он торговал только одеждой, теперь у него есть две точки на рынке. Вторая точка состоит в основном из обуви, там сидит продавец. Сам Мухсин работает в ЗАО «Катри» это итальянская фабрика по выпуску материалов для шитья одежды. Но оклад в «Катри » ему недостаточен что бы содержать семью. Его соседка порекомендовала обратиться в Микроинвест, для расширения бизнеса. Так как в настоящий момент сезон летней одежды, и ему необходимо ехать за товаром. Он получит кредит от КИВА в Микроинвесте с целью расширения, приобретения сезонной мужской и детской одежды.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothes for resale

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru:
Marhamat H. has been working with Microinvest for the past 5 years, and has had no problem repaying all of her previous loans. With her last loan Mahramat increased the variety of her goods and, therefore her profits. Mahramat would like to receive a new loan in order to purchase goods for sale next week.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Хакимова Мархамат уже 5 лет как кредитуется в Микроинвесте и без проблемно погашает свои предыдущие кредиты. На последний кредит Мархамат увеличила свой ассортимент товара, а следовательно и прибыль. Мархамат подала заявку на следующий займ чтоб в ближайшую неделю поехать за товаром.

loans.use: To purchase female head dresses for sale

loans.name: Djabrayil

texts.en: Djabrayil was born in 1958. He is married and has 3 children The O.'s family lives in Khachmaz town. He has been in the clothing sales business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. supplies several local businesses with fish and also sells drinks. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Efua and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Gadir

texts.en: Gadir was born in 1959. He is married and has 3 children. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man has been selling agricultural produce in the market for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $750 to buy produce.

loans.use: Buy the agricultural produce

loans.name: Irene Dallo

texts.en:
Irene Dallo is a 38-year-old hard-working lady. She has been in business for the past seven years and has had several businesses in that time. She is currently running a depot that sells Coca-Cola products. She supplies over 30 crates of soda per day.

She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim H. is a villager in Kbal Domrey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a pig breeder and farmer. Since her pig breeding business is going well, Mrs. Kim H. would like to expand it. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Kim H. will use part of the loan to buy pig feed. Her husband, Mr. Aun Khin, is a fisherman. Mrs. Kim H. is a 49-year-old mother of six children, three of whom are employed in different business activities while the remaining three are attending school. Mrs. Kim H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Sinan

texts.en: Mrs. Sinan L. sells second-hand clothes and shoes in Choeung Khnar Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Sinan L.'s current business is the product of a previous loan. Mrs. Sinan L. is a 57-year-old widow without any children and she now lives in an old house with a leaking roof. She is now requesting a loan to buy zinc to replace the old roof.

loans.use: to buy zinc to replace the leaking roof.

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en: Sanan was born in 1978 and is married. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan (Agdam region) and he has settled in Baku city.  He has been in the cafe business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy some necessary things for his cafe.

loans.use: Buy necessary things for his cafe

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Mrs. Chuon S. is a woodman in Kbal Domrey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Nil So, helps his wife with her current business. They have eight children, two of whom are employed while the remaining six are enrolled in school. In order to support her family, Mrs. Chuon S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Previously, Mrs. Chuon S. has obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart to transport her firewood to sell. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Eak

texts.en: Mrs. Eak M. lives in Au Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a Khmer noodle maker and seller. Her husband, Mr. Ang Kim, is a pig breeder in the local village. Since Mr. Ang Kim’s business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Eak M.  has decided to ask for a loan to buy more pigs for her husband’s business, the remaining money she will use to buy pig food. Mrs. Eak M. is 47-years-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for her husband’s business and to buy pig food

loans.name: Maqsutali

texts.ru:
Maqsutali A. lives in Tursun-zoda. Maqsutali is married and has four children. He practices animal husbandry. He has a small farm where he breeds bull calves for sale. He would like to get a loan for buying another bull calf. After raising the calf Maqsutali will be able to sell it at a profit. He plans to repay the loan in the next 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Ашуралиев Максутали проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Женат , имет четверых детей. Занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит бычков для продажи. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одного бычка. После откормки его он сможет его выгодно продать. Погасить кредит Максутали планирует в текчении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf

loans.name: Kimlon

texts.en: Mr. Kimlon N. is a fisherman in Kbal Dorey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Yoeurn Leng, is a pig breeder and farmer. Since demand for piglets has improved, Mr. Kimlon N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets in order to expand his business. Mr. Kimlon N. has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one works at a store that sells ice-cream. The remaining three are studying in state school.Mr. Kimlon N. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more piglets in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Shokir

texts.ru:
Shokir M. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is married and has 6 children. He has technical education and works on a collective farm. Besides he is engaged in agriculture. He grows rice and sells it at the market to wholesale buyers. He uses the profit for his family. Shokir would like to get a loan for buying seeds and fertilizers. He will be able to pay off the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Муродов Шокир житель города Турсун-Заде. Женат , имеет шестерых детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование. Работает в колхозе. Кроме того занимается земледелием. Сеет рис .Урожай продает на базаре оптовым покупателям. Прибыль использует для семьи. Хочет получить кредит и использовать его для покупки семян и удобрений. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng N. is a villager in Kbal Domrey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a Khmer noodle maker and seller. Her husband, Mr. Sovann Pin, is a fisherman and pig breeder (pictured on the left). Mr. Sovann Pin faces a small problem with his pig-breeding business because he does not have enough money to buy pig food. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Eng N., asked for a loan for her husband’s business. Mrs. Eng N. is 53 and the mother of five children, three of whom are fishermen while the remaining two are pig breeders.

loans.use: to buy pig food for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat M. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years old and is married with 5 children. She works in agriculture. Muhabbat grows rice and sells it at the local market. She wants to get a loan for buying rice seeds and fertilizers. She will pay off the loan in the next 12 months. Her business helps provide her family with rice. She also makes profit by selling rice, which allows her to buy other food products. By the way, rice from Tursun-zoda is considered the best.

Translated by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Мирзоева Мухаббат - жительница города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 51 год . Замужем и имеет 5 детей. Занимается земледелием. Сеет рис. Полученный урожай продает на базаре. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена риса и удобрения. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев. Ее бизнес помогает обеспечить семью рисом, а так же прибыль от реализованного риса. Это дает возможность запастись другими видами продуктов. Кроме того, рис, который выращивают в городе Турсун-заде, считается лучшими сортами риса.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim E. owns a grocery store in Au Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She has borrowed from AMK before and used the money to start her current business. Since her business has improved, Mrs. Kim E. would like to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Kim E. decided to ask for a loan to purchase grocery goods for her customers. Mrs. Kim E. is a 43-year-old widow with three children, all of whom are attending school.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Abdujalil Q. and his family live in Tursun-zoda. Abdujalil is 36 years old and is married with 4 children. He works on a collective farm and is involved in agriculture. He has been growing rice for ten years. He needs a loan of 3500 somoni for buying seeds and fertilizers. He plans to pay off the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Курбонов Абдуджалил - житель города Турсун-Заде. Живет со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Возраст 36 лет. Работает в колхозе , а так же занимается земледелием. У же 10 лет занимается посевом риса. Сейчас хочет купить семена и удобрения для посева. Для этого необходимо получить кредит в размере 3500 сомони, сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Yukea

texts.en: Mr. Yukea P. lives in Trapaing Pouv Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and works as a fisherman. Mr. Yukea P.’s boat has a leak and cannot be repaired, meaning that he cannot gather any fish to support his family. Thus, Mr. Yukea P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat and bamboo to make fishing equipment. His wife, Mrs. Nimul Lanh, is a Khmer cake maker and seller. Mr. Yukea P. is 21 and the father of two children, both of whom are too young to work or attend school. Mr. Yukea P. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a new boat and bamboo to make fishing equipment.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Mrs. Khon V. is a housewife in Andoung Russey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her family is currently grieving because Mrs. Khon V.’s mother has just died. Unfortunately, Mrs. Khon V. does not have enough money to provide a funeral for her mother. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to deal with this problem. Mrs. Khon V. is 46 and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other one is a firewood seller.

loans.use: to provide a funeral for her mother

loans.name: Ikrom.

texts.ru:
Ikrom N. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is married and has 5 children, and he is 42 years old. Ikrom works at a gas station. Except for that he also is engaged in agriculture. He owns a piece of land on which he sows rice. Therefore he wants to receive a loan so that he can buy more seeds and fertilizer, because it is the time to plant crops. To achieve this he needs to receive a loan of 1,025 dollars and he plans to repay the loan within 18 months. Ikrom is a very hardworking and cheerful person.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Назаров Икром проживает в городе Турсун- заде. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Возраст 42 года. Работает на заправке. Кроме того занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает рисом. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения, так как пришло время посева. Для этого необходимо получить 3500 сомони , сроком на 18 месяцев.Икром очень трудолюбивый и веселый человек.

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Chamrein

texts.en: Mrs. Chamrein C. lives in Au Kandal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, working as a fertilizer seller. Her business is doing well, and she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer. Mrs. Khon Vann is a year old widow with three children, one of whom is working at the Laos Embassy, while the others are still attending school.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to re-sell.

loans.name: Tagoimurod.

texts.ru:
Tagoimurod D. lives in the area of Shahrinav. He is married and has 5 children. He has a higher education and works as a assistant manager in a private organization. In parallel he is also engaged in the trade of food and goods. He has been engaged in this type of business for 16 years. His shop is located next to his home. He wants to receive a loan so that he could increase his commodity circulation, he plans to pay back the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатов Тагоймурод проживает в районе Шахринау. Женат и имеет пятерых детей.Имеет высшее образование . Работает экономичтом в частной организации. Параллельно он занимается торговлей продуктов питания и хоз товарами.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 16 лет. Торговая точка находится рядом с домом. Хочет получить кредит для того . чтобы увеличить товарооборот сроком на 15 месяцев

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Juramurod.

texts.ru:
Juramurod D. is a citizen of the Shahrinav area. He lives with his family, is married and has 4 children. He works as a veterinarian, but also is engaged in a small business. In his home he has opened a small shop where he trades food and economic goods. He has been engaged in this kind of business for 14 years. Currently he wishes to increase his assortment by increasing his commodity circulation. However this can only be achieved by receiving a loan, and that is why he has asked Kiva for help. He wants to receive a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni and plans to repay the loan within 15 months. He lives in a secluded area, therefore by increasing his business he can help the people of his region.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатов Джурамурод житель района Шахринау. Живет со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет четверых детей.Работает ветеринаром . Кроме того занимается мелким бизнесом. У себя дома открыл небольшой магазин , где торгует продуктами питания , а так же хозяйственными товарами. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 14 лет. Сейчас в данный момент хочет увеличить ассортимет путем увеличения товарооборота. А это возможно лишь путем получения кредита. Поэтому он обратился к нам за помощью. Хочет получить кредит в размере 2500 сомони сроком на 15 месяцев. Он живет в отдаленном месте , поэтому развитие бизнеса может помочь и населению его кишлака.

loans.use: Increase commodity-circulation

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en:
Zinaida K. is married with grown children. Her family lives in Kahovka. Zinaida offers medical services. She owns a medical clinic and invests much time in development of her business. Zinaida is a professional doctor. She is very attentive to all her patients. Zinaida's business has been growing since she started this practice 4 years ago. Currently her turnover capital is about $2000. Her monthly net profit amounts to $400.

Zinaida is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to develop her business and profits as a result. She is hoping to reconstruct her office and make it a more convenient place for patients who come in. She believes better quality of service will help her increase her clientele, too. Current financial assistance will be beneficial for Zinaida's business by keeping it competitive and promoting growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for her and the family.

This is a short-term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Remodel her medical office

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is a widow. She runs a small business selling clothing in the local market in Novaya Kahovka. Raisa lost her husband and had to find ways to support herself and her children. She started this business about 20 years ago. Her small venture has grown a lot since then. Presently, her turnover capital is over $2000. Monthly net profit is about $300.

Raisa would like to get a loan of 5000 Grivnas to increase available products in her kiosks. She would like to buy more clothing items for this sunny summer season. We believe her hard work, natural friendliness, good customer service and self-discipline will help Raisa use the funds received wisely and repay her loan in time.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married with two sons. He sells different household items and motorcycle parts. His business is located in a very favorable location and he offers nice selection of versatile inventory; e.g. household items, office supplies and bike and motorocycle parts. Gennadyi has been in this business for 10 years. He has about $7000 invested in inventory. His turnover capital is about $5000.

Gennadyi has been in the market for a while. He knows the trends and dynamics of this sphere of commerce. He has just finished construction of a new vending facility in the market where he owns his trade. His business is characterized by stable growth and consistent expansion. Today Gennadyi is hoping to get a 3500 Grivna loan to purchase seasonal inventory for summer. Additional funds will help him increase assorted merchandise without withdrawing this money from the family budget.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two children. She runs a business selling clothing and shoes in a spacious kiosk located at the busy central market. Galina has been in business for 16 years. Presently, she has about $5,000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $2000.

Galina is constantly looking for new ideas and products that would make her business more profitable, and she is consistently growing and developing as an entrepreneur. She values every customer and tries to do her best to meet their needs. Galina has gained a reputation as a committed and responsible market vendor among her clients. She has promptly repaid all loans that she has received from "Nadiya Ukraine". Galina would like to receive a loan for 2000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal clothing for the summer season. She is planning to purchase clothing in bulk so she will have plenty to attract new customers. Galina is an experienced bookkeeper. She knows all the tricks of this business and works hard to earn more profit so that she can provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase seasonal assortment of inventory

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is a member of the Yana Ñahui Village Bank (meaning Black Eyes in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Ernestina is separated; she is 65 years old and the mother of seven children. Ernestina sells sweets at a stand in a market in Carmen Alto, a business which she started five years ago. Additionally, she sells plastic goods brought from Lima in another stand at the Carmen Alto market, managed by her son.

Ernestina needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($725 USD) to invest in more buckets, tubs, plates, bags and different candies to further expand her business.

Ernestina´s dream is to develop her business, have another post, buy land and construct a house.

loans.use: Ernestina needs a loan to invest in more buckets, tubs, plates, bags and different candies to further expand her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Yana Ñahui Village Bank (meaning Black Eyes in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Cristina is a 56-year-old mother of eleven children. Cristina has a restaurant in the district of San Juan Bautista in a rented location near the city. Cristina prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner; her usual customers are city workers. Furthermore, on Sundays Cristina travels to the regional markets where she buys pigs and lambs, which she sells in local markets and to her neighbors.

Cristina needs a loan of 2500 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($900 USD) to invest in more cattle, goats, pigs, cheese and hens.

Cristina´s dream is to improve her business and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Cristina needs a loan to invest in more cattle, goats, pigs, cheese and hens.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Yana Ñahui Village Bank (meaning Black Eyes in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Paulina is a married 55-year-old mother of eight children. Paulina has a stand in a market in the district of Carmen Alto where she sells groceries. Paulina also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and rabbits in her home and sells them to middlemen.

Paulina needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($725 USD) that she will invest in rice, sugar, oil, noodles and milk.

Paulina´s dream is to improve her business, have a store in her home and that her children will be established economically.

loans.use: Paulina needs a loan that she will invest in rice, sugar, oil, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Vilma And Lidia Group

texts.en:
Vilma and Lidia are members of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Queachua, the native language of Peru).

Vilma is a married 67-year-old mother of eight children. Vilma sells hats and blankets for carrying bundles or infants in the city of Ica on a weekly basis. Vilma also sells traditional food in the city of Ica, such as chicharrones (fried pork) and other dishes.

Lidia is a married 36-year-old mother of three children. Lida acquires cheese on a weekly basis in the community of Alpachaca and sells the cheese door to door.

Vilma and Lidia need respective loans of 1000 soles ($360 USD) and 600 soles ($215 USD) to invest in more cheese, blankets and hats.

Vilma and Lidia´s dreams are to have a large store in the city of Ica, construct their own houses and have a grain mill.

loans.use: Vilma and Lidia need loans to invest in more cheese, blankets and hats.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Forutnata is a married 55-year-old mother of five children. Fortunata travels to different regional fairs where she sells wool, brooms, cleaning tools, combs, and flashlights, among other goods. Furthermore, Fortunata buys avocados and oranges at the regional fairs and sells them to middlemen in the city of Ayacucho.

Fortunata needs a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($575 USD) that she will invest in more wool, avocados, batteries, creams, and soaps to further expand her business.

Fortunata dreams to improve her business, improve her home and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Fortunata needs a loan that she will invest in more wool, avocados, batteries, creams, and soaps to further expand her business.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.en:
Betsy is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Golden Heart in Queachua, the native language of Peru).

Betsy is a married 26-year-old mother of two children. Betsy is an accountant. She also owns a printing house with her husband on the main street of the city of Ayacucho, where they provide all types of printing services with the help of several employees. Furthermore, her husband harvests root crops on their land that is five hours away from Ayacucho.

Betsy needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($725 USD) that she will invest in paper, ink and pieces for her printing machines to further expand her business.

loans.use: Betsy needs a loan that she will invest in paper, ink and pieces for her printing machines to further expand her business.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Carmen is a married 25-year-old mother of one daughter. Carmen and her husband raise and sell guinea pigs on her sister´s land in the city of Huanta, a business they have had for one year. Furthermore, Carmen works in her sister´s flower shop where she arranges flowers.

Carmen needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($375 USD) to invest in more guinea pigs.

Carmen’s dream is to have her own flower shop, have more space for her guinea pigs, and that her daughter becomes a professional.

loans.use: Carmen needs a loan to invest in more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Florentina is a married 53-year-old mother of four children. Florentina and her husband, a medical technologist, have a clinical analysis lab in a rented location. They have two other locations where they collect their samples and have other organizations help distribute their work. Florentina has recently taken over the administration of the three locations. Furthermore, Florentina on some occasions prepares cakes and sweets to order for her clients.

Florentina needs a loan of 3000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($1075 USD) to invest in chemical reagents.

Florentina’s dream is to proviD. an economically established environment for her children, that her children obtain professional jobs and that she will eventually be able to relax and learn more about Peru with her husband.

loans.use: Florentina needs a loan to invest in chemical reagents.

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.en:
Ana Antonia is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Ana Antonia is a married 28-year-old mother of two children. Ana Antonia makes biscochos and chapla (tradional bread of the region) using her mother´s oven and the help of her brothers and sisters. They sell their bread by cart in the Santa Clara market in the afternoons. Furthermore, Ana Antonia sells food and cake by special order to her clients. Ana Antonia has a current project to buy materials and build her house.

Ana Antonia needs a loan of 1200 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($450 USD) that she will invest in part to pay for her housing construction.

Ana Antonia´s dream is to have her own bread shop, learn more about breadmaking, and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: Ana Antonia needs a loan that she will invest in part to pay for her housing construction.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz started her business because she wanted to help her husband with the family’s expenses, and because she wanted to invest in something that would help support the family. She started her business about six years ago, at her mother’s invitation, given that she also sold clothing and was motivated to locate herself in the markets of the area. When her husband doesn’t have trips or charters he helps her to get situated on weekends, and the rest of the days she sells outside of the home.

She needs a loan of $600 USD, to be repaid over a period of six months, to buy two packs of clothing that she is going to stock up on in the United States. With your help, Luz will be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz inició el negocio porque queria ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia y ella queria invertir en algo que le ayudara a solventar los gasos familiares. Comenzó su negocio hace aproximadamente 6 años por invitacion de su mama ya que ella tambien vende ropa la animo a ponerse en los mercados de la localidad ya que cuando su esposo no tiene viajes o fletes que entregar solo cobra el minimo, pero el le ayuda en la colocacion del puesto los fines de semana los demas dias ella vende afuera de su casa.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar 2 pacas de ropa ya que ella va a surtirse a Estados Unidos. con tu ayuda Luz hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana started her business because she needed income to help her husband pay for her son’s education, given that she wanted to help her family get ahead and give them a better standard of living. She started seven years ago selling used clothing from her house. Little by little, the business grew and she currently sells her wares at the local markets and only rarely now from her home.

She needs a loan of $400 USD, to be repaid in five months, to buy a pack of clothes to sell given she has a very low inventory. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana inició el negocio por que necesitaba un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo a pagar los estudios de su hijoya que ella deseaba sacar adelante a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida. Comenzó hace 7 años vendiendo ropa usada en su domicilio, hast que poco a poco fue creciendo y actualmente vende en mercados rodantes y solo en ocaciones en su domicilio.

Ella necesita un credito por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar una paca de ropa para vender ya que tiene muy poco en inventario. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro lives in the Villa Tunari zone of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 12 and 11 respectively, in the home of his in-laws who find themselves in the interior part of the country. He dedicates himself to selling fruits at his stand in the market of La Paz. The loan would be designated to purchase more merchandise such as oranges, tangerines, bananas, etc., all seasonal fruits that are in much demand. In this manner, he hopes to improve his income. It is his first loan through IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted indicates he qualifies to receive the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Leandro vive en la calle Jose Vicente Ochoa de la zona Villa Tunari de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 12 y 11 años respectivamente en la casa de sus parientes, los cuales se encuentran en el interior del país. Se dedica a la venta de frutas en su puesto callejero un mercado de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de más mercadería, como naranjas, mandarinas, plátanos, etc. todos son frutas de la estación, que tienen mucha demanda. Así espera mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase greater quantities of fruit (oranges, tangerines, bananas) to sell at his stand.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena started her business to get ahead, since her husband’s earnings were not enough to meet the family’s living expenses given that his work is not steady. She saw a need to do something on her own, so she started her business three years ago. At first, she only sold baby clothing on order and gave small presentations for friends and neighbors or sold her goods door-to-door. She was always looking for a way to generate sales and, thanks to this, she has gotten ahead.

She needs a loan of $300 USD, which she’ll repay in four months, to buy merchandise so she can make more presentations. Also, the wait time for her customers’ orders to be filled will be shorter.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena inició el negocio para salir adelante por por nececidad dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos familiares, ya que su esposo no tenia un trabajo fijo, entonces ella se vio en la necesidad de salir adelante por si misma y emprendio su negocio hace 3 años, primero solo vendia ropa para bebe, sobre pedidos y realizaba pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas o bien vendia casa por casa, ella siempre estaba buscando la manera de generar ventas y gracias a esto ha salido adelente.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancia y asi podra realizar demostraciones, ademas el tiempo de espera para un pedido sera menor para sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena inició el negocio para salir adelante por por necesidad dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos familiares, ya que su esposo no tenia un trabajo fijo, entonces ella se vio en la necesidad de salir adelante por si misma y emprendio su negocio hace 3 años, primero solo vendia ropa para bebe, sobre pedidos y realizaba pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas o bien vendia casa por casa, ella siempre estaba buscando la manera de generar ventas y gracias a esto ha salido adelente.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancia y asi podra realizar demostraciones, ademas el tiempo de espera para un pedido sera menor para sus clientes.

loans.use: comprar mercancia

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines lives on Arani Street in the Luis Espinal zone of the city of El Alto. She lives with her 2-year old daughter in the home of her mother because she is separated from her husband. She dedicates herself to selling toys from a stand near the mayor’s office. She plans to invest her loan into the purchase of more toys, for which she indicates there is great demand. By increasing her inventory, she hopes to improve her income. It is her first loan through IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted indicates she qualifies to receive the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ines, vive en la calle Arani de la zona Luis Espinal de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su pequeña hija de 2 años en la casa de su madre, en vista de que por razones familiares se separo de su esposo Se dedica al comercio de juguetes en un puesto callejero en alrededores de la Alcaldía de la ciudad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de más juguetes, para los cuales ella indica qaue existe mucha demanda y así mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of more toys, which is the product she sells.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel lives on “P” Street in the Belen zone of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and three children. He dedicates himself to making lined jackets and sweaters, particularly for the cold, which he sells in the city of Oruro. The loan would be for the purchase of fabric at wholesale, the lower price helping him to improve his income. This is his first loan through IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted indicates he qualifies to receive the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Daniel vive en la calle “P” de la zona Belen de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. Se dedica a la confección de chamarras y chalecos de tela con frisa, especiales para el frío, los cuales los vende en la ciudad de Oruro. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de telas por mayor, pues los costos disminuyen y así Daniel puede mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase fabric at wholesale for his business making special jackets and sweaters for the cold.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is a member of the Sonrisa Village Bank.

Nelida is a 41-year-old mother of two children. Nelida and her husband sell CDs, DVDs and toys in her home situated in front of the Santa Clara market. Nelida has a stand in the “April 12” market where she sells men's polo shirts, goods that she acquires from the city of Lima.

Nelida needs a loan of 1600 Peruvain Nuevo Soles ($575 USD) to invest in DVDs and CDs to further expand her business.

Nelida´s dream is that her business will grow and she can buy and furnish a home.

loans.use: Nelida needs a loan to invest in DVDs and CDs to further expand her business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa lives her parents' home in the San Roque area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband, who is a public transportation driver. Jesusa is dedicate to selling consumer products such as bread, candy, beverages, soap, oils, etc., at her convenience store that she rents out at a highway stop. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a wider variety of merchandise to diversify her selections. This is her first loan with Kiva partner Impro, and her background makes her a good candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Jesusa vive en la calle San Miguel de Italaque de la zona San Roque de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo el cual es chofer de transporte público. Desusa se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo, como ser pan, dulces, refrescos, jabón, aceites, etc., en una tienda que posee en alquiler ubicada en la parada de transito de vehículos interprovinciales. El crédito lo destinará a la compra de más variedad de mercaderías y así diversificar sus productos a la venta. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of merchandise to offer customers at her convenience store / compra de más variedad de mercaderías para ofrecer al público en su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Sonrisa Village Bank.

Olga is a 30-year-old mother of two children. Olga sells chickens in a rented location that is located in front of a grocery store in the city of Ayacucho. She acquires her chickens at different hen houses in the city and sells the chickens from six in the morning until one in the afternoon.
