Olga needs a loan of 1200 Peruvain Nuevo Soles ($450 USD) to invest in eggs to expand her business.

Olga´s dream is to expand her business, build a home, and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: Olga needs a loan to invest in eggs to expand her business.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel lives with wife and one of his younger children in the Villa Dolores area of the city of El Alto. He is a carpenter and dedicates himself to building wooden doors and windows for homes by contract. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase wood for a large contract he was able to get but left him without enough extra income upfront for all the materials. This is his 13th loan overall and second through Kiva, and he has always fulfilled his obligations in the past. He has been a client of Kiva partner IMPRO since 1998.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Ángel vive en la calle F Vezga de la zona Villa Dolores de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y uno de sus hijos menores.. El es carpintero y se dedica a la construcción de puertas y ventanas de madera mediante contratos con constructores de casas. El crédito lo destinará a la compra madera para la realización de un contrato grande que pudo conseguir, el cual le dejará unos ingresos extras. Es el treceavo crédito en Impro y el segundo mediante KIVA, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 1998.

loans.use: Purchase wood to make doors and windows for a large contract / Compra de madera para elaboración de puertas y ventanas para un contrato grande que pudo conseguir.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a merchant and dedicates herself to selling masitas (small sweet breads and pastries). She has two children, and her home is in the Irpavi II area of La Paz. Her job is to buy masitas from local bakeries and sell them retail at her post. This is the second loan she has requested, and her history categorizes her as a good client who fulfills her obligations. This loan will be used to purchase larger quantities of masitas, because demand for her products has grown considerably. This will increase her income and help her improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Rosa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de masitas (son pequeños panes dulces y pasteles); tiene dos hijos a quienes mantiene. Su actividad economica es comprar masitas de los hornos y venderlas en su puesto al detalle Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir como cliente bueno en el pago de su obligación. El crédito será destinado para la compra de mayor cantidad de masitas, en vista de que la demanda ha aumentado considerablemente. El crédito le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que aumentará sus ingresos en sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of sweet bread and other pastries to sell / Compra de mayor cantidad de pequeños pan dulce y otros pasteles para su negocio de venta de los mismos.

loans.name: Magali

texts.en:
Magali is a member of the Sonrisa Village Bank.

Magali is a 30-year-old mother of two children. Magali has a restaurant on Venezuela Street in a rented location. With the help of her husband, she sells breakfast, lunch, and beverages. Magali has land near a park which she plans to make into a recreation area.

Magali needs a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($575 USD) to invest in materials to build the recreation area.

Magali´s dream is to have her own house and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Magali needs a loan to invest in materials to build a recreation area.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Sonrisa Village Bank.

Maritza is a single 29-year-old mother of one son. Maritza works at a jewelry store that sells rings, necklaces, and earrings, located in the artisan markets of the city. With her brothers, sisters, and father she makes altarpieces (artisan work in traditional drawers of wood) that she sells at the same store.

Maritza needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($725 USD) to invest in wire, flint, thread, triplay, plaster, rubber and paint to further expand her business.

Maritza´s dream is to improve her business, build a home and move forward for her son.

loans.use: Maritza needs a loan to invest in wire, flint, thread, triplay, plaster, rubber and paint to further expand her business.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the Sonrisa Village Bank.

Genveva is a 48-year-old mother of three children. Genoveva has a restaurant on “January 26” Avenue in a rented location with three employees. Additionally, she runs a boarding house where she sells Creole buffets on the weekends. Genoveva also has stands in the local market.

Genoveva needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($375 USD) to invest in rice, sugar, oil and noodles.

Genoveva´s dream is to expand her business, have a business with display cases and obtain her own land.

loans.use: Genoveva needs a loan to invest in rice, sugar, oil and noodles.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo is a chauffer and his wife is a merchant. They have four school-age children. His job as a minibus driver helps him earn income and give his children access to education and adequate nourishment, since his wife does not earn enough on her own. Adolfo and his family live in an apartment in the Lomas Ladera area on the West side of La Paz. It is an urban area with only water and electric services. It lacks a sewer system since it is a very impoverished area.

This is the second loan Adolfo has requested, and his history categorizes him as a client who fulfills his obligations. This loan will be used to purchase a motor and to fully overhaul his minibus because it is currently in poor condition and runs the risk of breaking down at any moment, in which case he would lose out on the income for the days it would take to fix it. If he buys a motor, then the maintenance and repairs will only take no more than two days.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Adolfo es chofer y su esposa es comerciante, tienen cuatro hijos en edad escolar. Su actividad económica como chofer de microbus le ayuda para poder tener ingresos y así tener la accesibilidad de educación y una alimentación adecuada para su familia ya que su esposa no tiene los ingresos suficientes como comerciante minorista. La familia de Adolfo vive en anticrético en la zona de las lomas ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La paz; es una zona peri urbana que solo cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, careciendo de alcantarillado ya que la zona es de alta pobreza. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro su historial lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El crédito será destinado en la compra de motor y un mantenimiento completo de su microbus ya que actualmente se encuentra en malas condiciones y corre el riesgo de que se descomponga en cualquier momento y pierda los ingresos por los días que pare para los arreglos correspondientes. Si compra el motor, entonces el mantenimiento y cambio de motor solo durará no más de dos días.

loans.use: Purchase a motor and make repairs on minibus  / Compra de un motor y gastos de mantenimiento de su microbus se servicio de transporte público.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is dedicated to making bread and empanadas. She rents a public oven to bake her products. She works alongside her children. She has three total, and two are school-age; her husband passed away. Her home, which she also rents, is in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of La Paz and has five rooms. This is her first time she has requested a loan, and she needs the support of Kiva. The loan will be used to purchase ingredients (flour, sugar, lard, etc.) at wholesale so she is able to reduce her costs and increase her income. This will help her improve her quality of life and provide for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Martha se dedica a la elaboración de pan y empanadas; ella alquila un horno público para hornear su producto. Ella trabaja junto a sus hijos, no tiene esposo ya que falleció. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, donde ocupa 5 cuartos y también vive en alquiler. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y requiere el apoyo de Kiva. El crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos al por mayor (Harina, azúcar, manteca, etc.) y poder reducir sus costos y aumentar sus ingresos, esto le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de Vida y subsistencia de sus hijos ya que cuenta con tres hijos de los cuales dos están en edad escolar.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients (flour, sugar, lard, etc.) to make bread and empanadas / Compra de insumos al por mayor ( harina, azucar, manteca) para su negocio de elaboración de pan y empanadas.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es:
Johnny lives in his parents' home in the Villa Nueva Potosí area of La Paz. He earns a living making chompas, which are traditional sweaters. He is 34 years old and works alone, and is able to afford necessities from his business. He's requesting a loan to purchase a mechanical loom, which will help him produce higher-quality products and thus be able to reach a larger market. This is his first loan, but his background qualifies him as a good candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El señor Johnny vive en casa de sus padres en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la confección de chompas. Johnny tiene 34 año de edad esta soltero con esta actividad él mantiene sus necesidades de subsistencia tanto de alimentación y ropa. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una maquina vaporizadora con la cual podrá dar mayor calidad a las chompas que elabora y así poder alcanzar un mercado mas amplio. No tiene crédito con nosotros es nuevo pero el análisis socio-financiero lo califica para obtener un crédito.

loans.use: Purchase a mechanical loom to produce higher-quality chompas (traditional sweaters) / Compra de una máquina vaporizadora para dar mayor calidad a su negocio de confección de chompas.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco lives on Guaqui street, in the 16 of July zone of El Alto. He is separated from his wife and lives with his parents. He is a men's shoe and boot-maker. He works from a small workshop in his home and sells his wares at the Fair Markets in El Alto.

This loan will be used to purchase leather and rubber bases so he can continue with his work. Francisco indicates that his business is in great demand and as a result he needs more material in order to increase his production. This is his sixth loan with Impro, through Kiva, who approved him for the loan. He has been a client since 2004.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco vive en la calle Guaqui de la zona 16 de Julio en la ciudad de El Alto. El está separado de su esposa, vive en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la elaboración de zapatos y botas para hombres, en su pequeño taller ubicado en su domicilio, los cuales los vende en la feria de la misma zona. El crédito lo destinará a la compra de cuero y plantas de goma para continuar realizando su trabajo. Francisco indica que su negocio tiene una buena demanda y por eso necesitar comprar más material para poder incrementar su producción. Es el sexto crédito en Impro y el segundo mediante KIVA, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2004.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of leather and rubber bases for his men's shoe and boot-making business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, like many Bolivian women, works as a carpenter in a furniture business part-time and also works as a vendor in the various popular fairs held in El Alto. Both activities constitute her primary source of income with which she provides for her 12 year old son. She lives in the Villa Tunara zone of El Alto.

The loan requested will be used as a supplement to the money she has saved to purchase land in the lower zone to build her own home, since she actually lives with her parents. This is her first loan with Impro, who determined through an evaluation, that Marina qualified for loan approval. Her yearning to overcome is deserving of the help she needs so that her dream of having her own home can become a reality.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Marina, como mucha mujeres bolivianas, trabaja en una empresa de muebles como carpintero medio día y también trabaja como comerciante en las diferentes ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto. Ambas actividades constituyen su principal fuente de ingreso con los que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo de 12 años; vive en la Zona Villa Tunara de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinará a completar el dinero que le falta para la compra de un terreno y en lo posterior contar con casa propia, ya que actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado. Sus ansias de superación merecen la ayuda necesaria para que su sueño de tener casa propia se haga realidad.

loans.use: Purchase of land to realize her dream of having her own home.

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr:
Anna D. has been a member of the Sokhayi village bank for 6 years. She would like a loan to strengthen her business which consists of buying and selling seasonal fruits which she then uses to produce juices and jams to be resold. This loan will be repaid in one single installment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Anna D. est membre du Banc villageois de Sokhayi depuis 06ans. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce qui consiste à acheter des fruits saisonnier qu’elle va ensuite transformer en jus ou confiture pour la revendre. Ce prêt sera remboursé en une seule échéance au bout de six mois .

loans.use: Processing of fruits into juices and jams for resale

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva is a businesswoman who sells eggs and cooking oil in bulk. She has a store in the Tejar zone of La Paz, her husband is an accounting instructor in the private schools. These activities are their sources of income which help them cover the costs of raising their two small children. The family lives in the Alto Tejar zone of La Paz. The loan requested will be used to increase Elva's merchandise (eggs and cooking oil) in order to generate better income for her family. This is her second loan with Impro, who determined that she qualifies for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Elva es comercializadora al detalle de huevos y aceite comestible a granel; ella tiene su tienda en la Zona Tejar de la Ciudad de La Paz, su esposo es docente de Contabilidad en los Institutos privados. Esas actividades son sus fuentes de ingreso con los que cubren la manutención de sus dos pequeños hijos. La familia vive en la Zona Alto Tejar de la Misma Ciudad. El crédito lo destinará a incrementar su mercadería (huevos y aceite)para de esa forma generar mayor ingresos familiares. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Elva.

loans.use: Purchase of larger quantities of eggs and cooking oil in bulk, which are products that she sells.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is a dairy farmer, selling the milk he produces in the PIL business. His wife sells potatoes and chuño (an indigenous freeze-dried potato product), which she produces on the same farmland. This work constitutes their chief source of income, which covers the costs of supporting their five children who are school-aged.

They live in the Chahuira Pampa community-Achacachi (three and a half hours from the city of La Paz). The loan will be used to purchase a better breed of dairy cow in order to increase the production of milk. By doing this, they plan to improve their income, which often lacks what they need. This is his first loan with Impro, their evaluation determined that Edgar qualified for approval of the loan he is requesting.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Edgar, es productor de leche de vaca la misma que comercializa en la empresa PIL; la esposa es comerciante de papa y chuño, productos que ellos mismos producen en su tierra. Así logran su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubren la manutención de sus cinco hijos que están en edad escolar. Vive en la Comunidad de Chahuira Pampa - Achacachi (A tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. De esta forma planean mejorar sus ingresos que tanta falta les hacen. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del prestamos solicitado por Edgar.

loans.use: Purchase of a better breed of dairy cow to improve his production of milk.

loans.name: Fatou Léna

texts.fr:
Fatou Léna D. has been a member of the Sokhayi village bank for 5 years. She hopes to acquire a loan that will allow her to purchase and resell palm oil and shrimps. She plans to repay the loan in six months and in one single installment.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Fatou Léna D. est membre du Banc villageois de Sokhayi depuis 05ans. Elle souhaite acquérir un prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter et de revendre de l’huile de palme et des crevettes. Elle compte faire le remboursement au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: The sale of palm oil and shrimp

loans.name: Meri Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ms. Meri del Pilar is a 31-year-old woman who has been selling sweets as a street vender for several years. She has 3 children, who are her motivation to work on a daily basis. She would like to see them become professionals in the near future. Her partner, Edgar, lovingly supports all the decisions she makes. Meri del Pilar would like to increase her candy sales and one day sell candy wholesale so that she can earn a better living, which is why she needs a loan to purchase merchandise and make home improvements. Support Ms. Meri del Pilar because she is a hardworking and honorable person who promises not to disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Meri del Pilar tiene 31 años y se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria hace ya varios años, ella tiene 3 hijos que son el motivo de su trabajo diario, desea verlos en un futuro cercano profesionales. Su pareja, Edgar, la apoya cariñosamente en las decisiones que toma. Meri del Pilar quiere crecer con la venta de golosinas, y más adelante desea hacerlo al por mayor y desde luego tener un ingreso económico mejor al actual, es por ello que necesita del préstamo que solicita para la compra de nueva mercadería y a su vez mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Apoya a la señora Meri del Pilar, ella es trabajadora y honorable, promete que no te defraudará.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia has a store where she sells general goods (good like, bread, sugar, soda, sweets, etc.) located in the Ex Tranca of Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. Her husband does not have a stable job, only working occasionally as a driver or a bricklayer. They have three children of 16 years, 8 years, and 6 years of age. Their home is located in the Yunguyo zone of El Alto.

This loan will be used to purchase concrete (cement and sand that they mix themselves) to renovate their home, which is in bad shape and needs urgent repairs. This is her second loan with Kiva, the good history of repayment allowed her to be approved for the new loan that she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Eugenia tiene un puesto de venta de abarrotes (tienda donde vende pan, azucar, refrescos, dulces, etc) ubicado en la Ex tranca de Rió Seco en la Ciudad de El Alto, el esposo no tiene un trabajo seguro solo realiza labores eventuales como chofer o albañil; tiene tres hijos de 16, 8 y 6 años de edad su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Yunguyo de la Misma Ciudad. El crédito lo destinara a la compra de cemento y arena para refaccionar su vivienda, la cual está en malas condiciones y necesita urgentemente los arreglos. Es el segundo crédito con Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta para la aprobación del nuevo préstamo que está solicitando Maria Eugenia.

loans.use: Purchase of concrete (cement and sand) to repair her home.

loans.name: Donatilde

texts.es:
Donatilde sells basic foodstuff in her small general store for a living. She is 34 years of age and has 4 children. Nothing is impossible for Donatilde because she is an extremely active woman who is good-humored with her children and customers. Her partner, Mr. Teodulo, supports all of her decisions and lends a helping hand with the business. Donatilde is full of desire for success and self-improvement. She tries her best to do everything she can for her children, who will grow up to be decent men and women in the future. Aside from her general store, she also looks after children for a living. She has been designated as a mother caretaker for wawa wasi (a daycare center for the children of low-income, working mothers). She needs capital in order to expand her general store. She would also like to improve her house’s condition so that she can take better care of the children, thus obtaining her goals little by little. She turns to you for a loan, promising to repay it in a timely manner and with a grateful heart.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Donatilde se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su pequeña bodega, ella tiene 34 años y 4 hijos. Para Donatilde no existe nada imposible ya que es una mujer súper activa y sobre todo jovial con sus hijos y clientes. Su pareja, el señor Teodulo, la apoya en todas sus decisiones y brinda su ayuda dándole la mano en su negocio. Donatilde es una mujer con ganas de superación y deseos de éxito, ella se esmera en todo por sus hijos quienes serán hombres y mujeres de bien en un futuro. Muy aparte de su bodega, se dedica al cuidado de niños, designada coma madre cuidadora de wawa wasi (guardería para los niños de las mamás trabajadoras de escasos recursos) Para ampliar e implementar su bodega requiere de un capital que la ayude, también desea mejorar los ambientes de su vivienda para la atención a sus niños y así poco a poco ir cumpliendo sus metas de superación. Ella recurre a ustedes para que le brinden el préstamo que solicita con la promesa de un pago en la fecha indicada y un corazón agradecido.

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store and improve the conditions of her home, which is used as a daycare center

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, age 45, has two school age children who are her reason to keep struggling to get ahead. She and her husband, Mr. José, work hard for their children, hoping that one day they will become professionals. Doris has been selling groceries and basic need items for a while now. This business is her family’s source of income. Doris intends to expand her business, buy foodstuff, and above all, make some repairs to her house, which is why she turns to you in search of a loan that will help her advance. Thanks to your help, Ms. Doris will be able to obtain her goal very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doris (45 años) tiene 2 hijos que aún están estudiando y son el por qué D. seguir luchando para salir adelante, ella junto a su esposo, el señor José, trabajan muy duro por sus hijos esperando que algún día sean profesionales.Doris se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad desD. hace ya tiempo, este negocio es el que brinda el sustento económico D. su casa e hijos. Doris tiene el propósito D. ampliar su negocio, comprar comestibles y sobre todo mejorar algunas estructuras D. su vivienda, por lo que recurre a ustedes en busca D. un préstamo que pueda ayudarla a surgir. Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Doris logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store and make home repairs

loans.name: Gelilin

texts.es:
Gelilin, age 25, has two children with her partner, Walter. They sell food for a living outside an educational center. They both say that they would do anything for their children, which is why they work hard and dedicate themselves to their business. They want to provide their children with an education so that they can grow up to be decent men in the future. Gelilin wants her business to grow, which is why she decided to request a loan so that she can have a kiosk made that will be more welcoming for her patrons, who come in search of her delicious dishes, such as the traditional tamales, among others. Gelilin knows that at her young age, she has the strength to keep working hard in order to make a better future for herself and her family. Help her!

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Gelilin, de 25 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, junto a su pareja, Walter, se dedican a la venta de comida en las afueras de una Institución Educativa. Ambos dicen que por sus hijos son capaces de todo, es por eso que se esmeran y se dedican totalmente a este oficio, para brindarles una educación y que sean hombres de bien más adelante. Gelilin quiere ver crecer su negocio, por ello que decidió pedir este préstamo para la fabricación de un kiosco que de una mejor acogida a sus clientes, los que vienen en busca de sus deliciosos platos como los tradicionales tamales, y otros. Gelilin sabe que a su corta edad aún tiene fuerza para seguir trabajando duro para forjarse cada día un futuro mejor, para ella y para su familia. Ayúdala.

loans.use: Make a kiosk for food sales

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson works in the Pil Andina factory, bottling milk products, receiving a monthly income with which he helps his parents and siblings with living expenses. He lives in his parents' home on R. Bustamante street, Zone 10 of February, Adela Village, of the city of El Alto.

The credit is destined for the purchase of two embroidery machines, that will be used in making traditional Bolivian blankets. Wilson will work with his parents, who are familiar with this art. This is his first loan with Impro, whose evaluation determined that he qualified for loan approval. In addition, having the initiative to start his own business makes Wilson worthy of all the help he needs.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Wilson trabaja en la fabrica Pil Andina, desempeña el cargo de envasador de productos lácteos, percibe un sueldo mensual con el cual ayuda a su padres y a sus hermanos con los gastos de la casa; vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la calle R. Bustamante en la zona 10 de febrero (Villa Adela) de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinará para la compra de dos maquinas bordadoras, que las empleará para la confección de mantas de cholitas; trabajará junto a sus padres que tienen conocimiento en este rubro. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Wilson. Además, esta iniciativa de querer comenzar su propio negocio es digna de toda la ayuda necesaria.

loans.use: Purchase of two embroidery machines to start his own business making  traditional Bolivian blankets.

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.es:
Ciriaca has a cart and works in the Pil Andina factory, selling her products. She has a monthly salary and is a natural healer. She thus combines her incomes and uses them to support her 12 year-old daughter and adopted 6 year-old daughter. They live in the Villa Bolivar zone of El Alto.

The loan will be used to upkeep her cart: her work equipment and source of income.

This is the fifth Impro loan. Her good loan behavior has allowed her to request another. She has been working with Impro since 2003.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva Volunteer

Ciriaca tiene un carro que trabaja para en la fabrica Pil Andina, comercializando sus productos. Percibe un sueldo mensual; ella también es curandera naturista, de esta manera combina sus ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de su hija de 12 años y una niña que adopto de 6 años; vive en la zona Villa Bolivar de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para el mantenimiento de su carro que es su herramienta de trabajo y su fuente de ingreso.

Es el quinto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2003.

loans.use:
Cost of maintaining her cart for the PIL Andina Milk Plant

Costo de mantenimiento de su carro que trabaja para la Planta Industrializadora de leche PIL Andina.

loans.name: Guida

texts.es:
Ms. Guida Verita, age 41, lives with her two school age children, who support her in everything she does. She is a single-mother who, despite the fact that she has many responsibilities, is very strong and dedicated because she would like for her young children to pursue higher education. She does everything within her abilities to give her children the essentials. For Guida Verita, the most important thing is to see her business grow and in the end own a mini market, in which she can offer many products to her customers. She also sells clothing (cash or credit) in different areas of her zone. For Guida, there is nothing she cannot do, which is why she needs money to invest in her business. Let’s give a helping hand to this diligent mother who eagerly works for her children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Guida Verita de 41 años, vive con sus dos hijos que son estudiantes y son los que la apoyan en todo, ella es madre soltera, a pesar de afrentar muchas responsabilidades es una mujer con mucha fuerza y dedicación, ya que desea que sus menores hijos tengan estudios universitarios, ella les brinda todas las facilidades necesarias que estén en sus posibilidades.Para Guida Verita lo más es importante ver crecer su negocio y a la postre tener un mini market, en el cual pueda brindar muchos beneficios a su clientela, también se dedica a la venta de ropa que lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de su zona a veces al contado y a veces a crédito. Para Guida no hay nada que no se pueda hacer, por eso requiere de una cantidad de dinero para invertirlo en su negocio. Démosle la mano a esta madre que con esfuerzo y ahínco se dedica a trabajar por el futuro de sus hijos.

loans.use: Increase goods for general store

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mariame S., is 54 years old and is divorced with 7 children. She plans to use this loan to strengthen her business of producing and selling artisanal soap in order to improve the lifestyle and health of her family. She plans to repay this loan after six months and in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Mariame S., divorcée et a ayant 07 enfants à sa chargeest agée de 54 ans. Elle compte avec ce prêt renforcer son activité de production et de vente de savon artisanal afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. elle compte rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance .

loans.use: Production and sale of artisanal soap

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben is a taxi driver on the Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88 payroll. With this income he supports his young daughter. He lives with his in-laws in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz.

Currently he does not have his own work equipment, and he is asking for a loan to add to his saving and make his dream to have his own car a reality. He will then be able to work as a car owner and increase his income by 25%.

This is his second Impro loan. His responsibility and on-time payments have allowed him to request another loan; he has paid off his last loan in full.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva Volunteer.

Ruben es chofer asalariado en el sindicato Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88, es su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su pequeña hija; vive en casa de sus suegros ubicada en la Zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

En este momento no cuenta con una herramienta de trabajo propia, entonces el crédito lo destinará para completar al dinero que tiene ahorrado y hacer realidad su sueño de contar con su propia movilidad a medio uso para poder trabajar como propietario. Este hecho le traerá como resultado el incremento de su ingreso en por lo menos un 25% más.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro préstamo. El anterior crédito fue cancelado en su totalidad.

loans.use:
Purchase a vehicle to work as a taxi driver with his own car

Compra de una movilidad a medio uso para trabajar como taxi y dueño de su propio carro.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon works as a taxi driver and is on the payroll of the Trufi 88 of the Eduardo Avaroa union. This is the income he uses to support his young son and wife; he also helps his elderly parents. He lives in his parents' house in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz.

The loan will be used to pay for treatment for his mother's kidney problem. She does not have insurance and his father does not have enough money to cover the costs of treatment.

This is the first load Jhon has requested in Impro, and he has been approved. This loan is directly linked to our social outreach vision for the less fortunate.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

Jhon trabaja como transportista publico es asalariado en el Trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Avaroa, es su fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo y esposa; también ayuda a su padres que son de la tercera edad, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la Zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para el tratamiento de Salud de su madre ya que padece un malestar en los riñones y no tiene ni seguro médico ni su pafre no tiene el suficiente dinero para cubrir el tratamiento.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Jhon. Este préstamo está directamente vinculado a nuestra visión social de ayuda a los más pobres.

loans.use:
To cover the treatment costs for his mother's kidney problem

costos de tratamiento de un problema en los riñones de su señora madre.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Doris is a married 34-year-old mother of two children. Doris buys dye and hangers in her home near Libertad Road. Her husband then collects and brings the products by rental car to the city of Lima and sells them to local businesses.

Doris needs a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($575 USD) to invest in more dye and hangers.

Doris´s dream is to expand her business and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: Doris needs a loan to invest in more dye and hangers.

loans.name: Donald Cristian

texts.es:
Don Donald is 51 years old and libes in the El Riguero neighborhood. He is married and has two children of schooling age. He would like to be able to support them until they have finished their studies.

Don Donald has a general store in his home, generally sales are good but there are days when sales are very low. Don Donald has eight years of experience doing business with these highs and lows; he began his business with his own savings from a liquidation of his previous job.

His plans are to increase his inventory in order to better attract the attention of his clients. The loan he is soliciting will be used to purchase basic everyday products for his general store.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Don Donald tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio El Riguero, es casado y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. Y desea poder apoyarlos siempre hasta que éstos terminen sus estudios. Don Donald tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, generlamente las ventas son buenas pero hay días que la ventas son muy bajas y en éstas subidas y bajadas Don Donal tiene 8 años de experiencia en el negocio el cual empezó con fondos propios con dinero producto de una liquidación de su anterior trabajo. Sus planes son poder aumentar el inventario para así mejorar la atención a sus clientes, el crédito solcitado será invertido en la compra de productos de consumo básico para su pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase products of basic consumption

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es:
William Alberto is dedicated to the sale of electronic household items and new and used clothing. He opened this business 11 years ago by selling just clothes and established a fixed point. Today, his sales are also conducted by travelling from area to area.

William's plans for his business are to augment salest in order to offer a better quality of service to his clients. He would also like to, in the future, be able to have a store for these products. William Alberto is married with four children that are of schooling age. His wife supports and helps him with his business.

They live in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood, an area where juvenile delinquincy has increased. For this reason William is asking for a loan in order to purchase material and build a wall behind his house and in this way provide more security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

William Alberto se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, ropa nueva y ropa usada, empezó su negocio hace 11 años vendiendo solamente ropa y establecido en un punto fijo, ahora sus ventas las realiza también de forma ambulante. Los planes que William tiene para su negocio es aumentar las ventas para poder ofrecer mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes, y desea también en un futuro poder poner una tienda de estos productos. William Alberto es casado, tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposa lo apoya en la actividad del comercio. Habitan en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, lugar donde la delicuencia ha aumentado es por eso que William solicita el crédito, para comprar materiales y construir un muro en la parte trasera de su casa y así brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia.

loans.use: Build a wall in the area behind his house

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Marta is 58 years old. She has worked for several years selling food and bananas. She sells her food from breakfast through lunch, moving from place to place. Her daily works helps her to feel good, and most of all useful. She works together with her husband Braulio who transports passengers in a cycle-taxi, and supports her in her food sales. Martha also has woodworking tools which she provides to her working children, and they give her 40% of their earnings. Martha's goal is to grow her business so that in the future she can have a restaurant, which will help her to improve her economic situation. In order to do this, Martha asks for you to trust in her work and to grant the loan which she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martha tiene 58 años, se dedica a la venta de comida y plátano desde hace varios años atrás, ella vende su comida a la hora del desayuno y del almuerzo de manera ambulante. Su labor diaria la hace sentirse bien y sobre todo útil. Junto a su esposo, el señor Braulio quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, la apoya en su negocio de venta de comida. Martha también cuenta con herramientas para madera los mismos que les brinda a sus hijos para que trabajen y le den un 40% de las ganancias.El propósito de Martha es crecer en su negocio para más adelante tener un restaurante, el cual ayudará a mejorar su nivel económico. Para ello Martha les pide que confíen en su trabajo y le brinden el préstamo que solicita.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to open a restaurant

loans.name: Cercia

texts.es:
Cercia is 25 years old, and she has recently began selling grocery items from her home. She is a single mother, but that doesn't stop her from progressing and in time growing her business. Cercia is the mother of 2 children, one of whom attends school, while the other is still a baby. Cercia wants only be be able to provide her children with what they need for a better future. Her goal is to have a mini market, but for now she would like to increase the size of her store and add additional products. For that reason, she is requesting this loan. Cercia promises to honestly invest the loan correctly and responsbily.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Cercia tiene 25 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio desde hace poco tiempo, ella es madre soltera, sin embargo, eso no le imposibilita seguir adelante y con el tiempo crecer en su negocio. Cercia es madre de 2 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos estudia mientras que el otro aún es un bebe. Cercia sólo espera dar a sus hijos lo necesario para que tengan un mejor futuro. Su meta es tener un minimarket, pero por el momento, quiere ampliar e implementar con más productos, para ello requiere del préstamo que les solicita. Cercia promete no defraudarles e invertir el dinero correcta y responsablemente.

loans.use: To increase the size of her store and to aquire new merchandise

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania is a 30-year-old mother of 2 children, who are her reason for living. She owns two motorcycle taxis, one of which her husband, Wilmer drives. He always supports Tania in everything that she does. They both want to give their children the essentials, provide them with nutrition, and take care of their health. Ms. Tania would like to improve her work vehicles, and for this she needs to purchase spare parts and have them fixed, since she does not have enough money to do so and this business is the family’s sole source of income. For this reason, she turns to you with the promise of repaying the loan in a timely and responsible manner.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tania tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, los mismos que son la razón de su vida, ella es propietaria de 2 mototaxis, uno de ellos lo maneja su pareja, Wilmer, quien siempre apoya en todo a Tania.Ambos quieren brindar a sus niños lo necesario, velar por su alimentación y salud.La señora Tania quiere mejorar sus herramientas de trabajo y para ello requiere comprar repuestos para mandarlos a arreglar, ya que es el único sustento que tienen y no cuenta con la cantidad necesaria, para ello recurre a ustedes con la promesa de devolver el préstamo de manera puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi repair and maintenance

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris is a 21-year-old mother of two children, who mean everything to her and are her reason for getting ahead. In the morning, Iris sells seasoning at a stand in the Bellavista market, while in the evening, she sells cold drinks at home, which is located in a commercial area. Her partner, Mr. Magbis, repairs refrigerators for a living and supports Iris in her decisions. They both give their young ones everything that is necessary for their education. Iris would like to improve and expand her business, which along with her husband’s job, is the family’s source of income. With your help, Ms. Iris will obtain her goal very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Iris tiene 21 años y es madre de 2 niños, los que son todo en su vida y su razón de salir adelante. Iris se dedica por la mañana a la venta de condimentos en un puesto del mercado Bellavista, y por la tarde a la venta de bebidas heladas en su casa, ya que está ubicada en una zona comercial, su pareja, el señor Magbis es técnico de refrigeradoras y apoya en todo lo que Iris decide, ambos brindan a sus pequeños lo necesario para su educación. El propósito de Iris es crecer, mejorar y ampliar su negocio, que junto al oficio de su pareja son el sustento de su hogar. Con tu ayuda la señora Iris logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Expand and improve business

loans.name: Fernando Santos

texts.es:
Fernando (33) has worked transporting passengers for some time, and he owns his own cycle-car. He is the father of one child who is still in school, and who is his reason for continuing to work hard. His wife Magrith has always supported him in everything that he decides to do. Fernando would like to be able to offer his son the education necessary for him to become a professional; rising out of the conditions that the now live in. For that reason, he works hard every day, both to economically support his family and to save to purchase a new cycle-car. Fernando will use this loan to have his cycle-car repaired so that he can continue to do his work and to continue to save to purchase a new cycle-car.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Fernando (33) se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace ya mucho tiempo, él es propietario de un motocarro. Es padre de 1 niño que aún está en el colegio, y es su razón de seguir adelante; su pareja, la señora Magrith siempre lo apoya mucho en todo lo que decide. Fernando quiere brindar a su hijo la educación necesaria para que en un futuro sea profesional y supere la condición en la que ahora se encuentran. Es por ello que trabaja duro y parejo, uno por el sustento económico de su familia y otro para ahorrar y comprar otro motocarro.El uso que daría Fernando al préstamo que solicita es para mandar a reparar su motocarro, poder trabajar tranquilo, y seguir ahorrado para un nuevo motocarro.

loans.use: Repair of his cycle-car which he uses daily to provide public transportation.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Sonrisa Village Bank.

She is married, is 30 and has 2 children. Vilma produces silver and gold jewelry with her husband and sells this jewelry in a craft market stall.

She helps her husband with the joins and the alterations and also has a stall in the same market where she sells scarves, pullovers, wallets she purchases from the producers. On Saturdays and Sundays, she is a mobile CD woman in a central street of the city.

Vilma needs a loan of 2400 soles ($875 USD) to buy silver and gold.

She dreams about having her own store and her own house. She wants her children to be professionals.

loans.use: Vilma needs a loan to buy silver and gold.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has been working as a food vendor for five years. She prepares and sells banku, a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with various kinds of local soups by most Ghanaian every day either as breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Elizabeth’s business is going well, and she now wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. Elizabeth is therefore asking for a loan to be able to buy more maize grains, vegetables, and assorted meat for sale. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. Elizabeth hopes that the current loan will help her increase her savings and allow her pay the children’s school fees. Elizabeth is a member of the group called Isaiah whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of dried maize grains, vegetables and assorted meat for sale

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 31 years old and has 2 children. She earns income making oil from palm kernels, used to cook all kinds of dishes that use oil. To be able to make enough oil, Gifty has to buy and roast a large quantity of palm kernels. She therefore needs a loan to buy additional bags of palm kernels to be able to stay in the business. With the additional palm kernels, she will be able to prepare more oil and sell it to local soap manufacturers. This, she believes, would allow her to save some money for her children’s education. Gifty is a member of the group called Gospel Light whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of palm kernels for making cooking oil

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Her children are currently in school. To support her husband, she sells cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. Janet considers this business to be very lucrative and therefore  needs a loan to expand her inventory and thus increase her sales and income. Janet is a member of the group called Isaiah whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 31 years old and has two children. She earns income selling fresh fish in the village to customers who then use the fish to prepare their dishes. Gifty currently needs a loan to buy additional trays of fresh fish for sale. This, she believes, would enable her to save some money to be able to afford renting a store for her operations and also to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Gifty is a member of the group called Isaiah whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is married and has six children. Two of them are in school. Georgina earns income selling maize, beans and gari (grains of cassava) in the local market to support her family. She has been involved in this business for five years and now wants to expand her operations and sell larger quantities of goods to other traders. Georgina therefore needs a loan to increase her inventory of different grains and thereby avoid price hikes in off-season. She is a member of the group called Gospel Light whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of gari, maize, beans, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Because she wanted to work in the textile arts ever since she was a little girl, Josefina is an excellent seamstress. She has sewing machines which she uses to do her daily work. She makes all manner of clothing which she sells from home, sometimes on credit. At 60 years old, Josefina still has the desire to keep working. She has 4 children, and, having separated from her husband some time ago, she lives with a son who is very supportive. Josefina would like to rent a location for her tailoring shop, and she is asking to borrow the money that she needs to do that, from you. Lets help Josefina, a talented mother who works hard to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Sus aspiraciones desD. muy joven han sido el arte textil, es por eso que la señora Josefina es una excelente costurera, ella cuenta con máquinas D. coser, que son D. mucha utilidad para la realización D. su trabajo diario, ella confecciona ropa para todos los gustos y la venD. a domicilio, dejándola a veces a crédito.La señora Josefina a sus 60 años, aún tiene deseos D. seguir trabajando, tiene 4 hijos, se separó tiempo atrás D. su esposo y ahora vive con uno D. sus hijos quien la apoya en todo.La señora Josefina desea alquilar un local para su taller textil, para ello estima una cantidad D. dinero con la que no cuenta y es el motivo por el que acuD. a ustedes. Apoyemos a la señora Josefina, madre talentosa que se esfuerza arduamente por prosperar.

loans.use: Rental of a location for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermos is a 56 year old father of 7 children who are now grown with families of thier own. He has worked transporting passengers for a long time, and owns tow cycle-cars which he uses to pay for the domestic expenses. His wife, Mart, works selling candies. Guillermo is requestiong this loan to repair one of his cycle-cars which is not running well. To do this, he will need to purchase some parts. Also, he would like to begin selling home baked goods which he has learned to make, having now become a master baker. Lets support this father who has shown a desire to progress. With your help, he will be able to meet his goal in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermo tiene 56 años y es padre de 7 hijos, los mismos que ya tienen su propia familia, él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, es propietario de dos motocarros con cuya ganancia sustenta los gastos de su hogar, su pareja, la señora Martha, se dedica a la venta de dulces.El préstamo que solicita Guillermo es para reparar uno de sus motocarros que se encuentra en mal estado, para el cual hay que comprar algunos repuestos; también, mientras no maneja el motocarro, quiere dedicarse a la venta de panes caseros ya que aprendió a prepararlos y es maestro panadero. Apoyemos a este padre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante, con tu ayuda él podrá cumplir su propósito en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: To repair his cycle-car in order to keep working and to begin selling homemade bakery products.

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es:
Bertila is a 49 year old mother of 6. Four of her children are now independent, with the two youngest still attending school. She decided to work selling clothing some time ago, and her husband, Luis supports her and is in agreement with what she proposes to do. Bertila gets up early in the morning to prepare her packages, and to go out to sell her wares door to door. Bertila and her husband both work hard to ensure that their children are happy, and that they grow up to be good men. Bertila wants her business to grow, and to accomplish that she would like to rent a location where she can sell her clothing. To do this, she needs the money requested in this loan, which she agrees to repay in a responsible and timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Bertila tiene 49 años y es madre de 6 hijos, 4 de ellos ya son independientes, los dos últimos que aún están en el colegio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace mucho tiempo, su esposo, el señor Luis, la apoya con su negocio y está de acuerdo con sus propósitos. Bertila se levanta muy temprano a preparar sus paquetes para luego salir a la calle, pues vende de manera ambulante por diferentes lugares. La señora Bertila junto a su esposo trabajan con mucho esmero para ver felices a sus hijos para que en el mañana sean hombres de bien.El deseo de Bertila es que su negocio prospere, para ello quiere alquilar un local para la venta de sus prendas, requiere de la cantidad de dinero que solicita en préstamo, con la promesa de devolverlo de manera puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Rental of a location to sell clothing, in order to no longer sell door to door.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Mr Antonio is a hard working man who has been transporting passengers for a long time - he is the owner and driver of a motorcycle taxi. Antonio is 42 years old and although he isn't a father yet, he anxiously hopes his partner will give him a child soon. She sells groceries and together they take care of their household's financial needs.

Antonio wants to be a prosperous businessman in the transport industry and as he is also a master pastry chef, he also wants to build an oven to make and sell his delicious pastry treats.

At this moment Antonio has worn out his motorcycle taxi and this is why he asks for a loan of 900.00 PEN to pay for it to be fixed and for the spare parts as these are very expensive. Your help will forever be in the hearts of this grateful couple.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Antonio, es un hombre trabajador que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, él es propietario y chofer de un mototaxi. Antonio con sus 42 años de edad aún no es padre, pero espera con ansias que pronto su pareja le dé un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y juntos sostienen las necesidades económicas de su casa.Antonio quiere ser un próspero empresario de transportes y como es maestro pastelero, también desea construir un horno para hacer y vender sus deliciosos pasteles. En este momento Antonio tiene malogrado su motocarro y es para ello que solicita un préstamo de 900 soles, para pagar la reparación y comprar los repuestos que son muy costosos. En el corazón de esta pareja agradecida permanecerá por siempre tu ayuda.

loans.use: To fix and buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.en:
Oneida M. P. (pictured on the far left) is a 27-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two-month-old son in a small community called Los Hatillos in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small business selling bedspreads, sheets, curtains, and towels two years ago and continues to increase her inventory with each loan.  Currently, Oneida travels from town to town selling her products in addition to selling them from her home; however, it is her hope to continue growing her business so that she will be able to establish her own store in town one day.  Above everything, she works to provide for her newborn boy, so that he may have a good education in the future.  In Oneida´s free time, she enjoys going to church, reading the Bible, and spending time with her family.

Oneida is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, Mujeres Solidarias.  In English, this means ´women in solidarity`.  Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. 

On behalf of Oneida, the Mujeres Solidarias group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy curtains, sheets, bedspreads, and towels

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo is 32 years old and the father of two children aged 4 and 6 who are his inspiration and motivation to move forward. Arturo is the owner of a motorcycle taxi and he has been transporting passengers for a while. He also runs a small store and his partner Kelly takes care of it. Together they work to give the children everything they need and above all, to see them grow up happy.

Arturo doesn't sit around doing nothing - in his free time he wants to sell wood. The loan he is asking for today is to repair his motorcycle taxi and to continue working in public transport. With your help Mr Arturo will achieve his goals in much less time.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Arturo tiene 32 años, es padre de 2 pequeños de 4 y 6 años de edad, quienes son su inspiración y motor para seguir adelante. Arturo es propietario de un motocarro y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace tiempo atrás. También Arturo, administra una pequeña bodega, su pareja, Kelly se encarga de la atención de la misma, juntos trabajan para brindarle a sus pequeños lo necesario y sobre todo, verlos crecer felices. Arturo, no se queda con las manos cruzadas y en su tiempo libre quiere dedicarse a la venta de madera. El préstamo que solicita hoy es para arreglar su motocarro y continuar trabajando en el transporte público. Con tu ayuda el señor Arturo logrará su meta en el tiempo menos esperado.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 28 years old, studied elementary school, and only speaks aymara and understands Spanish. She is married and has three boys, who are studying. They have their own house and is located on Chimbo, Cuturapi district, Province of Yunguyo.

She used to work selling sheep and cows; now she works selling food for cows and bulls, she brings this product from Yunguyo.

She belongs to the community bank “Central Progreso” where she got an initial credit of S/. 300.00 new soles that she used to buy 6 sheep that she used to sell.

With the loan of S/. 1000.00 of new soles, which will be paid in 4 payments, she will buy more food for cattle.

Her dream is to continue with her business and get more products, buy cows, provide her kids with good education and to grow financially.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda tiene 28 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, habla solo el aymará y entiende el castellano. Está casada y tiene tres hijos varones, quienes están estudiando, la casa que tiene es propia y está ubicada en el centro poblado Chimbo, Distrito de Cuturapi, Provincia de Yunguyo. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ovejas y vacas; ahora cambió de negocio, se dedica a la venta de Alimento Concentrado para Vacas y Toros, producto que trae de Yunguyo. Pertenece al Banco Comunal " Central Progreso" donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que pudo comprar 6 ovejas, las cuales las comercializaba. Con este préstamo de S/: 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará al por mayor alimento concentrado para ganado. Su anhelo es seguir con el negocio poder adquirir mas mercadería, comprarse vacas, darles una buena educación a sus hijos, crecer económicamente.

loans.use: Tou buy food for cattle at wholesale prices / Compra al por mayor de alimento para ganado.

loans.name: Sonia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia is 24 years old and is married, she has a daughter. Lives in Chimbo, Cuturapi district, Yunguyo Province.

Three years ago she worked in Lima, then she had her baby, and went to live in Chimbo, currently Sonia and her husband sell caws, sheep and donkeys, that they sell on the Chacachaca fair, every Thursday each week.

Sonia belongs to the community bank “centrl Progreso” she started with a credit of S/. 500.00 new soles that she used sheep and veal.

With the loan of S/. 1000.00, which will be cancelled in 4 months, she will buy 3 sheep and with the rest her husband will buy jackets and will bring them to the city of Lima to sell them – is the first trip he will do-, and expects to continue with the business.

His vision is to have his own business, a big one in the city of Lima and later on to buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sonia tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Chimbo, Distrito de Cuturapi , provincia de Yunguyo. Hace tres años trabajaba en la Ciudad de Lima ,después que tuvo su bebe, se vino a vivir al centro poblado de Chimbo, actualmente Sonia y su esposo se dedican al comercio de vacas , ovejas y burros, los mismos que vende en la feria de Chacachaca , todos los jueves de cada semana. Sonia pertenece a al banco comunal "Central Progreso" ella inicio con un crédito de S/. 500.00 con lo que compro ovejas y una ternera. Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 3 ovejas y con el resto del dinero su esposo comprará casacas y las llevará hacia la Ciudad de Lima para venderlas - es el primer viaje que hace , espera continuar con ese negocio. Está muy agradecida porque su negocio le está dando posibilidades de tener un nuevo negocio. Lo que ella aprendió al ser socia del Banco Comunal es que, con el dinero que se le presta, tiene que trabajarlo con la finalidad de incrementar su mercadería y sus ingresos. Su visión futura es tener un negocio propio, grande y un puesto en la ciudad de Lima y con el tiempo comprarse una casa.

loans.use: Buy sheep and jackets at wholesale prices / Compra de ganado (ovejas). Compra al por mayor de casacas.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is 53 years old, she studied elementary school, is married and has 4 children, 3 of them are in Lima and one of them studies in Senati (Institute). She learned to work and to be responsible and reliable.

Lidia works selling clothes in the Cairani Candarave fair, she sells sweaters, jackets, socks, pants, she also sells fruits. She is the only one who sells those products on the fair and receives requests of bed sheets, and other necessities her clients have, requests she has to fulfill on her next trip.

She belongs to the community bank of “Vista Alegre” where she started with a loan of S/. 300.00 new soles she used to buy jackets and pants.

With the loan of S/. 500.00 new soles, that will be paid in 4 months, she will buy 4 bed sheets (that her clients requested), and with the rest of the money she will buy wool at wholesale prices.

She dreams on buying a vehicle so she can pick up the products and be able to move with it and keep on with her business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia tiene 53 años D. edad, estudió hasta el quinto D. primaria, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, D. los cuales tres están en Lima y uno D. ellos estudia en el Senati (instituto). Ella aprendió a trabajar y no pedir dinero al esposo, y sobre todo ser responsable y cumplida. Lidia se dedica ala venta D. ropa en la feria D. Cairani Candarave, vendiendo chompas, casacas, medias, pantalones, también lleva frutas. Dice que es la única que venD. este tipo D. productos y además le hacen pedidos como frazadas, según la necesidad D. las personas, pedidos que tiene que llevar en la próxima fecha. Pertenece al Banco Comunal "Vista Alegre" donD. inicio con un crédito D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que compro chompas y pantalones. Con este préstamo D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará cuatro frazadas (pedido que le hicieron sus clientes), y con el resto del dinero comprará lana al por mayor. Sueña comprar un carro Datson para que pueda recoger la chacra y así poderse movilizarse en él y seguir con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy jackets and pants at wholesale prices / Compra al por mayor de chompas y pantalones.

loans.name: Vilma Maritza

texts.es:
Vilma is 27 years old, finished high school, speaks Spanish and Aymara, she lives with the father of her children, has two boys and owns her house which is located in Queñuani village, in the district of Yunguyo.

She works selling cows and sheep in the Yunyugo fair, in Huapaca, for the last 5 years.

She is a member of the community bank “Vista Alegre”, she started with a loan of S/. 300.00 new soles that she used to buy six sheep.

With the loan of S/. 600.00 new soles, that will be cancelled in 4 payments, she will buy a bull, that she will rise for a couple of months and then will be sold.

She learned to be responsible and organized. She is very thankful of the loan because it will help her increase her working capital.

Her dream is to build a house with good materials, support her kids’ studies and increase her cattle for the business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma tiene 27 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, habla castellano y aymará, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos varones, su casa es propia y está ubicada en villa Queñuani, distrito de Yunguyo. Ella se dedica a la venta de vacas y ovejas en la feria de Yunguyo, Huapaca, desde hace ya cinco años. También es socia del Banco comunal "Vista Alegre" al inicio tuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que compro seis ovejas. Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará un toro, el cual criará un par de meses luego será vendido. Ella aprendió a ser responsable, organizada. Esta muy agradecida con el crédito porque le permite aumentar su capital de trabajo. El sueño anhelado es tener una casa de material noble, hacer estudiar sus hijos y incrementar su ganado que tiene para la venta.

loans.use: To buy cattle (a bull) / Compra de ganado (toro).

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina is 59 years old; she didn’t finished elementary school, is married and has 3 kids. She lives in Queñuani village, district of Yunguyo.

Thrity years ago she used to sell chuño, pottatos, beans, quinua, cañihua. She belongs to the community bank “Vista Alegre”, and with her first loan of S/. 300.00 new soles, she bought 5 sheep and started a new cattle business.

With the loan of S/. 500.00 new soles that will be cancelled in 4 payments she will buy a bull to rise and to be sold later on.

She is very thankful with the loan because is helps her increase her working capital and increase her income.

Her hope is that her kids work and she can keep on with her business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Bernardina tiene 59 años de edad, estudió hasta el segundo año de primaria, está casada y tiene tres hijos. Vive en Villa Queñuani distrito d e Yunguyo. Hace treinta años se dedicaba a la venta de chuño, papa, habas, quinua, cañihua, pertenece al Banco Comunal " Vista Alegre", su primer crédito fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con ello compró 05 ovejas. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará un torete para engorde y después financiarlo. Esta muy agradecida con el préstamo porque le facilita negociar e incrementar de esa manera el capital y su ingreso económico. Su visión futura es que sus hijos trabajen y ella pueda continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy cattle (a bull) / Compra de ganado (toro)

loans.name: Rocío Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ms Rocío del Pilar sells clothes and is a hard working mother who wants to move forward in this business. She wants to pay for all of her two sons' needs through her business and they are her reason for working on. Her partner Alfredo, an independent worker (a trader) is very supportive of her and is in charge of purchasing the products she needs to then sell on.

Rocío del Pilar wants to keep growing her business and so has decided to increase the number of products in her range and to rent a space for her clothes store. In order to achieve her objectives she asks for your help, for the loan that you can offer. Rocío is a good payer who pays very punctually and promises to continue to do so for those who support her work.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rocío del Pilar se dedica a al venta de ropa, es una madre trabajadora que quiere salir adelante en este negocio y desde luego por medio del mismo dar lo necesario a sus dos hijos quienes estudian y son su razón de seguir adelante. Ella tiene a su pareja, Alfredo, trabajador independiente (comerciante) que la apoya mucho, él es el encargado de comprar la mercadería que ella necesita para después venderla. Rocío del Pilar quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio, es por eso que decidió implementar más productos y alquilar un local para poner su tienda de ropa. Para lograr ese objetivo solicita tu ayuda, el préstamo económico que le puedas brindar, Rocío es buena pagadora, muy puntual y así promete cumplir con quien apoye su trabajo.

loans.use: To add more products to her range and rent a space for her clothes store

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Ice lollies, snow cones, jell-o and chilled sodas - this is what María sells on a daily basis and she has positioned herself in an appropriate location for the sale of her products. She feels happy to be in this location as lots of people come to buy her snow cones and ice lollies. At 25 years of age, she is a mother of two sons who are at school. Her partner, Julián works with wood and is very supportive of her as he was the one who encouraged her to start in this business.

For María, it is important that her business keeps growing. She wants to build a kiosk for the sale of her frozen products so that she can have more space and in this way be more attentive towards her customers. For this reason, she requests a loan and appeals for your help. She will be eternally grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Chupetes, marcianos, gelatinas y gaseosas heladas es lo que vende diariamente la señora María, quien se encuentra ubicada en un lugar apropiado para venta de sus productos, ella se siente feliz de estar en ese lugar ya que concurre mucha gente a comprar sus marcianos y chupetes. A sus 25 años es madre de 2 hijos quienes están estudiando, su pareja, Julián se dedica a trabajar con madera, y la apoya en todo, ya que él fue quién la incentivo a ingresar en este negocio.Para la señora María es importante seguir creciendo, por ello desea construir un kiosco para la venta de sus productos helados y así tener mayor espacio y una mejor atención hacia los clientes. Por esta razón es que solicita el préstamo solicitado y de acudir en su ayuda, estará agradecida de por vida.

loans.use: To build a kiosk for the sale of her ice lollies

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronilla is 63 years old, she couldn’t study, is married and has 3 sons, and a daughter, they all work independently, she lives in Queñuan village in the district of Yunyugo. She has her husband’s support.

She works selling pigs, cows and sheep, in the Chacachaca fair, in Yunyugo, she has been working since she was very young. Currently she is a member of the community bank “Vista Alegre” where she started with a credit of S/. 300.00 new soles that she used to buy 5 sheep.

With the new credit of S/. 500.00 new soles, that will be cancelled in 4 months, she will buy a veal to rise and then sell.

She will keep on working because the loan helps her and it will increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Petronila tiene 63 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y tiene hijos varones y una hija mujer , quienes trabajan independientemente, vive en villa Queñuani del Distrito de Yunguyo. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Se dedica a la venta de chanchos, vacas y ovejas, en las ferias de Chacachaca, Yunguyo, se dedico al negocio desde muy joven. Actualmente ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre” donde en un inicio tuvo un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra 5 ovejas. Con este crédito de S/. 500.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará una ternera la cual criará y luego pondrá en venta. Ella seguirá trabajando, por que el préstamo le ayuda bastante y de esa manera incrementa sus ingresos.

loans.use: To buy cattle (a veal) / Compra de ganado (ternera)

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana has recently begun to sell fruit and candy. She considers herself to be an active and above all, capable woman, who at 25 is a single mother to an adorable little girl - the reason she puts so much effort into her work. Roxana sells from outside her own home so she can be near her little one. She would love to be able to pay for all of her daughter's education, including her University education and this is what she works so hard for every day.

The space from which she sells her products is very small, so she is asking for a loan to increase its size in order to improve it for herself, her products and her customers. Roxana awaits your help.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Roxana se dedica a la venta de fruta y golosinas desde hace poco tiempo, ella se considera una mujer activa y sobre todo capaz, a sus 25 años es madre soltera y tiene una preciosa niña, por quien dedica su esfuerzo en esta actividad. Roxana vende en las afueras de su domicilio para estar cerca de su pequeña, a ella le gustaría brindarle todos los estudios, inclusive los universitarios por ello se esfuerza cada día en su negocio. El espacio donde ella vende sus productos es muy reducido, por ello solicita un préstamo para ampliarlo, mejorar los espacios tanto para ella y sus productos, como para sus clientes. La señora Roxana espera de tu ayuda.

loans.use: To expand and improve the space from which she sells fruit and candy

loans.name: Fanny Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs Fanny, whilesearching for wayts to earn money in order to support her family, decided six years ago to open a local store out of her home. This was established thanks to the economic help from her children. Mrs Fanny does not currently have children that are dependent on her, but supports herself and her husband, who runs a hostel and also helps with expenses.

Mrs Fanny began this business with a bit of capital, and it has grown through the years and enabled her to increase the inventory of her products. She would like to continue this and her plan is to open a store, and with this loan be able to purchase clothing and cosmetics to increase the variety of the products offered in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Fanny en busca de formas que pudieran generarle ingresos para la manutención de su familia hace 6 años decidió poner una pulpería en su casa de habitación, esto pudo hacerlo gracias a la ayuda económica que le brindaron sus hijos. Doña Fanny ya no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, solamente son ella y su esposo, quien es pensionado y aporta a la economía familiar. Doña Fanny inició este negocio con poco capital, pero a través de los años éste ha ido creciendo y ha podido aumentar el inventario de su producto. Desea continuar ese crecimiento ya que sus planes son llegar a tener una tienda, así que con el crédito otorgado comprará ropa y cosméticos para poder aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su tienda.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Mrs. Anastacia is 45 years old. She studied until the second year of elementary school. She speaks aymará (language spoken by the Aymara people of the Andes) and a little Spanish. She is married and she has six children, two of them are in school. Her house is located in the town Queñuani of the district of Yunguyo. She sells cows (to fatten), sheep, she also sells potato flour, potatoes, canihua, at the fair of Huapaca and Yunguyo. She joined the “Vista Alegre” Communal Bank where she started with a loan of $105, which she used to buy 6 sheep. With this new loan of $550, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months. She will buy 2 bulls to fatten them and to sell them. Thanks to the loans of Manuela R. she learned to be a person in charge of the payments and to be punctual. Her big dream is to buy more cattle and that her children keep on studying.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Anastacia tiene 45 años D. edad estudio hasta segundo año D. primaria, habla el aymará y poco castellano, es casada y tiene seis hijos, dos D. ellos están estudiando, su casa queda en Villa Queñuani del distrito D. Yunguyo. Se dedica a la venta vacas (engorD.), ovejas, también a la venta D. chuño, papa, cañihua, en las feria D. Huapaca y Yunguyo. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre” donD. se inicio con un crédito D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que compro 6 ovejas. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 2 toros para poderlos engordar y ser vendidos. Gracias a los préstamos D. Manuela R. aprendió a ser responsable en los pagos y ser puntual. El gran anhelo que ella tiene es comprar mas ganado y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: Buy bulls

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana is 60 years old. She studied until the fifth year of elementary school. She is a widow and she has three children, who are all married. She is a partner of Wiñay Marca Communal Bank. Since she got married, she has been selling hardwood floors, firewood, nails, etc. Since 1985, when her husband died, she has run the business by herself. She has the support of an assistant to cut the wood.
