Friends and neighbors formed a group of fifteen people, who had a business and needed a loan and formed the Communal Bank Wiñay Marca where they learned the woman rights, and learned how work responsibly. She tells us that they first get a small loan of $105 and if they repaid in time they can bigger loans. With her new loan of $1075, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy wood and firewood. Also she plans to install a small candy and soda shop at home. This way she will assure a bigger income. Her vision is to keep her business and to keep on working up until she has the strength and life.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Adriana tiene 60 años D. edad, quien estudio hasta el quinto año D. primaria, es V. y tiene tres hijos, los cuales son casados. La señora es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca, desD. que se caso se dedica a la venta D. tablas para piso, venta D. leña, clavos, etc. desD. 1985 fecha en la que falleció su esposo, ella continua con el negocio. Para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo D. un maestro y un ayudante para el corte D. madera. Amigas y vecinas formaron un grupo D. quince personas, las cuales tenían un negocio y necesitaban D. un crédito y conformaron el Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca en donD., aprendieron cuales son los derechos D. la mujer, aprendieron a trabajar organizadamente y responsablemente. Nos cuenta que el crédito que se les ofrece es en forma escalonada, según el tiempo que estén D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles a mas. Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará madera y leña, también piensa instalar una pequeña tienda D. golosinas y gaseosas en su mismo domicilio y D. esta manera asegurar un poco mas sus ingresos. Su visión es mantener su negocio y seguir trabajando hasta donD. le alcancen sus fuerzas y la vida.

loans.use: Buy wood and firewood.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia sells lamb and alpaca at the Market 15 de Agosto. The idea came from her mother-in-law (who also is in the same business). She told her that it was very profitable business. She lives in the Yunguyo province. She joined the Wiñay Marca Communal Bank where she obtained a first loan of $105 that she used to buy two more sheep. With this new loan of $725, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy an average of 13 sheep, which will allow her to improve her income. Delia always makes her payments punctually to the communal bank. Delia is 27 years old; she is married and has two small children. With this loan, she hopes to sell her products in other markets like Tacna, La Paz – Bolivia, to be able to buy her house and that her children are able to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Delia se dedica a la venta diaria de carne de ovino y alpaca en el mercado 15 de Agosto, la idea del comercio la dio su suegra (quien se dedica a la misma actividad), le comentó que era muy rentable. Ella vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno. La venta del producto era seguro por que ya tenia caseros diarios, es que se vio en la necesidad de buscar un crédito, motivo por el cual se asocio al Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca, a un inicio fue acreedora de un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra de dos corderos mas. Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará un promedio de 13 ovinos, lo cual le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos. Delia siempre paga sus intereses puntualmente al banco comunal. Delia tiene 27 años de edad, casada tiene dos hijos pequeños. Con el siguiente crédito espera vender sus productos en otros mercados como Tacna, La Paz – Bolivia, para poder comprar su casa y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Buy sheep.

loans.name: José Helidoro

texts.es:
José lives in the 3-80 neighborhood of the city of Managua. He is married with 3 school age children. He has been working as a bricklayer for 20 years. His wife is a domestic working and supports her husband with the household expenses.

Jose's house is still under construction; he has been building it bit by bit due to the family's meager income. He is ready now to build the family's bathroom. He already has the building materials but lacks the toilet, and for that reason he is applying for a loan. He deepest desire is to be able to complete the construction of his home and to have a bedroom for each of his children in order to give them better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Don José habita en el barrio 3-80 de la ciudad de Managua, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, todos en edad escolar. El oficio de Don José es albañilería y tiene 20 años de trabajar en esta actividad. Su esposa es empelada doméstica y apoya a su marido con los gastos del hogar.

La casa donde habita Don José todavía no está terminada de construir, debido a los pocos ingresos que generan la casa la van levantando poco a poco, actualmente necesita construir el servicio higiénico, ya tiene los materiales de construcción sólo le falta el inodoro, y para eso solicita el préstamo. Su mayor anhelo es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, y hacer una habitación para cada uno de sus hijos y así poder darles mejor comodidad y mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy a toilet for the bathroom he's installing in the family home.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Ofelia is a 38-year-old single mother, who finished junior high. She has a 21-year-old daughter and a 4-year-old boy. They all live in Jr. Incas nº 58 of the Yunguyo Province. Ofelia sells cups, thermos jugs, small radios, which she sells wholesale. The products were brought from the city of Tacna, La Paz Bolivia. She decided to have her own store by suggestion of some friends at the same Yunguyo. She has the support of her daughter; but the business needed a little more capital, this is when she joined the Wiñay Marca Communal Bank. She first started with a loan of $105, that she used to buy small TV sets and radios. With this new loan of $900, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy TV sets, mini components and Dvds. She is happy because she increased her revenue. Her big dream is to have a big appliance store, she wants to support her children in their studies, and later buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ofelia; madre soltera, tiene 38 años de edad, culmino sus estudios secundarios, tiene una hija de 21 años de edad y otro de 04 años quienes viven en el Jr. Los incas nº 58 del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo. Ofelia se dedica al comercio de tazas, termos, radios pequeñas, que dejaba por mayor los cuales eran traídos de la ciudad de Tacna, La Paz Bolivia, por sugerencia de algunas amigas tomo la decisión de tener un puesto propio, en el mismo Yunguyo, para lo cual contaba con el apoyo de su hija; pero el negocio requería un poco mas de capital, es donde logro integrar al Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca para lo cual inicio con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero con que compro pequeños televisores y radios. Con este crédito de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará televisores, mini componentes y DvDs. Ella vive contenta por que mejoro su ingreso. su gran anhelo es tener una gran tienda de artefactos, apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, posterior mente adquirir un carro.

loans.use: Buy television sets, dvd players, etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is 38-year-old woman. She studied until the second year of junior high. At present she lives with his partner with whom she has two sons and one daughter. They all are in school. The house where they live is rented and is located in Av. Ejercito at the Yunguyo Province. Lidia sells buckets, pitchers, tapers, dishes, cups, and plastic goods in general. She started her business 18 years ago. She sells her products every Sunday in Yunguyo, and every Thursday in the square of Chacachaca. Also she is the owner of a grocery store, and a telephone business to cellular phones, which is located in Av. Ejercito, which is served sometimes by her partner and children. In order to increase her products, she joined the Wiñay Marca Communal Bank, and she obtained a loan of $105 that she used to buy bigger wastebaskets and washers. With this new loan of $900, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy wholesale of rice, Bolivian gas and she will install cabins in her telephone booth store. This way she will increase her income. She has learned to be more responsible, organized, to share chores, especially to keeping on working. His longed dream is to have her own house, a bigger business, and that her children are professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Lidia tiene 38 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria, actualmente convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos varones y una hija mujer, quienes están estudiando, la casa donde viven es alquilado y esta ubicado en la Av. Ejercito salida a Puno del Distrito y Provincia Yunguyo. Lidia se dedica a la venta de tachos, baldes, jarras, tapers, platos, tazas, plastiqueria en general, negocio que inicio hace 18 años. Productos que vende los domingos en Yunguyo, los jueves en la plaza de Chacachaca. También es propietaria de una tienda de abarrotes, locutorio de llamadas a celular el cual esta ubicado en la avenida el Ejercito, quien es atendida a veces por su conviviente e hijos. Con la finalidad de incrementar sus productos, integro el Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca en el cual accedió a un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que logro comprar mas tachos grandes, y lavadores. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará arroz al por mayor, gas Boliviano e implementará la instalación de las cabinas de locutorio. De esa manera incrementará sus ingresos económicos. Aprendió a ser mas responsable, organizada, compartir quehaceres, sobre todo a seguir trabajando. Su visión anhelada es tener casa propia, un negocio mas grande, que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy wholesale of plastic goods.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Julio Del Carmen

texts.es:
At 70 years old Julio likes to work as though he were 20. He is a brick layer and works independently on construction projects. He is single and has three children, aged 12, 20 and 30. He has one adolescent left to educate and it is for that child that Julio puts in so much effort at work every day. He wants to give a dignified home to his son and his life partner, who takes on the responsibility of caring for the home. With the loan he will replace a part of his roof that is in poor condition. AFODENIC considers Julio an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Don Julio a la edad de 70 años le gusta trabajar como si tuviera 20, es albañil y hacer trabajos de construcción de forma independiente. Es soltero y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 20 y 30 años. Todavía le queda un adolescente por terminar de educar, y es por él por quien don Julio se esfuerza dia a dia en su trabajo. Desea darle una vivienda digna a su hijo y su compañera de vida quien se encarga del cuido del hogar. Con el préstmo cambiará parte del techo de su vivienda que está en mal estado. Don Julio es un exelente cliente para AFODENIC

loans.use: Install a new roof on his house.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.en:
Grisel Y. lives in a tropical paradise in the Dominican Republic. Surrounded by the jungle, with a small waterfall nearby, most would consider this exotic location the perfect vacation destination. But the tranquil image is shattered by the reality of the poverty confronted in the small town of Imbert every day. Grisel works everyday to provide meals and school materials for her three children (and a 4th on the way). With her two small barbecues, she sets up shop at a popular intersection in town, where she sells Chicharrones (deep fried pork) and other meets. With this loan, Grisel intends to purchase propane, paint for her BBQ, and a supply of raw meet and oils. While her current business is selling food, she dreams of one day owning her own boutique clothing store.

Grisel is the leader of a 10 person micro bank Mujeres de Fe, which means "Women of Faith". Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another's payments in order to receive their next loan together. As these 10 women embark upon their first ever loan from Esperanza, we are confident that they will all succeed in bettering their lives and the lives of their families with this loan. One of the women in the group just began a small general store, one owns a small hair salon, and several of the others plan to sell clothing.

On behalf of Grisel Yocast, the Mujeres de Fe group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase paint to decorate a barbecue, propane, and pork to be sold on the street.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Luisa Elena

texts.es:
A few years ago Mrs. Luisa used to sell vegetables, now she sells clothing (sweaters, track suits, trousers, t-shirts, stocking, underwear,etc.) at the Campo VerD. market, in Yunguyo every day of the week. She is a partner of Estrellita del Sur Communal Bank, where she started with a loan of $105, that she used to buy sweaters and stockings. With this new loan of $350, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy wholesale clothing like: track suits, sweaters babies' clothes. She really wants to keep on working. Luisa is 44 years old, she study until the first year junior high. She is married, and she has 5 children who are in school, and their dream is to have a big clothing store in order to increase their revenue and be one day a wealthy family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luisa unos años atrás se dedicaba a la venta D. verdura, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. ropa (chompas, buzos, pantalones, polos, medias, pantis, ropas interiores, entre otros) esto en el mercado campo verD.,- Yunguyo durante todos los días D. la semana. Es socia del Banco Comunal Estrellita del Sur, donD. inicio con un crédito D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que compro chompas, medias. Con este crédito D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará ropa al por mayor como: buzos, chompas y ropa D. bebes. Tiene muchas ganas D. seguir trabajando Luisa tiene 44 años, estudio hasta el primer año D. secundaria, es casada, tiene 5 hijos quienes estudian, quienes tienen como sueño tener una gran tienda D. ropa, incrementar sus incrementar su ingreso y ser una familia pudiente.

loans.use: Buy wholesale of clothing.

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
The town of Cocani – Puno, is the hometown of Melina, a young mother who is humble but very hardworking. Ever since she got married, she decided to live with her family in the city of Juliaca. She started out weaving clothing by hand, but after much effort and many hardships, she managed to purchase her indispensable work tool—her power loom. She and her husband started the business, but for years, they were able to get only sporadic work. As a result, many times their household budget was affected. Nevertheless, they have managed to notably improve their living conditions little by little, which is why their clothing production has been continuously increasing. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to purchase wool so that she can continue manufacturing apparel, thus filling her customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El centro poblado de Cocani – Puno es el pueblo natal de Melina, joven madre que proviene de un hogar humilde pero muy trabajador, desde que contrajo matrimonio decidió radicar junto a su familia en la ciudad de Juliaca, se inició tejiendo prendas de vestir manualmente, pero con esfuerzo y algunas privaciones logró comprar su indispensable herramienta de trabajo, su maquina de tejer. Iniciaron esta actividad con su esposo y durante años sólo lograron tener trabajos eventuales y muchas veces la economía de su hogar se vio afectada. Pero poco a poco, lograron mejorar notablemente su condición de vida es por ello que continuamente viene aumentando el volumen de producción de sus distintivas prendas de vestir. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de lana para continuar con la fabricación de sus prendas y terminara sus pedidos.

loans.use: Purchase wool to make clothing

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
Martha Rosa works buying and fattening pigs she later slaughters in order to sell various parts of the animals to her clients as food products. She started this business a year and a half ago and reports that it has gone well for her although sometimes the initial price she has to pay for the pigs increases, reducing her earnings.

She learned the business from family members; pig-raising has been a family business. She is requesting a loan which which to buy pigs. She will make the purchase in the interior of the country since the elevated prices in Managua would limit her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Rosa se dedica a la compra de cerdos, que luego ella los engorda, los mata y saca diferentes productos alimenticios que luegos los vende a sus clientes. Empezó este negocio hace año y medio y aduce que le ha ido bien aunque a veces el cerdo se pone más caro y ella saca menos ganacias.

Este negocio ha sido de la familia y fue de ahí donde ella aprendió esta actividad. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos, la compra la realizará en el interior del paísya que actualmente los precios en la ciudad de Managua están muy elevados y eso no le permite captar muchas ganacias.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Yessica Elieth

texts.es:
Yessica is 23 years old and married with 3 children, all under 18. She lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood. Yessica has been selling new clothing for a year and a half in a business she was able to start thanks to her husband's support. Her sales have peaks and valleys as in all businesses but she has been able to keep the business going well despite the cycles. She is requesting a loan with which to buy more products in order to increase her inventory. She dreams of one day owning her own clothng store and of giving a good education to her 3 small children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Yessica tiene 23 años de edad, es casada, habita en el barrio Villa venezuela, tiene 3 hijos que son menores de edad. Yessica vende ropa nueva desde hace año y medio, negocio que pudo empezar gracias al apoyo que le dio su esposo. Las ventas tiene altas y bajas como todo negocio, pero Yessica se puede mantener ante estas situaciones. Solicita el crédito para comprar más productos y poder aumentar el inventario de su negocio. Su sueño es poder llegar a tener una tienda de ropa y poder darle educación a sus 3 pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Buy new clothing to meet her clients' demands.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is 36 years old and she is a teacher. She's married and she has 2 sons who are at primary school. She owns her own home and it has electricity, water and a drainage system. Her home is in the district of Jr Bolognesi in the province of Yunguyo.

Due to her low income she also needs to do other things such as offering a photocopying service, a small bookshop (selling notebooks, folders, graph paper, pencils, ink pens, coloured pens, a variety of paper) from the school. This was a way of increasing her income.

To be able to increase merchandise she managed to join the group Banco Comunal Winay Marca which she has belonged to for some years. Her first credit was of $300 new soles which she invested in writing materials (packets of bond paper, writing books, ink pens, a variety of paper).

With the loan of $1000 (new soles) which she will pay back in 4 months, she will put in some phone booths for cellphone calls, and this will enable her to increase her income.

She has learned that women should be given their place, and her husband helps her a lot in the different activities that she does. Her vision is to buy a house in Tacna or Arequipa and a car so that her kids will get good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Consuelo tiene 36 años de edad, tiene como profesión profesora, es casada, tiene dos hijos varones, están en el nivel primario, casa propia cuenta con luz , agua y desague. Su domicilio esta ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo. Debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos, es que se vio obligada a desarrollar otras actividades como; servicios de fotocopiado y pequeña librería (venta de cuadernos, fólderes, papelógrafos, lapiceros, lápiz , plumones, colores, variedad de papeles) aun inicio dentro del pedagógico. Fue un medio para poder incrementar su ingreso. Para poder incrementar mercadería, logro integrar el Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca quien pertenece hace nueve años atrás, accediendo a un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en material de escritorio (paquetes de papel bond, cuadernos, plumones, variedad papelería). Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, instalará cabinas de locutorio para llamadas a celular, con esto incrementará un poco mas sus ingresos. Lo que aprendió es que las mujeres deben darse su lugar, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, en las diferentes actividades que realiza. Su visión futura comprar una casa en el departamento de Tacna o Arequipa, y un automóvil, darles una buena profesión a sus hijos.

loans.use: To put in phone booths/Instalación de cabinas para locutorio.

loans.name: Elena Rita

texts.es:
Since 1987 Elena Rita has been selling food, sweets and fruit in a school tuck shop at the Jose Galvez school. For 3 years she has been a member and the president of the group Banco Comunal Winay Marca where she had an initial credit of $300 new soles with which she bought fruit, sweets and biscuits which she sold at the school until 2007 when she retired. She now sells bicycles and rents out tricycles.

With this credit of $2000 new soles which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 10 bicycles which she will sell in the markets of Yunguyo, Chacachaca, Huapaca and Llaquepa.

Elena is very grateful for the credit and she will repay it punctually. She has learnt to keep working, start new businesses and to grow financially. The vision that she has is to keep going with her business and to be able to buy a car.

She is 60 years old and she studied until the third grade of primary school. She married young and had 3 kids who are now professional and who also live in Yunguyo.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elena Rita desde 1987 se dedico a la venta de comida, golosinas, frutas en la tienda escolar de la institución educativa José Gálvez; desde un inicio fue socia y presidenta durante tres años en el Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca, donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que compro frutas, golosinas, galletas, preparo comida dentro de la institución. hasta el año 2007 fecha en que se retiro de ese negocio. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de bicicletas y alquiler de triciclos. Con este crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 10 bicicletas aproximadamente, las cuales serán vendidas en la feria de Yunguyo, Chacachaca, Huapaca, Llaquepa. Elena esta muy agradecida, por el crédito se le dio, el cual paga puntualmente; también por que aprendió ha seguir trabajando, emprender nuevos negocios, crecer económicamente. La visión que tiene es seguir adelante con el negocio, asegurar su vejes con ese negocio y poder adquirir un carro. Su edad 60 años, logro estudiar hasta tercero de secundaria, muy joven se caso y tuvo tres hijos quienes también ya tiene su familia y son profesionales, viven en el mismo Yunguyo.

loans.use: To buy bicycles in bulk/Compra de bicicletas al por mayor.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Amelia is 46 years old and married with 4 children, all of whom are now independent. Her husband is already retired, but he works as a taxi driver in order to increase the family's earnings.

Rosa Amelia has a convenience store in her home with which she supports the family. They live in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, an area known for a high delincuency rate. Rosa wants to assure that her home and her business are secure, She is requesting a loan with which to buy a wooden door and wrought iron for a gate, in order to secure the entrance and give her peace of mind when she leaves the house empty.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa Amelia tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos que ya son independientes a ella. Su esposo ya está jubilado, pero trabaja en un vehículo taxi para percibir mayores ganacias para la familia.

Doña Rosa Amelia tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación con la que apoya a los gastos familiares. Habitan el barrio Villa Reconciliación lugar conocido por un índice delincuencial alto, y Doña Rosa desea asegurar su vivienda y su negocio, solicita el préstamo para comprar una puerta de madera y hierro para ponerle verjas y así asegurarla y darle mayor tranquilidad cuando ella sale y deja su casa sola.

loans.use: Reinforce the entrance to her home.

loans.name: Mariela Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa will finish her higher education studies this year. She is 21 and currently lives with her partner who is also studying. They rent a house and have basic services. They live in the district of Jr Grau in the province of Yunguyo.

She has been a member of the group Banco Comunal Winay Marca for 3 years, and has a loan of $300 new soles with which she bought a tricycle to rent out.

She now has a stationary store and with the credit of $1000 new soles which she will pay back in 4 months she will buy notebooks, pencils, pens, paper and ink pens. She will also offer a photocopying service.

Her vision is to work in her chosen profession, buy a house, start to rent out motorbike taxis and to open a bigger stationary store.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Mariela Luisa concluirá sus estudios superiores este fin de año, tiene 21 años de edad, actualmente convive con su pareja, quien también curso estudios superiores, el domicilio donde viven es alquilado, cuenta con servicios básicos, esta situado en el Jr. Grau del Distrito, Provincia de Yunguyo. Hace un año atrás llego a ser socia de banco comunal Wiñay Marca, teniendo un préstamo de S/: 300.00 nuevos soles , con lo que compro un triciclo, para que lo pueda alquilar. Actualmente tiene una librería y con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará cuadernos, lapiceros, papelería en general, plumones. Además prestará servicio de fotocopiado. El gran sueño que ella tiene trabajar en su profesión, comprar una casa, dedicarse al alquiler de moto taxis y apertura una tienda más grande de papelería.

loans.use: To buy stationary in bulk/Compra al por mayor de artículos de librería.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anatasia is the president of the group Banco Comunal Estrellitas del Sur and for 15 years she has been selling vegetables daily in the plaza 15 D. agosto square. At first she got a loan of $300 new soles with which she bought tomatoes, onion, carrots, spinach, celery, pumpkin etc in small quantities.

With the credit of $7000 soles which she will repay in 4 months she will buy vegetables in bulk.

Anastacia is very grateful for the loans she has received as they have helped her to increase merchandise and her income.

Anastacia is 40 years old and studied until fifth graD. of primary school. She has 4 kids who are studying, and is married - her husband supports her.

The dream that she has is that her kids will become professional, to buy more land and to keep going forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Anastacia es presidenta del Banco Comunal Estrellitas del Sur; hace quince años atrás se dedica a la venta D. verduras en la plaza 15 D. agosto, lo hace diariamente; cuando ella al inicio tuvo un préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra D. tomates, cebolla, zanahoria, espinaca, apio, zapallo, etc en poca cantidad. Con este crédito D. S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará verduras al por mayor. La señora Anastacia está muy agradecidas con los préstamos ya que le han permitido incrementar su mercadería y a la vez sus ingresos económicos. Anastacia tiene 40 años D. edad, estudio hasta el quinto D. primaria, tiene cuatro hijos quines estudian, es casada y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo. El sueño que ella tiene es que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar mas terrenos, y seguir trabajando.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk/Compra de verduras al por mayor.

loans.name: Dina Soledad

texts.es:
Dina Soledad is 26 years old and she studied until third grade of primary school. She speaks Spanish and is Aymara. She's single and she rents a house in the Jr Tarapaca district, in the province of Yunguyo.

Four years ago she opened a grocery store which was her mother's idea. She joined the group Banco Comunal Estrellita del Sur and got an initial loan of $300 soles with which she bought rice, noodles, soap, sugar and sweets.

She now rents out a cement mixer.

With the loan of $600 soles which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy a mixer.

Dina is very grateful for the credits as they have helped her to support herself. Her vision for the future is to have a huge grocery store, buy her own house with which to support her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Dina soledad tiene 26 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de primaria, habla el idioma castellano y aymará, es soltera, la casa donde vive es alquilada y esta ubicada en el Jr. Tarapacá Distrito, Provincia de Yunguyo. Ella nos cuenta que hace 4 años atrás, aperturó una tienda de abarrotes la cual fue idea de su mama; integrando al Banco Comunal Estrellita del Sur ,adquiriendo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 soles con lo que compro arroz, fideos, jabón, Azúcar, gaseosas. Actualmente se dedica ala actividad de alquiler de maquina mezcladora de cemento. Con este préstamo de S/.600.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará una máquina mezcladora. Dina esta muy agradecida por los créditos, además aprendió ha ser solidaria. Su visión futura es tener una gran tienda de abarrotes ,comprar su casa propia para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres .

loans.use: To buy a cement mixer/Compra de máquina mezcladora.

loans.name: Jhony Antonio

texts.es:
Jhonny Antonio is 28 years old. He works as a security guard and also, together with his wife, runs a clothing business. All of their work is motivated by the search for the best way to deal with their difficult economic situation.

Jhonny has a young son. With a lot of effort the couple pays for his education and they plan to continue doing so as long as they are able. Jhonny has been a security guard for 2 years and selling clothing for 1 year. They started the business with money the family had saved.

They would like to increase their inventory and will use this loan to buy women's and children's clothing, in order to offer a wider selection of products to their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jhonny Antonio tiene 28 años de edad se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, y también junto a su esposa administra un negocio de venta de ropa, todo esto en busca de poder sobrellevar la difícil situación económica.

Tiene un pequeño hijo al que con mucho esfuerzos le dan sus estudios y planean seguírselos dando mientras ellos puedan. Jhonny tiene 2 años de ser guarda de seguridad y un año de dedicarse a la venta de ropa. Empezaron el negocio con dinero ahorrado de la familia.

Desean aumentar el inventario de su negocio y con el préstamo comprará ropa de dama y niños para diversificar la oferta a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy clothing for women and children

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia has been selling mana, made from maize, noodles, wheat that she got from a factory 13 years ago, and she has a stall in the 15 de agosto market.

She is a member of the group Banco Comunal Estrellita del Sur where she had an initial loan of $300 soles which she invested in 2 and a half sacks of mana.

With the new credit of $500 soles which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 4 sacks of mana.

She tells us that the date when they meet to pay their quotas is a fun moment, they advise each other and are all very happy as she has her husband's support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Antonia se dedica a la venta de mana, hechos de maíz, fideos, trigo que lo adquiere directamente de la fabrica desde hace 13 años atrás, teniendo un puesto de venta en la plataforma del mercado 15 de agosto. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal Estrellita del Sur donde tuvo un préstamo inicial de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, que lo invirtió en la compra de dos sacos y medio de mana. Con este crédito de S/ 500 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 4 sacos de mana. Ella nos cuenta que la fecha en que se reúnen para el pago de sus cuotas es un momento de distracción, se aconsejan entre ellas y se sienten muy feliz por que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo .

loans.use: To buy mana (a type of cereal) in bulk/Compra al por mayor de mana (cereal)

loans.name: Yomeli Milagros

texts.es:
Yomely Milagros, 29 years old, managed to study up to high-school level. She is married with one son who is currently in primary school. Her house is rented, and has basic services. It's located on Independence Avenue in the district and province of Yunguyo.

Yomely offers her services in a beauty salon called “Yomely”: she cuts hair, offers waves, dyes, perms and styling. She is a member of the Community Bank “Villa Copacobana”, where she began with a loan of 300 soles which she invested in dyes, perming chemicals and curlers.

With this loan of 2300 soles, which she will repay within 4 months, she will buy gifts for birthdays, weddings and special events, and she will also invest in Avon and Esika beauty products. The idea emerged thanks to the customers who used to frequent the salon asking for these types of products: as a result she set-up a small gift shop in the same location as her beauty salon.

She is very happy and grateful for the obtained credits, because she has learnt to be both responsible and work in solidarity.

Her future ambition is to buy a house, have a larger store and give her son a good education.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Yomely Milagros, de 29 años de edad, logro estudiar superior técnico, es casada, tuvo un hijo varón el cual estudia en educación primaria, su casa es alquilada cuenta con los servicios básicos y esta ubicada en el Jr. Independencia del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo.

Ella presta servicios en un salón de Belleza “YOMELY” realizando cortes, ondulaciones, tintes, frisados, peinados. Integra en el Banco Comunal Villa Copacabana; donde inicio con un crédito de S/. 300.00 que lo invirtió en tintes, liquido para la ondulación y ruleros.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2300.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará regalos para cumpleaños, matrimonios y eventos especiales, también invertirá en productos de belleza de las marcas Avon y Esika. La idea surge debido a que los clientes que frecuentaban el salón pedían ese tipo de productos, motivo por el cual instaló una pequeña tienda de artículos para regalos en el mismo local del salón de belleza.

Ella se encentra muy contenta y agradecida por los créditos obtenidos, porque aprendió a ser responsable y solidaria.

Su visión futura comprar una casa, tener una tienda mas grande, darle una buen a educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Buy gift products.  Purchase beauty products.

loans.name: María Soledad

texts.es:
Maria is a 54 year old woman, born in 1953 in the province of Yunguyo and she managed to study up to the third graD. of secondary school. She is married, and has 8 children, 4 boys and 4 girls, who are all studying at different levels. She has her own house with complete basic services.

From when she was very young, Maria learnt from her mother how to make empanadas. She travelled, for reasons for work, to Lima, where she put even more effort into this activity. Then, on returning to her hometown, she didn't hesitate to set-up a Snack Bark, where she offers sandwiches, cakes, empanadas and a special fixed meal.

She is a member of the Community Bank, ““Wiñay Marca” , where she started with a loan of 300 soles, purchasing the ingredients needed to make empanadas such as flour, fat, eggs and sugar.

With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will buy rice, flour, fat, sugar, vegetables and potatoes wholesale. In this manner she will be able to expand her production.

Being a bank member has taught her to be reliable, responsible and organised in her business, and as a result she's very happy. Her future ambitions are that all her children become professionals and work. She will continue working in her business, as she can depend on her husband's help.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

María es una señora D. 54 años D. edad, nació en el año 1953 en la provincia D. Yunguyo y logró estudiar hasta el tercer grado D. secundaria, se casó tiene 8 hijos cuatro varones cuatro mujeres quienes están estudiando en diferentes niveles D. estudio, tiene una casa propia con los servicios básicos completos.

Ella desD. muy joven aprendió la elaboración D. empanadas D. parte D. su madre, viajo por motivos D. trabajo a la ciudad D. Lima, donD. puso mas empeño a esa actividad; pues al regresar a su tierra natal no dudó en instalar una Snack Bar, en donD. se atienD. desD. bocaditos, alfajores, empanadas y menú especial.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca” donD. inicio con un crédito D. S/. 300.00, comprando productos para la elaboración D. empanadas como harina, manteca, huevos y azúcar.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, harina, manteca, azúcar, verduras y papa al por mayor. D. esa manera incrementará su producción.

Siendo socia del banco comunal aprendió a ser cumplida, responsable y organizada en su negocio, por lo que esta muy contenta. La visión futura que tiene es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales y trabajen. Seguir trabajando en su negocio, para ella cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra was born in 1975 and today is 35 years old. She managed to complete her secondary school studies and is married to Jesús Calla Velásquez, 38 years old who is member of the National Police of Peru and they have three children, two daughters and one son, who are currently studying.

Sandra and her family live in a rented house with complete basic services. Previously she helped her mother in her restaurant, and there she learnt many business skills, so she decided to set-up her own business.

She managed to join the Community Bank “Villa Copacobana”, where she received a 300 sol loan which she invested in the sale of beauty products such as Avon, Esika, Unique (perfumes, jewellery, cosmetics etc.

With the loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy various products to stock her gift shop with presents for weddings, birthdays, and special occasions (utensil sets, stuffed toys, cards etc.) At the same time, in the afternoons she makes and sells bread.

She has learnt to be responsible and punctual. Her great wish is to build her house in Arequipa, so that her children can continue studying.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Nació en julio del año 1975 y hoy tiene 35 años vividos, logró concluir sus estudios secundarios y se Casó con don Jesús Calla Velásquez de 38 años de edad quien es miembro de la Policía Nacional del Perú con quien tienen tres hijos dos mujercitas y un varón, quines se encuentran estudiando.

Sandra y su familia viven en una casa alquilada con servicios básicos completos, pues anteriormente le ayudaba a su mamá en su restaurante, de allí aprendió las actividades de negocio entonces, decidió instalar su propio negocio.

Logro integrar al Banco Comunal “Villa Copacabana” donde accedió a un crédito de S/. 300.00 que lo invirtió en la venta de productos de belleza, cosméticos como Avon, Esika, Unique (perfumes, joyas, cosméticos).

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará diversos artículos para surtir su tienda de regalos para matrimonio, cumpleaños, y fechas especiales (juegos de utensilios, peluches, tarjetas etc.). Paralelamente, por las tardes elabora y vende panes.

Aprendió a ser responsable y puntual. Su gran anhelo es construir su casa en Arequipa, para que sus hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: Purchase gift shop products

loans.name: Johana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Johana del Socorro is 32 years old and lives in the René Cisneros neighborhood. She is a single mother who wants to offer her child and herself better quality of life.

She is a shopkeeper. She has a convenience store in her home which has been growing over the years, thanks to her good and organized management. At times, however, the lack of capital has made it difficult for her to offer a large inventory.

Her father gave her the financial support with which she started the business. Her future plans are to expand the business by offering a wider range of products. With the loan she will buy basic grains, cosmetics and clothing, all of which which help her increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Johana del Socorro tiene 32 años de edad, habita en el barrio René Cisneros es madre soltera de un menor de edad, al que desea darles las mejores condiciones de vida.

Es comerciante, tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación la que ha ido creciendo a través de los años, gracias a su buena y ordenada administración, aunque a veces se le dificulta por falta de capital para poder agrandar su inventario.

Su papá la apoyó económicamente para poder montar el negocio. Sus planes futuros son ampliar el negocio con una gama más grande de productos.Con el préstamo comprará granos básicos, cosméticos y ropa para tener mayores ingresos.

loans.use: To invest in basic grains, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Delfina Noemi

texts.es:
Doña Delfina Noemí has a well-established restaurant in Grau avenue in front of the principal square in Yunguyo where national and international tourists as well as workers from the different nearby organisations come to enjoy breakfasts, snacks and lunches that she prepares every day.

For many years, she used to sell food on the street: becoming a member of the Community Bank “Villa Copacabana", she received a loan of 300 soles, which she used to buy rice, oil, noodles and vegetables. With these her business expanded.

With this loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will buy the necessary ingredients to prepare extra dishes. Part of the loan will also be used to build her house.

Delfina is 62 years old, she managed to complete primary school She is married, and has three children (one son and two daughters), who are now independent.

She has learnt to be responsible, and wants to continue working, living happily. She would like to complete the construction of her house and see all her children find work.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Delfina Noemí tiene su restaurante muy bien instalada se ubica en el Jr. Grau frente a la Plaza principal de Yunguyo a donde llegan turistas nacionales, extranjeros y trabajadores de las diferentes instituciones que existe, donde acuden a degustar, desayunos extras y almuerzo que todos los días prepara.

Desde hace años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria ; siendo socia del Banco Comunal “Villa Copacabana” donde tuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compro arroz, aceite, fideos y verduras. Con lo que fue creciendo su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará los insumos necesarios para la preparación de platos extras. Parte del crédito está destinado a la construcción de su casa.

Delfina tiene 62 años de edad, logro estudiar primaria completa, casada, tuvo 3 hijos un varón un dos hijas mujeres quienes ya son independientes.

Ella aprendió a ser responsable, tener ganas para seguir trabajando, vive feliz, le gustaría terminar la construcción de su casa y que sus hijos tengan trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients.  House building.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca Q. Huayhua is 34 years old and was born on 29 May 1974. She managed to finish her secondary school studies and married Santiago Chávez, aged 37 and with superior qualifications. They have two children, one son and one daughter who are currently studying. The have their own home in the District and province of Yunguyo.

Blanca has made bread and empanadas for the last 17 years. She sells them in the same square and in different shops in the district. She is a member of the Community Bank, “Union 28 July”, where she received a loan of 300 soles, buying flour, sugar, fat and salt.

With this loan of 1600 soles, which she will repay in 3 months, she will buy six bags of flour, fat and wood, and in this way she will increase her productivity and her income.

She has learn to be responsible in her repayments and work in solidarity. Blanca's ambition is to own a larger bakery, so she can give her children a good education.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Blanca Q. Huayhua tiene 34 años de edad nació un 29 de mayo del año 1974 y logró terminar sus estudios secundarios y se casó con don Santiago Chávez de 37 años de edad con instrucción superior, tienen dos hijos un varón y una mujercita quienes actualmente se encuentran estudiando. Con domicilio propio en el Distrito, provincia de Yunguyo.

Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes y empanadas desde hace ya 17 años; vendiéndolos en la misma plaza y en las diferentes tiendas del distrito; integra el Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio” donde tuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 adquiriendo harina, azúcar, manteca, sal.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,600.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 3 meses, comprará seis sacos de harina, azúcar, manteca y leña, de esa manera incrementará su producto y su ingreso económico.

Aprendió a ser responsable en sus pagos y solidaria la visión que ella tiene es tener una panadería mas grande, poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta has five children, two boys and three girls. She is married to Aurelio P. who is 60 years old. Their house is located on Tupac Amaru avenue in the district and province of Yunguyo.

She has run a grocery store for the last six years. She is a member of the Community Bank “Small southern star”, who also provided her with a 300 sol loan in order to buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar and a half box of eggs.

With this loan of 1500 soles, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will buy various products to stock up her grocery store.

She recounts that at the moment of meeting to repay, they share experiences and it is a moment of happiness, where she learnt to be responsible.

She wants to continue working as long as her strength and health allow her to.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Tiene cinco hijos dos varones y tres mujeres se casó con don Aurelio P. quien tiene 60 años D. edad actualmente, su casa está ubicada en Jr. Túpac Amaru del distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo.

El negocio al que se dedica es la Venta D. Abarrotes, desD. hace seis años; es socia del Banco Comunal “Estrellita del Sur” quien también saco un crédito inicial D. S/. 300.00 para poder comprar un saco D. arroz, un saco D. azúcar y media caja D. huevo.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará diversos productos para surtir su tienda D. abarrotes.

Ella cuenta que al momento D. reunirse a pagar comparten experiencias, es momento D. alegría, donD. aprendió a ser cumplida.

Quiere seguir trabajando hasta donD. su fuerza y la vida lo permitan.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale various products (groceries)

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is a self-sacrificing mother of 3 girls who are very young and they are the reason Doris makes such an effort with her work every day. She sells fruit ice lollies which she makes in her own home. They are very popular as she lives in a very hot area. With her earnings from this business, Doris can pay for the daily needs of her family.

One of her wishes is to be able to save up enough money to build her own house as she and her daughters currently live in one made of pre-fabricated materials.

This mother turns to you for a loan which she will invest in her business - in the purchase of fruit and the little bags she uses to produce the ice lollies. She hopes that little by little she can save up enough to build her very own home.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Doris es una madre abnegada de 3 niñas que están aún muy pequeñas, y son el motivo por el cual Doris se esfuerza cada día trabajando.Ella se dedica a la venta de chupetes de fruta (hielo), que fabrica en su propia casa y su consumo es muy común porque vive en una zona muy calurosa.Con las ganancias de este oficio, Doris puede pagar el costo diario de las necesidades de su familia. Y uno de sus deseos es poder ahorrar para construir su casa, ya que ella y sus hijas viven en un ambiente de material prefabricado.Esta madre recurre a ustedes para solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de fruta y las bolsitas para la fabricación de sus chupetes. Espera que poco a poco pueda ahorra para construir su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for the production of fruit ice lollies

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana is 43 years old and provides internet services at her internet cafe where customers can use a computer and the internet for a fee. A short time ago, she began her business with only 4 computers, and now she feels proud of her business' growth, having more than 10 computers. Through this service Viviana makes life easier for the people in her area. However, she doesn't want to remain only here, she has set her sights on other businesses as well. She is also the owner of a motorcycle taxi, and counts on the unconditional support of her husband who drives the taxi. Viviana is the mother of four children, 2 of which are on their own and 2 of which are students, and she would like to see them have a good professional future. It is for that reason that she works hard to provide them with whatever they need. Viviana requests this loan in order to expand and improve the condition of her store. Please support this dedicated mother who is working arduously to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Viviana tiene 43 años, ella brinda los servicios de cabinas de Internet desde hace poco tiempo, ella empezó en este negocio con sólo 4 computadoras, ahora cuenta con más de 10 máquinas y se siente orgullosa de su crecimiento. Viviana, mediante este servicio brinda muchas facilidades a las personas de su entorno, sin embargo no sólo quiere quedarse ahí ya que tiene visiones para otros negocios. A la vez es propietaria de un motocarro y para ello cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo quien se dedica a manejar la moto. La señora Viviana es madre de 4 hijos, siendo 2 de ellos independientes y los dos últimos estudiantes, a los mismos que quiere ver en un futuro buenos profesionales, es por eso que trabaja duro para brindarles lo necesario. Viviana quiere ampliar y mejorar las condiciones de su local y para esto es que solicita el préstamo. Apoyen a esta madre emprendedora y decidida, que trabaja arduamente por salir adelante.

loans.use:
To expand and improve the atmosphere of her store where she provides public internet access and use of computers (cabinas de Internet).

Ampliar y mejorar el ambiente de su local donde brinda el servicio de cabinas públicas de internet.

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
Marvin José's goals are to complete the construction of his home and to move his business ahead.

He lives in the Hialeah neighborhood and is married with three children. Fifty percent of the loan will be used to buy the zinc and rafters he will use to replace the roof of his home, which is in poor condition and needs to be changed before winter.

Marvin's wife is a storekeeper and supports her husband in the family's business activities. They have a convenience store and also offer cell phones and video games for rent. They started out 8 years ago selling various products from their house and over time they have been able to expand the business. Because they want to increase their sales volume, the other fifty percent of the loan will be used to buy merchandise to invest in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Las metas de Marvin José son poder terminar de construir su vivienda y sacar adelante su negocio.

Habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casado y tiene tres hijos, el 50 % del monto del crédito será usado para comprar zinc y perlines y cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación, que está en malas condiciones y debido al invierno necesita ser cambiado.

La esposa de Marvin es comerciante y apoya a su marido en las actividades que realizan. Tienen una pulpería, alquilan teléfono y alquilan video juegos. Iniciaron hace 8 años comercializando productos varios en su hogar y a través del tiempo han podido crecer. Desean incrementar el volumen de ventas, es por eso que el otro 50 % del préstamo será destinado para compra de productos e invertirlos en su negocio.

loans.use: To invest in his business and in his home.

loans.name: Lizzeth Margarita

texts.es:
Lizeth is 30 years old and married with 2 children, a 12 year old daughter and a 7 year old son. She and her husband want to give their children a good education and ensure them a bright future.

Lizeth works selling clothing and cometics; she also works as a domestic employee three days a week. She has 11 years of experience in sales. When she started the business she sold only cosmetics. She plans to one day open a store. With this loan she will expand her inventory by buying gold plated jewelry, as a way to begin to put together her store little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Lizeth tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, una niña de 12 años y un varón de 7 años, a los que como todo padre desea darles estudios y asegurarles un futuro mejor.

Lizeth se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos y tres días a la semana labora como empleada doméstica. Tiene 11 años de experiencia en las ventas e inició vendiendo solamente cosméticos. Sus planes son llegar a poner una tienda, con el crédito otorgado expandirá su oferta, comprará oro laminado para empezar la comercialización de éste y así empezar a formar su tienda poco a poquito.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry, such as gold plated items.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, age 45, is the mother of 4 children, 3 of them being independent and her youngest daughter at home. Her youngest daughter is the reason Julia continues moving forward. For some time, Julia has been selling water, which she distributes to the people living in her area. Julia is very active and hardworking, therefore she wants to continue with this business which has proven very profitable. Aside from this business of selling water she is also contracting the construction of rooms for rent, and all of this is done for the well-being of her daughter, to whom she wishes to give everything needed to get ahead. Julia wants to provide water to a large sector of people through a network of tubing for which she needs two generators and for which also requires some capital which will help her complete her proposal. We support this mother, who, with care and dedication is working hard to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Julia de 45 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, siendo 3 de ellos ya independientes y quedando la última de sus hijas quien es la razón de seguir adelante, ella desde hace tiempo se dedica a la venta de agua, que distribuye a las personas que colindan por su alrededor, la señora Julia es muy activa y trabajadora, por eso quiere continuar en este negocio ya que le parece muy rentable. Aparte de su negocio de venta de agua está mandando a construir habitaciones para alquiler, y todo esto lo hace por el bienestar de su hija, a quien quiere darle todo lo necesario para que salga adelante. Julia quiere brindar agua a un gran sector de personas por medio de red tubular por lo que necesita de dos generadores y para ello requiere de un capital el cual ayudará a cumplir con su propósito. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esmero y dedicación lucha duro por salir adelante.

loans.use:
Purchase of 2 generators in order to provide water to a greater number of people in her area.

Compra de dos generadores para brindar agua a más cantidad de personas de su localidad.

loans.name: Egna

texts.es:
Egna is 32 years old and has 3 children that she strongly supports with their studies. She has a popsicle business which supplements her job as a janitor in a radio station. Her popsicles are prepared with the utmost care as her main clients are children. Mrs. Egna tells us that nothing is impossible if you want to get ahead and even more if you have a family to support. She feels blessed to have two wonderful, understanding children and she shows no signs of fatigue...as she says "to get ahead you´ve got to fight hard".

Egna wants to keep growing her business and needs the microloan to build a refreshment stand for her weekend sales.

With your help, Mrs.Egna will achieve her goals in a short span of time.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Construction of a refreshment stand.

loans.name: Antonia Digna

texts.es:
Antonia R. works selling all kinds of shoes, including formal shoes, sandals and women's thong sandals. She started the business 4 years ago and over the years has acquired the experience she needs to manage her business successfully. She is now able to recognize which models of shoes will sell well and which will not.

Because she wants to increase her sales volume she will use the loan to buy new shoe designs, models she believes will sell well, in order to offer new products to her clients. Antonia is married with an 11 year old son; her husband is a bricklayer. They hope to be able to complete the construction of their home soon.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Antonia R. se dedica a la venta de calzados, entre los cuales se encuentran zapatos, sandalias y chinelas. Empezó esta actividad hace 4 años y en este tiempo ha adquirido experiencia para poder administrar el negocio, ahora sabe distinguir los modelos que podrían venderse y los que no.

Desea incrementar el volumen de ventas y con el crédito comprará nuevos diseños de zapatos para tener una nueva oferta para sus clientes. Antonia es casada su esposo es albañil tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad y espera poder terminar de construir su humilde hogar.

loans.use: To buy a new model of sandals to sell

loans.name: Reynelda De Los Ange

texts.es:
Reynelda is 43 years old and married and lives with her husband in the Hialeh neighborhood. Her husband sells soft drinks and baked goods in a school in the city. They have 2 daughters, aged 16 and 14, and a 12 year old son.

The family's immediate desire is to be able to remodel their house in order to make it a more comfortable home for the children. Reynelda has a convenience store in the house and also sells barbecued meats 3 times a week.

She started her business with just the convenience store but thanks to a little saved capital she was able to start selling barbecue. Her future plans for the business include diversifying her products and capturing a new segment of the market. With the loan she will buy basic grains, personal care products and vegetables for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Reynelda tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah es casada, su esposo es comerciante de refrescos y repostería en un colegio de la ciudad. Tiene dos hijas de 16 y 14 años y un varón de 12 años.

Los planes para su familia son poder remodelar su hogar a fin de brindarles comodidad a sus hijos. Reynelda tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación y vende asados 3 veces a la semana.

Comenzó con la pulpería, pero gracias a un poco de capital ahorrado pudo iniciar sus ventas de asados. Los planes futuros para su negocio son diversificar el producto y obtener un nuevo segmento de mercado. Con el crédito comprará granos básicos, productos de aseo personal y verduras para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, vegetables and personal care products

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es:
Alma Nidia works selling tortillas she makes herself. She also sells firewood and sells prepared meals to construction workers, although tortilla sales are the most important part of her business.

Alma Nidia has been in this business for 6 years; along the way she struggled due to the lack of financing available to the food sector. She has now been working with AFODENIC for several years, and has been able to invest more in her business thanks to the loans she's received.

She began the business selling only tortillas and has now been able to diversify her business a little more, although she still needs to expand her client base in order to improve her profitability. She will use this loan to buy corn and firewood, basic raw materials for the production of tortillas and prepared meals.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma Nidia se dedica a la venta de tortillas que ella misma produce. La venta de tortillas es su actividad más fuerte, aunque también vende leña y hace comida de venta para trabajadores de la construcción.

Tiene 6 años en el negocio y se le ha hecho difícil debido a la falta de financiamiento para este secto, hace algunos años trabaja con AFODENIC y ha podido invertir más a su negocio.

Empezó vendiendo tortillas y ya pudo diversificar su oferta un poco más, aunque necesita mayor captación de clientes para así ser más rentable. El préstamo lo usará en compras de maíz y leña, granos básicos para elaboración de tortillas y comidas

loans.use: Purchase corn and firewood

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim T., 43, earns $3 per day selling flowers that she purchases from growers and then resells at her local market. Her husband, 43, is a motorcycle-taxi driver and earns about $5 per day. They have six children, and they live in Trapeang Reang Village, Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.

Mrs. T. is requesting a loan so that she can purchase more flowers to sell. In addition, she plans to use part of the loan to purchase a second hand motorcycle for family use. The motorcycle will also allow her to more easily transport her goods to and from the market.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more flowers to sell and a second hand motorcycle for family use

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon C. and her husband, Mr. Nhong Heak, are grocers in Roka Tong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Because sometimes their customers buy on credit, Mrs. Yon C. does not have enough money to purchase inventory for her store. Thus, Mrs. Yon C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more goods for the grocery store.

Mrs. Yon C. is 53 and the mother of three children. One child is employed in a garment factory, another is a firewood seller. The youngest child is attending school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the grocery store.

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en:
Mrs. Kolab K. is a villager in Roka Tong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a beauty salon. Her husband, Mr. Chanimul Pok, is a rice wine maker and a pig breeder. Since Mr. Chanimul Pok’s two businesses are going very well, he wants to expand them. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Kolab K., decided to ask for a loan to buy rice and piglets for her husband businesses.

Mrs. Kolab K. is 27 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Kolab K. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice and piglets for her husband's businesses.

loans.name: Bi

texts.en: Mr. Bi P. is a rice farmer in Chy Prong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Kith Un, is in the pig breeding business. They have a child who is too young to work or attend school. Since land prices in Cambodia are going up quickly, Mr. Bi P. wants to buy a piece of land and resell it later at a better price. Unfortunately, Mr. Bi P. does not have enough money to afford it. Therefore, he has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. His wife is shown on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land and resell it at a better price.

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Po S., 30, is a bricklayer as well as a farmer, and his wife is a garment worker. Their combined income is $3 per day. They have three children and live in Khsom Village, Kandal Province, Cambodia. Mr. S. wishes to expand his farming business, so he is requesting a loan of $700 US. He will use the loan to purchase an ox, which will be used for plowing his fields. The loan will enable him to expand his farming business and thereby increase his family’s income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase one ox, which will be used for plowing his fields

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem C., 47, is a farmer and her husband is tuk-tuk taxi driver. (The tuk-tuk is a type of motorized 3-wheeled vehicle.) The couple lives in Khsom Village, Kandal Province, Cambodia. Mrs. C. earns about $2 per day and her husband earns $3.50 per day. They have seven children, one of whom is married. Her two sons who work as bricklayers in Phnom Penh also help with the family’s expenses.

Because of her desire to expand her husband’s business, Mrs. C. is asking for a loan so her husband can purchase a new trailer for his tuk-tuk. The new trailer will allow him to attract more customers and thereby increase his earnings as a tuk-tuk driver.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for her husband's tuk-tuk

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of G. R., and she has been living in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan for the last 16 years. She is the mother of six children: five sons and one daughter. Her oldest son completed his studies through 12th standard (grade) and then went abroad to work in Saudi Arabia. Her husband is a driver, and he has been in this profession for the last 8 years. Razia baji is a housewife, and she takes care of her children. She has already successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan): she bought a vehicle with the loan proceeds from the first loan, and she bought tires for that vehicle with proceeds from the second loan. Now, she is applying for a loan for her younger son; more specifically, her son works as a loader (i.e., he transports materials in a truck or van), and he is in need of this loan so that he can purchase another vehicle (a Mazda) for loading purposes.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Zeba baji, who seeks a loan for her juice carton business; (2) Shamim baji, who requests a loan to buy fruit; (3) Farhat baji, who is in need of a loan for her bookshop; and (4) Manzooran baji, who asks for a loan in order to buy electric supplies for her electric shop.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing a vehicle, fruit, electric supplies, etc.)

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji is the wife of A. N., and she has lived in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan for the last 20 years. She owns a two-room brick house, and she is the mother of five children: four daughters and one son. Her oldest daughter is married, and her next oldest daughter completed her education though the 8th standard (grade) level. She has already successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and she is now applying for a loan for her husband. More specifically, A. N. has a business of buying and selling motorbikes, so he is seeking to expand his business by purchasing another motorbike.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Zubaida baji, who seeks a loan to expand her food business; (2) Parveen baji, who requests a loan to buy a sewing machine; (3) Nasreen baji, who is in need of a loan to expand her paint business; and (4) Sugran baji, who would like a loan to buy, grow, and sell wheat.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing a motorbike and other materials)

loans.name: Rashda's Group

texts.en:
Rashda baji is the wife of L. A., and they live in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her oldest two children are in 3rd standard (grade), while the next three children are in kindergarten. Her husband is a fruit seller, and he has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Rashidan baji is a housewife, and she takes care of her children. She has already successfully repaid her prior loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and she is now applying for a loan for her husband. More specifically, her husband uses a vehicle to go to the city to buy fruit, but he needs a loan in order to repair his vehicle.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Farhat baji, who seeks a loan to expand her hair salon/barber shop; (2) Jamila baji, who requests a loan to expand her grocery store; and (3) Nazia baji, who is in need of a loan to expand her repair workshop business.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., to repair a vehicle, to expand their shops, etc.)

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. A., and they live in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, and they have been living in this house for the last 16 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. All of her daughters are in kindergarten. Her husband runs a cafeteria. She has already successfully repaid two previous loans she received from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and she is now applying for a third loan for her husband so that he may expand his cafe business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Asia baji, who seeks a loan to diversify her grocery shop; (2) Zainab baji, who requests a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle); and (3) Khursheed baji, who is in need of a loan to buy animals to resell.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing grocery products, a rickshaw, and animals)

loans.name: Babara's Group

texts.en:
Babara baji is the wife of Nazir A., and they live in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is the mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Her daughter is 4 years old, and her son is 1 years old. Her husband is a driver, and he has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Babara baji is a housewife, and she states that she truly enjoys house-related work and taking care of the children. She is applying for a loan for her husband so that he may buy his own auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Asia baji, who seeks a loan to buy animals to resell; (2) Razia baji and (3) Bushra baji, both of whom request loans to expand their scrap businesses; and (4) Najma baji, who is in need of a loan to expand her fruit business.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing a rickshaw, animals, fruit, etc.)

loans.name: Hurinisso

texts.ru:
Hurinisso U. lives in the Bokhtar district in southwest Tajikistan. She is 26 years old, divorced and has one child. In order to support her family Hurinisso works as a seamstress in the local clothing factory. She purchases fabric and makes national Tajik clothing for sale. Hurinisso wants to take out this loan in order to purchase raw materials for her business, so that she can work efficiently, and also increase the number of items she will have available for sale. The loan will also allow the local population to purchase national dress at a reasonable price from a local business. Hurinisso will pay back the credit in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Усмонова Хуриниссо проживает в Бохтарском районе. Возраст 26 лет. Разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Длятогочтобы прокормить семью она работает портнихой в швейном цеху. Покупает ткань и шьет национальные платья для продажи. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить материал . Это поможет ей работать без перебоев. А так же увеличить объем продаваемой продукции. Кроме того услуги , которые она оказывает помогает населению покупать платья по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит Хуриниссо планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Mahmadnazar

texts.ru:
Mahmadnazar B. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 63 years old, married and has six children. Mahmadnazar has a college degree in education and works as a teacher in the local school. To supplement the family income he also grows wheat and other grains. Mahmadnazar wants to take out a loan to finance the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for the next growing season. He also wants to purchase fuel for his equipment. The loan will guarantee that Mahmadnazar will be able to buy the best quality seeds for his fields and collect a quality harvest next year. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Бекназаров Махмадназар житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 63 года , женат и имеет 6 детей. Имеет высшее образование . Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того работает у себя на участке, который засеивает пшеницей , другими злаковыми культурами. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. А так же хочет закупить ГСМ. Это поможет ему без проблем купить качественные семена. Таким образом он сможет получить качественный урожай. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en:
