Rafia baji is the wife of K. M., and they live in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is originally from another city in Pakistan known as Sahiwal, but she moved to Chichawatni 3 years ago. She is the mother of two sons: her oldest son is in kindergarten, while the other son is not of school-going age. Her husband has an oil change (for motor vehicles) business, whereby he collects oil from different places and then sells such oil and/or uses it to service his customers with oil changes (which he does himself). Rafia baji is hereby applying for a loan to buy more oil for her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Naziran baji, who seeks a loan for her grocery shop; (2) Hanifan baji, who requests a loan to buy a donkey cart; (3) Parveen baji, who is in need of a loan to buy electric materials such as switches and lights for her electric shop; and (4) Shamim baji, who asks for a loan for her utensils business.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their businesses (e.g., by purchasing oil, grocery products, a donkey car, electric materials, and utensils)

loans.name: Jamilya

texts.ru:
Jamilya B. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. She is 34 years old, married and has three children. Jamilya has no formal education but to support her family she sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. Jamilya has been managing her stand for the last four years and in order to increase goods turnover she wants to take out a loan of 3500 somoni for 15 months. This will help her improve her business, attract new clients and will result in additional income for herself and her family.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Базарова Джамиля проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 34 года , замужем и имеет троих детей. Образования не имеет , но для т ого , чтобы обеспечить сою семью работает на базаре. Имеет торговую точку , где торгует овощами и фруктами. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 4 года. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот хочет получить кредит в размере 3500 сомони сроком на 15 месяцев. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов, а это приведет к получению дополнительной прибыли.

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia baji is the wife of M. M.Yaqoob, and they live in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a school near her neighborhood. Asia baji and her husband have a dream to provide each of their children with a good education. Her husband is a mason, but he also has a business whereby he sells masonry tools. Now, she is applying for a loan for her husband so that he can expand and improve his business enterprise.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Kosar baji, who seeks a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer; (2) Shafqat baji, who requests a loan for her garment business; and (3) Zareena baji, who is in need of a loan for her scrap work.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing seeds, fertilizer, materials for a garment business, etc.)

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is the wife of A. Hamid, and she lives in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is the mother of eleven children: ten daughters and one son. Her oldest daughter is married. Her husband is a laborer: he is hired to carry or move items, for construction work, etc. She has already successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). In practice, Sakina baji takes care of other people’s land and she does house-related work. Now, she is applying for a loan for her husband so that he can buy a cart to lift heavy items.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Shazia baji, who seeks a loan to expand her children's garment business; (2) Allah Rakhi baji, who requests a loan to buy masonry tools for her husband’s business; (3) Ameeran baji, who asks for a loan to buy a donkey cart; and (4) Razia baji, who wants a loan for her food business.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing carts, materials for a garment business, masonry tools, and food)

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru:
Safarmo Z. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. She is 48 years old and has seven children. She lives alone with her children and works long hours in order to feed them - she sells bread at the local market. Safarmo purchases bread wholesale from the local bakers and sells it at the market for a higher price. This business provides her with an income but it is barely sufficient to feed her family. In order to increase the amount of goods she sells and so increase the earnings from her business Safarmo would like to take out this loan. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Зоитова Сафармо проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 48 лет и имеет семерых детей. Живет одна , вместе с детьми. Поэтому ей приходится много работать для того , чтобы прокормить свою семью и своих детей. Работает на базаре. Торгует лепешками. Покупает у производителей и продает по более прибыльной цене. Этот бизнес дает ей доход позволяющий ей еле прокормить свою семью. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот хочет получить кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase of goods turnover

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is the wife of Z. A., and they have been living in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan for the last 16 years. She is the mother of ten children: seven daughters and three sons. All of her children received education through 7th standard (grade). One of her daughters is married; her oldest son buys beans and resells them, while her other two sons work in a factory. She has already successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), which she used to purchase an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her oldest son's business. Now, she is applying for a loan for her younger son, who is 25 years old and who wants to drive an auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Khursheed baji, who wants a loan to buy vegetables; (2) Hanifan baji, who seeks a loan to buy masonry tools; and (3) Fozia baji, who requests a loan for her husband, a tailor that is in need of an over-lock machine (a type of sewing machine).

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing a rickshaw, vegetables, masonry tools, and a sewing machine)

loans.name: Rajabmo

texts.ru:
Rajambo A. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 43 years old, married and has four children. Rajambo has finished nursing school and currently works as a nurse at the local hospital. On the side she also manages a small business - a sale stand at the local market, where she sells children's clothes. Rajambo wants to purchase school supplies in time for the beginning of the local school year. However, in order to have sufficient funds for the purchase she needs to take out this loan. This loan will enable Rajambo to earn money during the back to school sale season. She will use the income to support her family and will also invest in her business. Rajambo is planning to pay back the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Алназарова Раджабмо жительница города Курган-тюбе. Возраст 43 года . Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Закончила медицинское училище. Работает медсестрой в поликлинике. Кроме того занимается мелким бизнесом. Работает на базаре. Имеет торговую точку , где продает детскую одежду. Хочет привезти школьный товар к школьной ярмарке. Но для этого сначала она должна получить кредит, который даст ей возможность заработать в сезон школьной продажи. Прибыль полученную от торговли использует в хозяйстве , а часть для увеличения бизнеса. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan baji is the wife of M., and she lives in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, and she has been living in this house for the last 20 years. She is the mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Her daughter sews clothes, while her son washes clothes. Her husband owns and operates a cigarette shop. She has already successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and she is now applying for a loan for her husband so that he can diversify his cigarette business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Bushra baji, who seeks a loan to expand her cosmetics business; and (2) Safia baji, who requests a loan to buy a donkey cart.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing a donkey cart or cosmetics)

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng S., 57, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her five children. She sells food from her bicycle stand. She typically makes $5 USD each day as she travels around and selling vegetables, pork, and beef from her bicycle. She has had this business for the last eight years. Her family is also aided by the support of two of the children who work in construction and use their income to help the rest of the family.

Cheng S. believes that she has a very good business, but that she could increase her income if she was able to access more customers. The best way for her to access more customers is for her to upgrade her bicycle to a motorbike. She has asked for a loan of $900 USD to make this investment. She anticipates a great improvement in her business and looks forward to seeing the return on her investment.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike to use as a portable food stand

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny H., 35, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, with her husband, Mul Saret, and their five children. Three of their children are in the local schools and the other two are employed and helping to support the family. One works in the local garment factory and the other is a part of a construction business.

Ny H. works out in the fields as a farmer and typically makes $2 USD each day. Her husband is a fisherman and makes $3 USD each day.

She has asked for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a tractor to plow the family’s farm land, thus eliminating the expense of renting a tractor every year. She can also earn extra income by renting her newly purchased tractor to other people in her village who need their land plowed . She sees this as a valuable investment for her future and that can save the family money right away.

loans.use: Purchase tractor

loans.name: Sreyry

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyry N. and her husband Chheang Nhean are subsistence farmers who raise pigs and cows in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. They have five children. Three of their children attend school. The other two are too young to work or study. Mrs. Sreyry N. now has insufficient money to buy a pig and a cow and food to feed them. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Previously, Mrs. Sreyry N. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy a motorbike for transport purposes. Last year, some of Mrs. Sreyry N.’s children got dengue fever and she spent $500 to cure them. This is one of the reasons that Mrs. Sreyry N. does not have enough money to buy animal food. Mrs. Sreyry N. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a pig and a cow and food to feed them.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat S. lives in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and a widow with four children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. The other two attend school.

Mrs. Phat S.’s family lives under poor conditions. She wants to start a cow breeding business to improve her family’s life. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for this purpose.

loans.use: To start a cow breeding business to improve her family’s life.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 46, lives with her husband, Bou Tha, their two children, and their niece in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Their niece works in a local garment factory and helps to support the family with her income. Leng S. operates a small karaoke business in her village and makes $5 USD each day. Her husband operates a motortaxi service can typically make $2.50 USD each day.

The family believes that it is running a successful karaoke business and would like to investment to improve their equipment. Leng S. has asked for a loan of $600 USD to invest in her karaoke business and would like to see her income increased as a result. She sees a lot of potential in her small business and is grateful for the opportunities that this loan presents.

loans.use: Invest in karaoke business

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy S. is a villager in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Virak Svay, is a construction worker. They have three children. All three are too young to work or attend school.

In order to travel to work easily, Mrs. Sophy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to use for work. In the past, Mrs. Sophy S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. She has fully paid off her original loan. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use for work.

loans.name: Sreychen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreychen K. lives in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a garment worker who makes a small salary. Her husband Mr. Vanna Pov owns a small rice field where he cultivates both rice and vegetables. Mr. Vanna Pov now faces a small problem because he does not have enough draft animals to plow his rice field. Thus, Mrs. Sreychen K. decided to ask for a loan to buy another cow to plow her husband’s plantation.

Mrs. Sreychen K. is 24 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. So far, Mrs. Sreychen K. has obtained a loan to buy piglets for breeding, which she has already paid off. Mrs. Sreychen K. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy another cow to plow her husband’s plantation.

loans.name: Heanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Heanh L. and her husband Mr. Nguon Hem are subsistence farmers in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They have seven children. One child is employed in a garment factory. Three other children attend the local school. The remaining three are too young to work or enroll in school.

Although the family members have different business activities, they still live under poor conditions. Thus, Mrs. Heanh L. has asked for a loan to start a grocery business and to buy fertilizers for her rice field. Previously, Mrs. Heanh L. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. She has fully paid off this loan. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To start a grocery business and to buy fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng S., 25, collects recyclable items in Kampong Cham and typically makes US$3 each day. She lives with her husband, Ngan Seth, and they have four young children. Her husband operates a motortaxi service and makes US$5 each day. Her husband has a good business, but his old motorbike is creating a lot of unnecessary expenses and is hindering his ability to earn more income. Eng S. has asked for a loan of US$800 to replace her husband’s motorbike and to make an investment in her husband’s business. She sees this loan as a great opportunity for her family to increase its income and improve its standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase new motorbike

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng S., 25, collects recyclable items in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, and typically makes $3 USD each day. She lives with her husband, Ngan Seth, and their four young children.

Her husband operates a motortaxi service and makes $5 USD each day. Her husband has a good business, but his old motorbike is creating a lot of unnecessary expenses and is hindering his ability to earn more income.

Eng S. has asked for a loan of $800 USD to replace her husband’s motorbike and to make an investment in her husband’s business. She sees this loan as a great opportunity for her family to increase its income and improve its standard of living.

Eng S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Ngan Seth, appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Purchase new motorbike

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla K. is 28-years-old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending school. The other children are too young to work or study. Mrs. Phalla K. and her husband Mr. Loeurng Sam are farmers. The soil on their plantation field is infertile, so Mrs. Phalla K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers so that she can grow rice. In the past, Mrs. Phalla K. obtained a loan to buy piglets for breeding. She has paid off this loan.

Last year, one of Mrs. Phalla K.’s children got dengue fever. She had to spend $500 to cure her child, which is part of the reason she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers for the field. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers so that she can grow rice.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat N. is a farmer in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. She now faces a small problem because Mrs. Phat N. does not have enough cows to plow her rice field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy another cow. Mrs. Phat N. purchased their first cow to plow the field through a loan from AMK.

Mrs. Phat is a 49-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the two others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy another cow to help the old cow plow the field.

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Yuon Y., 39, is a construction worker in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, and typically makes $2 USD each day. Her husband, Ly Sokva, and their son also work in construction and make around $2.50 USD each day. They have four children and the other three are still in the local schools.

Rising inflation has affected many Cambodian families over this past year and this family has been figuring out ways to decrease their expenses and save more money. Yuon Y. has asked for a loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorbike for her family to commute to work each day. This will cut down on the family’s public transportation costs and will allow them to save money to be used for other needs.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Chetra

texts.en:
Mrs. Chetra N. is a villager in Trapaing Ronas in Kampong Speu Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Since her business activity is going well, Mrs. Chetra N. wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her current business. Her husband, Mr. Doeurn Pok, is a soldier who earns a small salary.

Mrs. Chetra N. is 39-years-old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Chetra N. obtained a loan to buy piglets for breeding. She has fully paid off this loan. Mrs. Chetra N. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her current business in order to expand it.

loans.name: Phavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phavy K. is a subsistence farmer and pig breeder in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. She now faces a small problem because she does not have enough animals to plow her rice field. Thus, Mrs. Phavy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy another cow. Her husband, Mr. Ry Kruk, uses a motorbike with a cart to transport villagers and goods for a profit.

Mrs. Phavy K. is a 36-year-old mother of six children, one of whom is employed at a garment factory while two others are attending the local school. The remaining three are too young to work or enroll in school. So far, Mrs. Phavy K. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy another cow to plow the field.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan S., 35, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, with her husband, Seng Ly Heng, and their four children. One of their daughters works in a local garment factory and helps to support the family, while Ngan S. sells fish in the food market. She typically makes $5 USD each day. Her husband operates a motortaxi service and his income varies each day.

Rising inflation has affected many Cambodian families over this past year and this family has been figuring out ways to decrease their expenses and save more money. Ngan S. has asked for a loan of $700 USD to purchase a motorbike for her family to commute to work each day. This will cut down on the family’s public transportation costs and will allow them to save money to be used for other needs.

Ngan S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Seng Ly Heng, appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Purchase new motorbike

loans.name: Navin

texts.en:
Mrs. Navin V. lives in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and grocer. Her husband, Mr. Von At, is a village chief and he usually helps his wife on the rice field too. They have three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest is enrolled in school.

Although Mrs. Navin V.’s family members have different business activities, they still live under poor conditions. Thus, Mrs. Navin V. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Previously, Mrs. Navin V. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her grocery business. She has fully paid off her original loan. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Kai

texts.en:
Kai T. lives with her husband, Mao Eng, in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has been traveling around and selling a traditional Khmer food made from rice, pork, vegetables, and a fish sauce for the last eighteen years. They have four children who are all married and employed locally, selling fruit, rice, etc.

Kai T. makes her traditional Khmer dish that she walks around and sells locally. Her husband works at a rubber company and makes $3.30 USD each day. However, rising inflation has forced the family to look for ways to increase and diversify their income.

Kai T. and her husband would like to venture into an ice business and begin to sell ice to local restaurants. She has asked for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a car to distribute the ice to customers. She believes that this business venture can increase the income that the family will generate. She looks forward to the opportunities that this loan presents and would like to see her family’s standard of living improved.

loans.use: Purchase vehicle to distribute ice in their new business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 52 years old, divorced, and has four children. She has been the bread winner for her family for twenty years, baking bread and selling it to consumers in the town. Margaret's business is affected by the high price rise of commodities like flour, sugar and margarine. She therefore needs a loan to be able to buy flour, sugar and margarine. She hopes to expand her bakery business and better respond to her community's needs. Margaret is a member of the group called Gospel Light whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of baking flour, sugar, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom N. is a villager in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a subsistence farmer and pig breeder. Previously, Mrs. Mom N. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. Since this business activity has improved, Mrs. Mom N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for her business.

She would use the rest of money to buy fertilizer to support her rice field. Mrs. Mom N. is a 54-year-old widow with two children, both of whom are employed at a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her business, and fertilizer to support her rice field.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 52 years old, married, and has three children. The living conditions of her family are difficult, and she has therefore decided to start a business of selling corn dough, used to prepare banku, kenkey, and other local dishes. Charity needs a loan to be able to buy bags of maize during the harvest season to avoid price hikes later. By selling corn dough, she hopes to increase her family's income and future savings. Charity is a member of the group called Gospel Light whose members agree to provide a guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of maize for making corn dough

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn S., 27, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her husband, Chhet Bun Thol, and takes care of her two young children every day.

Her husband is the only source of income for the family. He typically makes $13 USD each day in his auto body shop. He has been repairing cars for about fourteen years and his business is running very well. He could use some new equipment, though, and the family would like to see their income increased through this investment.

Thorn S. has asked for a loan of $600 USD to purchase some tools, paint, and other items that her husband needs to improve his business. She believes this loan will provide a great opportunity for her family and looks forward to seeing how her standard of living can be improved.

Thorn S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Chhet Bun Thol, appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Purchase auto repair tools, paint, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 42 years old and a mother of four children. She sells used clothing and charcoal in the neighborhood to earn income for her family. She considers used clothing sales to be a very profitable activity; however, she does not have enough capital to buy cloths for sale. Gladys also sells charcoal to earn additional income and be able to pay her children’s school fees. Currently, Gladys needs a loan of US$400 for the purchase of additional bales of cloths and bags of charcoal to expand her sales business. She is a member of the group called Isaiah whose members provide a guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing and charcoal for sale

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru:
Umedjon Y. is a businessman. He has been selling women's clothing for the past five years. He is married and has one child. He has a spot on the market where he trades. Umedjon would like to prepare his shop for the school fair. He needs money in order to bring in more school uniforms. The sales season lasts through July and the beginning of August, and therefore, all businessmen are trying to make the best of this opportunity. Umedjon would like to receive a loan and use it for his business. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Якубов Умеджон бизнесмен. Уже пять лет занимается торговлей женской одежды. Женат , имеет одного ребенка. Имеет торговую точку на рынке . Хочет подготовить твар к школьной ярмарке . Но для этого нужны деньги , которые он может использовать для ввоза школьной формы. Месяц июль и август начало торгового сезона и поэтому не каждый бизнесмен упустит возможность заработать. Поэтому Умеджон хочет получить кредит и использовать его в бизнесе. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng N., 37, has been working her farm land for over twenty years and she typically makes $1 each day. Her husband, Chea Mach, operates a motortaxi service and his income isn’t steady, but he typically makes $4 each day. They live in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, and have four children. Three of them still live at home and two of them are employed and helping to support the family.

Heng N. has asked for a loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband’s motorbike that will turn his motorbike into a tuk-tuk. Tuk tuks can hold more passengers and are very popular among the tourists in the area. The family hopes that the tuk-tuk can generate more income and they can use the money to improve their standard of living.

Heng N. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Chea Mach, appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Purchase trailer to turn motorbike into a tuk-tuk

loans.name: Hayrullo

texts.ru:
Hayrullo M. lives in Vakhsh region. He is a business man. He trades farm animals. Hayrullo M. buys young calfs and after feeding them for 40 days, sells them on the same markets. He has been in this business for seven years. The business is fairly profitable; therefore, he decided to obtain a loan and purchase a new calf. He plans to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мирзоев Хайрулло живет в районе Вахш. Работает частным предпринимателем. Торгует крупно-рогатым скотом. Скупает молодых бычков и после откормки , которая длится около 40 дней продает на тех же рынках. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около семи лет. Бизнес приносит неплохие доходы, поэтому он решил взять кредит и купить еще одного бычка. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mr. Sinat T. lives in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He uses a motorbike with a cart to transport firewood, which he sells door-to-door. Mr. Sinat T. now faces an obstacle because he needs to spend a lot of money on petroleum for his old motorbike, since gas prices have gone up significantly. Therefore, Mr. Sinat T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike to replace his old one.

His wife, Mrs. Channy Morn, is a subsistence farmer. Mr. Sinat T. is 34 and the father of two children, both of whom are too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Sinat T. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy household equipments to use for daily life. He has paid back the loan in full.

Last year, his wife was burned while boiling water, so Mr. Sinat T. spent $500 for her medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike with a cart to transport firewood to seller.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoeurn C. owns a grocery store in Kraing Sromor village located in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 33-year-old widow with two children, both of whom are too young to work or attend school. Mrs. Hoeurn C. is the head of the household, and her family lives in very poor conditions.

Mrs. Hoeurn C. needs to buy a piece of land to re-sell later at a better price. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to do so. Thus, Mrs. Hoeurn C. has asked for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to re-sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru:
M. Huseyn lives in Khuroson region. He is 52, married and has 4 children. He finished high school. Currently, Huseyn trades farm animals. He purchases young animals, feeds them, and then resells them later. This business brings profits. Therefore, to develop it further, Huseyn needs additional money. He would like to receive a loan. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мирзоев Хусей житель района Хуросон. 52 года , женат и имеет 4 детей.. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей крупно-рогатого скота. Скупает молодняк , откармливает и перепродает на тех же рынках. Это бизнес приносит доход , поэтому для того , чтобы его развивать нужны вложения. Сейчас Хусейн хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет он в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn L. is a rice reseller in Chhouk village located in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from this business activity, she sells Kor fruit which can be used to make pillows. Her husband, Mr. Kosol Saom, helps his wife with her business. They have three children who attend the local school. Although Mrs. Khorn L. and her husband have two business activities, they still cannot afford a piece of land.

Mrs. Khorn L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land so that she can re-sell it later at a better price. Previously, Mrs. Khorn L. had obtained a loan to start her Kor fruit business, which she has fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land so that she can re-sell it later at a better price.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, 43 years old, is married and the father of two children.  The family lives in the southern suburbs of Beirut, Lebanon, where Hassan is a hair designer for men. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to improve his shop in order to better accomodate his clients.  Hassan will then attract more customers and expand his business, which is the only source of revenue for his family. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Decoration improvement to the barber shop

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S., 27, is a garment factory worker in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, and makes $3 USD each day. She lives with her husband, Noy Noeun, who operates a motortaxi service and can usually make $6.60 USD each day. They have one small child at home and have been looking for ways to increase their income and improve their standard of living.

Heng S. has asked for a loan of $500 USD to invest in her husband’s taxi service and to purchase a new motortaxi to replace their old one. Their old one uses a lot of gas and is constantly in need of repair, which cuts into the income her husband is able to make. She believes that this investment can help the family in the long-term and looks forward to seeing the results.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is married with seven children. She says life is very hard for them as she has to help her husband pay all her children’s fees. She buys palm kernels to manufacture oil which is used for cooking and also used by local industries for making washing soaps.

Yaa says her working capital is small and therefore she wants to use this loan to buy more kernels for her operation. She is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members agree in unison to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm kernels to manufacture oil

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Bahtiyor S. lives in Vakhsh region. He is 46 years old, married and has 9 children. Bahtiyor has a college degree and is a cook. He works in the middle school No. 9. Aside from his work, Bahtiyor sells wheat. He has a trading spot in the market, where he sells wheat. He has been involved in this business for 28 years. He would like to increase his profit by receiving a loan. This will help develop his business and increase profits from the business. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Шоимов Бахтиер житель района Вахш. Возраст 46 лет , женат и имеет девятерых детей. Образование высшее , по специальности повар. Работает в средней школе №9 . Кроме того занимается торговлей муки. Имеет торговую точку на рынке , откуда и пролает муку. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 28 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет развитию бизнеса и увеличению прибыли дела. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim S., 47, sells vegetables in the local food market and makes US$6.60 each day. She lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, with her husband, Samreth Seng Hun, and their four children. Two of their children still live in the household and help to support the family, while the other two are married and have started their own families.

Sim S.’s husband works as a farmer and typically makes US$5.60 each day out in the fields, but the family would like to see their income increased. Sim S. has asked for a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike to transport her vegetables to the market where she sells them. The family may also find other uses for the motorbike and it can be a great way for them to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike to transport vegetables to market

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Pon S., 23, is a young farmer who has worked her land, making less than $1 USD each day for the last six years. She lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her husband, Chuop Saroeun, and their two young children. Her husband collects recyclable items and can usually make $8 USD each day. Pon S. and her husband also support her elderly mother and father who live in their home.

In this family that has many needs, Pon S. and her husband have been searching for ways to increase their income and improve their businesses. They have decided that it would be best to invest in a motorbike for the family, which would allow Chuop Saroeun to transport his recyclable items around the area.

Pon S. has asked for a loan of $500 USD to make this purchase for her husband and looks forward to seeing her family’s standard of living improved and their income increased.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike to transport recyclables

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is 37 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are currently in school. She says selling of lingerie especially for women is very profitable and therefore, she has been selling ladies' lingerie in the local market for five years to help her husband in taking care of the family’s needs.

Augustina wants to use the loan to buy bales of lingerie to increase her inventory and sales for good income. She believes this loan will help her save some money to start paying part of the children’s school fees and the utility bills. Augustina is a member of the group called Confidence. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie for re-sale

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas, 47 years old, lives in Beirut with his wife and two children. He owns a sewing shop and specializes in the manufacture of lingerie. Abbas continuously develops his business. For this reason, he has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 2 years. He has successfully repaid his previous loan on time.

Now, Abbas needs a loan of US$1,200 to purchase a wider variety of fabrics so that he can meet the current demands of his clients in terms of choice and fabric quality.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of lingerie fabrics

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim Y., 54, purchases bananas from a local farm and transports them to the market to resell for a profit. She typically makes $3.90 each day in the local market and believes that she can expand her business to reach more customers.

She lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, with her husband, Sou Sam Ol, and their ten children. Her husband sells traditional Khmer medicines and makes less than $1 each day. The family is also aided by the support of some of the children. Three of their children are employed in Kampong Cham and are able to provide US$100 each month to their parents to help them meet their daily needs.

Through some expansion, Kim Y. believes that her banana business could generate more income for her and her husband and help to lighten the financial burden on this large family. She has asked for a loan of $600 to purchase more bananas and invest in her business. This purchase could increase her inventory and allow her to generate more income in the local food market.

loans.use: Increase banana inventory

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and married with three children. All her children are currently in school. Grace is a food vendor and she prepares "waakye" (cooked brown rice with beans eaten with vegetable sauce) for school children and workers in her neighborhood. She has been selling waakye for four years and she wants to buy more bags of rice and vegetables to avoid price hikes in the commodities.

With this loan, Grace hopes to increase her savings towards her children’s future. She is a member of the group called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, frozen fish, and vegetables

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn S., 28, raises pigs and sells soup, making $4.90 USD each day. She has been involved in this business for the last ten years. Her husband, Hea Siem, is a local blacksmith and mechanic. They live in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, with their two children,

They are looking to expand their current businesses. Hea Siem makes $5.80 USD each day by repairing motorbikes and bicycles in his shop. He could use some more tools to help his business. Sorn S. has asked for a loan of $500 USD to invest in both her and her husband’s businesses. She would like to use $200 USD to purchase a few more pigs to raise and use the other $300 USD to purchase some blacksmithing tools for her husband.

She looks forward to the opportunities that this loan can provide and is optimistic about the return on her investment.

loans.use: Purchase more pigs and blacksmithing tools

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 23 years old and single, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He owns a shop where he sells electrical items and home accessories. Since he is looking ahead to a better future, Ali needs a loan of US$1,200 to enlarge and diversify his inventory, especially of lighting items, that he can offer to his clients.

This is the first time Ali has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He heard about the organization through word of mouth, which is Al Majmoua's best promotion tool.

loans.use: Diversify inventory of the lighting items

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 35 years old and married with five children. All her children are in school. She has been selling rubber slippers in the community for four years. Rubber slippers are very common and are worn by the majority of Ghanaians as they are comfortable and easy and cheap to buy. Abena says she wants to buy more variety so that customers may choose according to their preference.

Abena hopes to increase her savings to rent a store as she currently hawks her wares under the scorching sun. She also needs money for her children’s education. She is a member of the group called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more rubber slippers for re-sale

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Bahtiyor M. lives in the Khuroson area. He is married and has five children. He is 36 years old. For five years he has been trading in cattle. In order to further develop his business, he wants to take out a loan and buy one or two more calves. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. He will be able to use the profit for his family. He plans to pay off the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer

Мирзоалиев Бахтиер житель района Хуросон. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Возраст 36 лет. Пять лет занимается торговлей крупно-рогатого скота. Для развития бизнеса хочет получить кредит и закупить еще одного или двух молодых бычков. После откормки сможет их продать по более выгодной цене. Прибыль сможет использовать для своей семьи.Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying calves

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M., age 27, is married with one daughter of 9 months. He has had a cosmetics business since 2003. He works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $154.

In the past Charles has taken out 4 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to improve his cosmetics business. He hopes for a new loan to increase his capital.

loans.use: to increase on capital

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon Y., 39, works in her fields as a farmer and makes less than $1 USD each day. She lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her husband, Soy Ngoy.

They have seven children. Five of their children are still living in their house. The other two are married and have started their own families. Three of their children are employed and are able to provide around $200 USD each month for the family. Soy Ngoy works in construction and makes $3.30 USD each day. The family has been figuring out ways to increase its income.

Suon Y. has asked for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase a weaving machine to begin a new business. She believes that this weaving business can generate more income for her family and can allow them to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase weaving machine

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is forty-two years old and married with five children. All her children are in school. Ama hawks herrings in the village for the folks to get fish to prepare their meals, either for lunch or dinner. She says smoked herring is entering the lean season therefore she wants to use the loan to buy more herrings to avoid price hikes.

Ama hopes to save some money to rent one of the local market stalls to sell her fish out of as hawking is a very tiring job for her. She also hopes to register to become a member of the health insurance scheme where she and her family can enjoy free medical care. Ama is member of the group called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of smoked herrings for re-sale

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy P., 48, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her husband, Chea Ionh. They have four children. She works on her farm land each day and makes less than $1 USD. The family is also aided by the support of three of the children. Two of the children are tailors and one works in a local organization. Together, they are able to provide $150 USD each month for their parents.

Suy P. has asked for a loan of $1000 USD to make an investment in her childrens' tailoring business. She would like to purchase more cloth for their business, so that they can make more clothes. This investment will allow her children to expand their current business. She looks forward to seeing the family’s standard of living improved.

loans.use: Purchase more cloth

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is 32 years old and a married mother with two children, both in school. Philomena sells frozen foods in the local market but she says profit from the sales is very low since she pays high rent on the store she operates from. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her to raise enough income to build a permanent store for herself. She is a member of the group called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, 32 years old and single, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is the owner of a small laundry.  He needs a loan  of US$1,200 to purchase a new laundry machine with more functions than the one he currently owns. Hassan also wants to restructure his shop in order to expand his business. This is the first time Hassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new laundry machine

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 32 years old and a mother with two children. The children are currently in school. Selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, selling of used clothing has created a market for many women like Lydia.

Lydia wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a store to sell clothing out of. Lydia is member of the called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is 42 years old and married with three children. Two of them are in school. She is so grateful to Sinapi for giving her a loan which saved her marriage since, before, her husband saw her to be a burden on him. She used the previous loan to start selling cooked rice for schools and children and other workers in her town. This enabled her to save to help her husband in paying the children’s school fees.

Afia wants to add to her rice business the selling of spring rolls which she says customers want for breakfast. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and flour, vegetables, eggs and assorted meat to expand her operation. She is a member of the group called Confidence. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, flour, vegetables, eggs, and assorted meat to expand her operation

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad, a 47-year-old married man, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is a taxi driver. Because of the high cost of living in Beirut, the low income provided by his taxi business is not sufficient to cover the living expenses of his wife and six children. Therefore, he has requested a loan of US$1,000 as a boost for him to open a small clothing shop to be managed by his wife to generate a second income for the family.

This is the second time Fouad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He successfully repaid his previous loan on time.

loans.use: Open a small clothes shop

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Mrs. Vin S. and her husband, Mr. Morn Kong, are subsistence farmers in Chhouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They make only a small revenue, because their rice field is small. Mrs. Vin S. wants to expand her rice business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan so that she can buy more land to grow rice. Mrs. Vin S. is 48 and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others two are enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy a a rice field in order to expand her rice revenue.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 44 years old and married with four children. All her children are in school. For three years she has been hawking and selling materials used for sewing school uniforms and other cloth in the community.

Paulina says basic schools will reopen soon and the demand for school uniforms will be very high. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more materials to increase her stock for good sales and income to enable her to save some money for her children’s education.

Paulina is a member of the group called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy materials for school uniforms and cloth

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 28 years old and single, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is a hair designer for men. The low income generated by his business doesn't support Ahmad's dreams to drastically improve the living conditions of his family. However, he believes he can make a better life for his parents, brother and sisters by undertaking small steps. He now needs a loan of US$1,000 to make some house improvements including painting and sanitary work.

This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Najib

texts.ru:
Najib F. lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is single, 22 years old. He trades in the city market. He sells socks and other accessories. He has been doing this kind of business for three years. He wants to bring school supplies to the market. To do this, he will need to borrow 2500 somoni for 12 months. This loan will help him to increase sales and attract new clients.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer

Фалишоев Наджиб житель города Курган-тюбе. Не женат . Возраст 22 года.Занимается торговлей на рынке города. Торгует носками и другими принадлежностями . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже три года . Хочет завести школьный товар к ярмарке. Для этого необходимо получить кредит в размере 2500 сомони сроком на 12 месяцев.Этот кредит поможет ему увеличить товарооборот и привлеч новых клиентов.

loans.use: Delivery of goods

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 34 years old and married with four children. All her children are currently in school. Victoria hawks and sells materials and cloth used for sewing dresses for both children and adults. She says selling sewing materials is profitable as people would want to cut designs of their preference and she therefore wants to increase her inventory to enable her make good income to rent a store one day. Victoria is a member of the group called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of sewing materials and cloth

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is married and she 46 years old. She has 8 children and three of them are in school now. Akosua is very enterprising and she has been selling her products to support her children’s future. Currently she has set up one of her children to start selling pharmaceutical drugs like painkillers, antacids, anti-malarial drugs, etc. in the community.

Akosua wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of tomatoes, eggplants, assorted meat, etc., to increase her inventory. She is a member of the group called Confidence. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of tomatoes, eggplants, assorted meat, etc., for re-sale

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, a 39-year-old father of three children, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Ibrahim owns a butcher shop and needs a loan of US$1,200 to increase and diversify his inventory. Indeed, at this time, Ibrahim’s shop cannot answer the demand of all clients in terms of the choices of meat he can offer.

This is the first time Ibrahim has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Mrs. Thong Y. is a nurse in Trapaing Srang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy medical supplies to cure her customers. Therefore, Mrs. Thong Y. is now requesting a loan. Her husband, Mr. Pan Chhin, is a soldier. Mrs. Thong Y. has three children, one of whom is staY. at home to cook food for the family while the other two are enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy medical supplies to cure her customers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 55 years old and a widowed mother with six children. Two of them are in school now. She has been selling grocery products for five years in the town to support her family. She says business is doing well and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory.

Cecilia believes this loan would help her increase her savings for the welfare of her two children who are in school. She is a member of the group called Anointed Ladies. Members agree in unison to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like tin fish, tin tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, a 56-year-old married man with five children, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Mohamed owns a sewing and ironing shop. He needs a loan of USD$700 to purchase a new sewing machine, which will allow him to expand his business and therefore guarantee a better livelihood for his family.

Mohamad has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 2 years and he always repays his loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Roeurng

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeurng L. is a housewife in Prey Puoch Village in Kampong Chhang Province. Her husband, Mr. Sameth Meas, collects palm juice to make palm sugar. They have five children, one of whom is employed at a company while the other two are attending school. The remaining two are too young to work or study.

Although the family members have different business activities, they have insufficient money to hire construction workers to build a new house to replace the existing one. Mrs. Roeurng L. decided to ask a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Roeurng L. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To hire construction workers to build her a new house to replace her existing one.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Anvar S. lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. He has a higher education. By profession, he is an engineer. He works selling vegetables and fruit. Currently, he brings in watermelons and other types of melons, buying them at wholesale and selling them at retail. He wants to increase turnover. Therefore, he wants to take out a loan for 2500 somoni for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer

Собиров Анвар житель города Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 31 год . Женат и имеет двоих детей. Образование высшее. По специальности инженер. Занимаетс яторговлей овощей и фруктов. В данный момент привозит арбузы и дыни , скупая их у оптовых реализаторов. Продает в розницу. Хочет увеличить товарооборот . Для этого хочет получить кредит на сумму 2500 сомони , сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomena is 47 years old and a married mother with six children. All her children are currently in school. She treks to Kintampo, in the northern part of Ghana, to purchase her products and retail them in her town market. She says prices for her commodities is on the rise and therefore she wants to use the loan to buy more yams and millet to avoid price hikes and frequent trips to the north. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband and pay the children's school fees. She is a member of the group called Partners. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy tubers of fresh yams and bags of millet.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mr. Vannak D. is a villager in B'er Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Yatdek Uk, is a garment worker. They have three children, two of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Since Mr. Vannak D. and his wife’s workplace are far from their house, Mr. Vannak D. is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike to travel to work. In the past, Mr. Vannak D. has obtained a loan from AMK to increase his profits and to build a new house. This loan has been fully repaid. His wife is shown on right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel to work.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, 54 years old, lives with his wife and four children in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. His work includes the maintenance and repair of home electronics and the installation of satellite dishes. The income generated by his work is not sufficient to cover more than basic living expenses for his family. Therefore he needs a loan fof US$1,000 to repair his car.

This is the second time Said has requested a loan from Al Majmoua and he successfully repaid his previous one.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr:
Kodzo B. is 35 years old and a married father of 3 children, all of whom attend school. He lives in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been working as a motorcycle taxi driver for more than 3 years and successfully provides for his family with the income that he earns. Kodzo would like to improve his business by buying a new motorcycle with the loan he will receive from FECECAV. The fruits of his labor will allow him to improve the lifestyle of his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Kodzo B. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il habite à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est conducteur de taxi moto depuis plus de 3 ans et arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille par les revenus de son activité. Kodzo souhaite améliorer son activité en achetant une nouvelle moto par le crédit qu’il bénéficiera de FECECAV. Les fruits de son travail lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: The purchase of a new motorcycle

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal, 30 years old, is divorced and has no children. She lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Manal owns a small clothes shop next to her home. She is a very responsible woman whose priority in life is the improvement of her business, which is her only source of income. She needs a loan of US$800 to purchase more inventory. This stock increase will allow Manal to expand her business by guaranteeing more choice for her clients.

Manal has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 5 years.

loans.use: To increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Gulbahor Q. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 44 years old. She is a widow with two children. In order to provide for her family and give her children a complete education, Gulbahor works in sales. She sells fabrics and various national wedding outfits in the market. She has done this for five years. To further develop her business, she needs additional funds. That is possible only if she gets a loan. She plans to pay off her debt in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer

Курбонова Гулбахор проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 44 года. Вдова с двумя детьми. Для того , чтобы обеспечить семью и дать полноценное образование детям Гулбахор занимается торговлей. Торгует на рынке города тканями и различными национальными свадебными нарядами. Работает так уже пять лет. Для того , чтобы развивать свой бизнес ей необходимо вливать дополнительные средства. Это возможно только после получения кредита. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Khagani

texts.en: Khagani  is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Zangilan region, and he settled in Baku city. This man was born in 1977 and is single. He has run this business for 8 years. Now he needs a loan of $625 to improve his internet cafe.

loans.use: To improve his internet cafe

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Aimée

texts.fr:
Aimée K. is 39 years old and is married with 5 children. For about 4 years she has been working as a loincloth retailer in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, her second from FECECAV, Aimée would like to improve the capacity of her business by buying 3 rolls of cloth. This would allow her to satisfy the ever-growing demand of her clientele and to provide for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Aimée K. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse, depuis environ 4 ans, de pagnes à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Aimée désire par ce crédit, le deuxième de FECECAV, améliorer la capacité de son commerce en achetant 3 balles de pagnes. Ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de la clientèle et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: The purchase of 3 rolls of cloth

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem, 39 years old, is a married man with one child. He owns an aluminum workshop in a village close to the Southern city of Nabatieh. Kassem has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 5 years and has always repaid his loans on time. Kassem is a very responsible man whose priority in life is the improvement of his business, which is the only source of income for his family. He needs a loan of US$1,200 to purchase raw material for his workshop.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for an aluminum workshop

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Beth M.. She is married and has two children, aged 6 and 3. In 2006, Beth established her used clothing business. She opens her business six to twelve hours a day. Beth requires a loan in order to buy more clothing. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $87. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially among the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. Others still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress; however, the growing market in used clothing, and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs, cannot be denied.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.fr:
Nestor L. is 37 years old, is married and a father of 4 children. He is a palm wine salesman in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Nestor has worked in this trade for the past 5 years and it is his main activity. With this credit, he would like to improve his business by buying more palm trees for winemaking in order to satisfy the requests by the distillers. The increase in the capacity of his business will help him to provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Nestor L. est âgé de 37 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est vendeur de vin de palme à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Nestor exerce ce métier depuis 5 ans et demeure sa principale activité. Il souhaite par ce crédit améliorer son activité en achetant plus de palmiers pour en tirer le vin afin de satisfaire la demande des distillateurs. L’augmentation de la capacité de son activité lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of palm trees

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 36 year-old Helena M.. She is married and has five children, aged between 8 and 19. In 2002, Helena established her crops business. Working days a week, and hours a day, she earns about US $230 every month from this business. Helena has already received, and successfully repaid, two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more rice. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $52. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more rice.

loans.name: Houda

texts.en: Houda, 31 years old, is married with three children and lives in the South of Lebanon. She owns a clothes shop that she named Al Amal (Arabic: Hope). Houda always offers a nice assortment of clothing merchandise, which is a good attraction for potential customers who pass by her shop. She has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for two cycles. Presently, she needs a loan of US$600 to purchase new merchandise and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: Purchase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. Thou N. is a dried fish seller in the market and she makes about $5 per day. Her husband is an ox merchant. He makes about $1.60 per day. They have five children; one of whom is married, living in Kork Daung Village, Siem Reap Province. One of their daughters is a tailor who graduated recently from professional school. She operates a tailoring business, but she doesn’t have enough capital to run the business. Mrs. N. is requesting a loan of $1000 to build a store for her daughter’s tailor business.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To build a store for her daughter’s tailor business

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou N. is a dried fish seller in the market and she makes about $5 per day. Her husband is an ox merchant. He makes about $1.60 per day. They have five children; one of whom is married, living in Kork Daung Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

One of their daughters is a tailor who graduated recently from professional school. She operates a tailoring business, but she doesn’t have enough capital to run the business. So Mrs. N. is requesting a loan of $1000 to build a store for her daughter’s tailor business. N.'s husband is pictured.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To build a store for her daughter’s tailor business

loans.name: Etse

texts.fr:
Etse Z. is 32 years old, is married and a father of 2 children. He lives in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Etse has been a textile artisan for the past 3 years and this trade is his main source of income. With this second credit from FECECAV he would like buy strings necessary for the textile manufacturing and also to build his workshop.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Etse Z. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il réside à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Etse est tisserand depuis 3 ans et ce métier demeure sa principale source de revenu. Il désire par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV améliorer la capacité de son activité en achetant des ficelles nécessaires à l’exécution de son activité et aussi procéder à l’aménagement de son atelier.

loans.use: To buy strings for his textile trade and to build his workshop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 47 year-old Tatu R.. She is married and has five children, aged between 14 and 33. In 1996, Tatu established her charcoal business. Working seven days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $170 every month from this business. Tatu requires a loan in order to buy more charcoal in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $43. She thanks you for your support.

These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important, not just to charcoal sellers, but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Noha

texts.en:
Noha, 40 years old and single, lives in a village close to the city of Nabatieh, in the South of Lebanon. She designs flower arrangements and named her business Al Estimrar (Arabic: Continuity). She needs a loan of US$400 to purchase material for flower arrangements.

Noha has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 3 cycles and always repays her loans on time.

loans.use: purchase material for flower arrangements.

loans.name: Providence Group

texts.en:
Abdul A. K. is 30 years old and married with three children. He sells soft drinks in the Sierra Leone town of Magburaka, and has been running his business for four years. With his previous loans from SMT, he has increased his stock and profits. Abdul's business is the main source of income for his family, and he is requesting another loan to further expand his business.

Abdul is the leader for "Providence" group, which has been working together for two years. The group also includes: Aminata C., who sells second hand clothes; Hannah K., who sells cosmetics; Foday K., who runs a general store; and Alex T., who sells clothes. The group is requesting a loan so each can increase inventory and profits for their business.

loans.use: Increase stock of soft drinks, cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Afisa

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Asifa M.. She is not married, and has no children. She has one dependent, who lives with her because she is an orphan. In 2007, Asifa established her crops business. Working six days a week, and six to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $80 every month from this business. Asifa requires a loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $13. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr:
Kodzo A. is 42 years old, is married and a father of 5 children. He is a carpenter in Assahoun, a village located 50 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. He has been in the carpenting trade for the past 7 years. With this third credit from FECECAV, Kodzo wishes to buy wooden boards so that he can deliver on his numerous and growing orders. The income from this business will help him better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Kodzo A. est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. Il est menuisier à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il exerce ce métier de puis 7 ans. Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, Kodzo désire acheter des planches pour l’exécution des commandes qui ne cessent de croître. Les revenus de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of wooden boards

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem N., 29, raises pigs and makes traditional Cambodian rice wine. She earns around $5 per day from these activities. Her husband, Heng Hak, is a motorcycle taxi driver and also earns about $5 per day. They have one child and live in Sophy Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. N. is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to purchase more pigs to raise and to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband’s taxi service. A newer motorcycle will be more efficient and allow him to attract more customers.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia.
