Francisca M. sells fabric and is also a seamstress. She is a single parent with 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fuel to retail in her community.

loans.name: Lilliam Azucena

texts.es:
Llliam works as a security guard in a commercial center in Managua, for which she is paid a salary insufficient to maintain her family. She is married and her husband is a mechanic who supports the household expenses. She has one son of school age. Seeing the need for greater income, two years ago Lilliam decided to start a business selling jewelry, with a loan from AFODENIC. These parents desire the best for their son and want to give him all the education he needs. For this reason Lilliam requests the loan, so that she can purchase gold and silver jewelry to augment her inventory and generate more sales and obtain more clients.

Lilliam trabaja como guarda se seguridad en un Centro Comercial de Managua, por el que devenga un salario pero que no es suficiente para mantener a su familia. Es casada y su esposo es mecánico y aporta para los gastos del hogar. Tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar. En vista de la necesidad de mayores ingresos, hace 2 años Lilliam decidió empezar el negocio de las ventas de joyas, lo empezó con préstamo otorgado por AFODENIC. Estos padres desean lo mejor para su hijo y dentro de esto está poder darle toda la educación necesaria. Es por eso que Lilliam solicita el préstamo, porque quiere comprar joyas de oro y plata y así poder aumentar su inventario y generar más ventas y captar más clientes.



Translated by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gold and silver jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a wide variety of goods to replenish a small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in various foodstuffs for a mini-market.

loans.name: Sowa's Group

texts.en: Moses Kamara, Thomas Kamara, Sorie Tholley and Mohamed Keita are requesting a loan of  Le 3,800,000.00. They are all military personnel who engage in outside business because military salaries are not adequate. The loan will be divided among their wives who will invest in various businesses while the men work in the military. This will help them all improve their incomes and support their families.

loans.use: To buy more local produce--rice,palm-oil,onions etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in many goods in order to keep operating a small greocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair products to keep operating a small salon.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Mrs. Honorata is 63 years old and studied through her fourth year of secondary school. Currently she lives with 72 year old Don Julio Romero with whom she has one son who is studying in the university. She owns her own home, which fortunately has basic services (light, water, etc.), located on Bolognesi Street across from May 2nd plaza in the Yunguyo province.

She has a restaurant where she prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner which she sells to the workers of various institutions nearby everyday of the year. She has run the restaurant with her husband for the past 10 years.

Initially, she took out a $125 loan from the “Winay Marca” village bank in order to buy two sacks of rice and some oil. With this $350 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy wholesale ingredients like rice, potatoes, beans, oil, and vegetables.

She is very grateful for her last loan as it helped her to improve her earnings. As a member of the village bank, she has learned to be responsible in her payments, and to continue working hard in order to support her son who is studying.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

a señora Honorata tiene 63 años, estudio hasta cuarto año de secundaria , actual mente convive con Don Julio Romero de 72 años, con quien tiene un Hijo Varón, quien estudia en la universidad, su domicilio es propio, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, esta ubicada en el Jr. Bolognesi frente a la Plaza Dos de Mayo, del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo. Ella tiene un Restaurante donde prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena que es consumido por los trabajadores de las diferentes instituciones, durante todos los días del año, desde hace diez años atrás viene trabajando con el apoyo de su esposo. Saco un préstamo de inicial de S/.300.00 del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca” para poder comprar dos sacos de arroz y aceite. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará insumos al por mayor como arroz, papa, menestras, aceite y verduras. Nos cuenta que se encuentra muy agradecida porque pudo mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Siendo integrante del Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable en sus pagos, a seguir trabajando, para que pueda apoyar a su hijo que estudia.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale food ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a collection of wigs to resell in her community.

loans.name: Ana Veronica

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana Veronica is 32 years old, has studied through secondary school, and is married with three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are students and the other is still a baby. She lives in the house of her mother which fortunately have basic services (light, water, etc.) on Ejercito Avenue in the Yunguyo province.

For the past 6 years, she has worked making macrame fabrics (wall decor, lamp carriers, flowerpots, paper holders, satchels, decorative mirrors, hats, and backpacks). She makes them using macramé and crochet. Sometimes she teaches knitting classes as well.

She is a member of the “Villa Copacabana” village bank where she initially took out a $125 loan in order to buy macramé and tape, and to acquire some land in Arequipa. With this $1,050 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy material for manufacturing her fabrics.

She is very thankful for the loan she received as it allowed her to purchase land and to be responsible for her activities.

She dreams of building a home on her land and helping her children to study.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Verónica tiene 32 años de edad , tiene estudios superiores, es casada y tiene dos hijos varones y una hija mujer, dos de ellos estudian y el otro aun es bebe, vive en la casa de su mamá , cuenta con los servicios básicos y esta ubicada en la Av. Ejercito del distrito, provincia de Yunguyo. Desde hace seis años ella se dedica a elaborar tejidos de macramé (adornos para pared, porta lámparas, porta maceteros, porta papeles, carteras, espejos adornados, gorros, mochilas.) hechas de macramé, cola de rata y crochet. A veces dicta cursos de tejido. Integra el Banco Comunal “Villa Copacabana” donde saco un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 con el cual compró macramé y cinta cola de rata. Con este de S/. 3,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, compró material para la elaboración de sus tejidos. Así mismo compró un terreno en Arequipa. Esta muy agradecida con el crédito que se le dio por que pudo adquirir el terreno que tanto anhelaba y aprendió a ser responsable en sus actividades. Sueña hacer construir el terreno que compro en Arequipa, hacer estudiar a sus hijos

loans.use: Purchase of material to make decorative fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase an assortment of fashionable women's underwear and exclusive jewelry to retail in her community.

loans.name: Andrea Justina

texts.es:
Mrs. Andrea is 63 years old and was born on November 29, 1945. She studied through 5th graD. and speaks both Spanish and the native language of Aymara. She is currently separated from her husband; she has six children of whiC. only one is currently studying. The others are all grown with their own families. She owns her own home with all basic services (light, water, etc.) on Ejercito Avenue in the Yunguyo province.

Andrea used to work selling clothing for adults and youth but she struggled to sell it. Selling just one item seemed to take forever. She began knitting clothing for babies (sweaters, sleepwear) whiC. she was able to sell very easily so she changed her inventory. Now, she sells clothing for children (cotton t-shirts, wool sweaters, small socks, dresses, shirts, and pants) in the markets of Chacachaca, Huapaca, and Yunguyo.

She is also a designer; she makes clothes for cold-weather suC. as vests, pants, and ponchos for children. She is a member of the “Villa Copacaban” village bank where she first received a loan of $125 in order to buy sweaters, pants, and hats for babies. With this $1,050 loan whiC. she will repay in 3 months, she plans to purchase wholesale clothing for babies.

She is very grateful for her loans whiC. helps her substantially in her business and improve her earnings. She hopes that one day her daughters will become professionals and that they will have a clothing factory.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Andrea tiene 63 años D. edad nació el 29 D. noviembre D. 1945, estudio hasta quinto D. primaria, habla es castellano y el aymará. Actualmente su estado civil es separada, tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales solo uno esta estudiando, los demás ya son independientes con familia, la casa donD. vive es propia tiene todos los servicios básicos y esta ubicada en la Av. Ejercito del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo. Andrea cuenta que anterior mente se dedicaba a la venta D. ropa adulta, jóvenes con la que tenia problemas para venderlo, no tenia suerte, se demoraba bastante en vender una prenda, empezó a tejer ropas para bebes (chompitas, ajuares ) que vendía con mucha mas facilidad, motivo por el cual cambio D. mercadería. Ahora se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. niños (roponcitos, politos D. algodón, chompas D. lana, medias pequeñas, vestidos, camisas, chullos, pantalones.) en las ferias D. Chacachaca, Huapaca, en el mismo Yunguyo. Andrea es Modista, confecciona Ropas D. tela polar como chalecos, pantalones, ponchos, todo para niños. Ella integra al Banco Comunal “Villa Copacabana” también inicio con un crédito D. S/. 300.00 comprando un docena D. chompitas D. bebes, pantaloncitos, gorritos. Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 3 meses, comprará ropa D. bebes al por mayor. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito, que le ayuda bastante en su negocio y incrementa sus ingresos. El gran anhelo que ella tiene que sus hijas saquen sus títulos profesionales, que tengan una fabrica D. confección.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale baby clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand a small business of selling women's clothing.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es:
.Felisa is 55 years old. She did not get the opportunity to study as her father said she was only a woman and should be doing the chores at home, especially the cooking. She has six children with her partner, lives in her own house that has all the basic services and is located in Av. Ejercito, district and province of Yunguyo. For the past fifteen years, doña Felisa has been selling groceries for a living at the market “15 de Agosto” in the province of Yunguyo. She is a member of “Banco Comunal, Unión 28 de Julio” and with a previous loan of S/.300 she bought a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, and a bag of noodles. With the requested loan of S/. 800, to be repaid in 3 months, she will buy different articles and products to increase her stock and her economic income. As a member she has learned to be responsible; to work from early on in the morning and to move forward as a woman. She would like her children to become professionals and to work.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Felisa tiene 55 años de edad, no pudo estudiar por que su padre le dijo que solo era mujer y que se dedicara a los quehaceres de la casa como la cocina, actualmente ella convive y tiene seis hijos, su casa es propia , con servicios básicos completos y esta ubicada en la Av. Ejercito del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo. La señora Felisa se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes, desde hace quince años atrás, en el mercado 15 de Agosto de la provincia de Yunguyo. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”, inicio con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 , compro un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar y una bolsa de fideos. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 3 meses, comprará diversos artículos y productos que permita incrementar su mercadería y sus ingresos económicos. Siendo socia aprendió a ser cumplida. Trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y salir adelante como mujer. Le gustaría que sus hijos sean profesionales y trabajen.

loans.use: Purchase different products to increase stock and improve sales.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en: The 4 members of this group are: Mosses K., Thomas K., Sorie T., and Mamudu K.. They all work for the army, which pays very small salaries. Because of the need to supplement their incomes, they are requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000.00. This money will be used to buy seed rice and other crops to plant on their farms and to expand their wives' businesses. These loans are a great help to the soldiers, as the loan will enable them meet their current financial needs and then to repay it gradually.

loans.use: To buy seed rice for farming.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es:
Fausto is 45 years old, she has been a widow for 17 years, has 4 children, only one is studying, the others work. Her home, which has all the basic services, is located in Villurcuni, District of Ollaraya, Province of Yunguyo. She is a craftswoman dedicated to making woven blankets, llijlla, since she was very young. Mainly she works upon requests and she also sells at a slightly higher price at the carnivals. Since her husband passed away she also farms and breeds animals such as sheep, cows and pigs.

She is a member of the “Banco Comunal Unicachi” and with a previous loan of S/.300 she bought 120 different colored hanks of wool for the blankets. With the requested loan of S/.500, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy wool for 2 llijllas (blankets) In the Banco Comunal she has learned to be responsible, to make conversation and to work. Her vision of the future is that her children work and have their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Fausta a sus 45 años de edad, es viuda hace 17 años, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia, los demás trabajan, su domicilio esta ubicada en Villurcuni, Distrito de Ollaraya, Provincia de Yunguyo y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Ella se dedica a la artesanía, realiza tejidos frazadas, llijlla, desde muy pequeña. Mayormente hace pedidos y también vende en los carnavales, fecha en la que sus tejidos cuestan un poco más. Desde que falleció su esposo también se dedica a la chacra y a la crianza de animales como oveja, vaca y chancho.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal Unicachi al inicio tuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 con lo que compró 120 madejas de lana para frazadas, lana de diferentes colores. Con este crédito de S/. 500.00 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará lanas para 2 llijllas (tejido). En el Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable, a conversar y a trabajar. Su visión futura es que sus hijos trabajen, y tengan su casa.

loans.use: Purchase wool to increase production of woven blankets.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva is 63 years old, she did not have the opportunity to study for being a woman and had to do the chores at home. She is married to Francisco A. Calderón, they have 5 children who all work in the city and are independent. They visit their parents on the anniversary of the District or special festivities. Doña Genoveva is a member of “Banco Comunal San Pedro D. Unicachi”. Since she was very young, she has been selling potatoes, “chuño” (a kind of Peruvian potato), broad beans, and “tarwi” at the market of Yunguyo. She also sells sheep, and young pigs. She lives in her own house; it has electricity, water, and latrine and is located in the Santa Bárbara Sector, District of Ollaraya, Province of Yunguyo. She and her husband spend every day farming, collecting broad beans, “chuño”, and potatoes.

With the requested loan of S/.200, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy “chuño” and a small sheep to be sold when the first instalment of her loan is due. It is her dream that her children work and their business grow, and that she may work as long as God permits.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Genoveva tiene 63 años D. edad, no estudió sólo por que fue mujer, tuvo que dedicarse a los quehaceres D. la casa. Es casada con Francisco A. Calderón, con quien tuvo cinco hijos, quienes trabajan en la ciudad y son independientes; ellos llegan para el aniversario del Distrito o fiestas grandes. Doña Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro D. Unicachi”, se dedica a la venta D. papa, chuño, habas y tarwi en la feria D. Yunguyo desD. muy joven. También venD. ovejas y chanchitos. La casa donD. vive es propia cuenta con luz, agua y letrina y está ubicada en el Sector Santa Bárbara, Distrito D. Ollaraya, Provincia D. Yunguyo. Con la ayuda D. su esposo pasan los días en los trabajos D. la chacra, recogiendo los productos como habas, chuño y papa.

Con este crédito D. S/. 200.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará chuño y una oveja pequeña, la cual será vendida, cuando se acerque la fecha del pago D. su primera cuota. El sueño que ella tiene es que sus hijos trabajen y crezcan en su negocio. Y que ella trabajara hasta donD. Dios le permita.

loans.use: Purchase a kind of Peruvian potato (chuño) and a sheep.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Doña Teodocia is 55 years old, a widow with four children who are independent. She owns her home which has electricity, water, latrine, and is located in Patascahi, District of Ollaraya, Province of Yunguyo. For the past 20 years, she has been selling potatoes, “chuño” (a Peruvian kind of potato), and “tarwi” (pulses) as well as making “aguayos” (a kind of woven shawl) and blankets. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Unicahi, and with a previous loan of S/.300 she bought different colored wool; 100 hanks, to make blankets. With the requested loan of S/.1,500, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy “chuño”, potatoes as well as cheese to be sent to her daughter in Lima who will sell it and send back the money via a bank. At the present she is collecting “tarwi” and potatoes. As a member of the bank she learned to get ahead to support her children, and it is her dream that her children have a better life than she has had, better homes and more material properties. She is very thankful for the loans as they enable her to help her children en Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teodocia tiene 55 años D. edad , su estado civil es V., tiene cuatro hijos , quienes ya son independientes. Su domicilio es propio, cuenta con luz, agua, letrina y esta ubicado en Patascahi, Distrito D. Ollaraya, Provincia D. Yunguyo. Se dedica a la a venta D. papa, chuño, tarwi, desD. hace 20 años atrás, también elabora aguayos y frazadas. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Unicahi, inició con S/. 300.00 con lo que compró lana D. diferentes colores, la cantidad D. 100 madejas, para elaborar frazadas. Con este crédito D. S/. 1,500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará chuño, papa , además comprará queso que será enviado a Lima a su hija y ella se encargará D. venderlo y enviar el dinero vía banco. Por esta fechas ella esta recogiendo la producción D. tarwi y papa . Perteneciendo al banco aprendió a salir adelante para que pueda apoyar a sus hijos, sueña que sus hijos vivan mejor que ella, que tengan sus casas y adquieran más bienes. Está muy agradecida por los préstamos, porque D. esa manera también ayuda a sus hijos que se encuentran en Lima.

loans.use: Purchase "chuño", potatoes and cheese to increase sales.

loans.name: Liberata

texts.es:
Liberata is 60 years old and married. She never had the opportunity to study. She has six children with her husband, Cirilo U. Coarita; five of them are in neighboring Chile and one of them is studying in the university. She and Cirilo own their home which fortunately has electricity, water, and a bathroom. They live in the Patascachi neighborhood in Unicachi, Yunguyo, Peru.

For the last 20 years, Liberata has worked in the production of decorative ropes and nets which she sells in the Tinicahi and Yunguyo markets.

She also sells potato flour and potatoes in the markets. She belongs to the “San Pedro D. Unicachi” village bank.

With this $125 loan which she will repay in four months, she plans to buy wholesale nets and rope.

She counts on the help of her husband who travels to Lima to buy the ropes and nets wholesale. Her great desire is for her children to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Liberata tiene 60 años D. edad, no estudio, es casada con Cirilo U. Coarita con quien tuvo seis hijos, quienes cinco D. ellos están en el país vecino Santiago D. Chile y uno D. ellos esta estudiando en la Universidad; La casa donD. vive es propia cuanta con luz, agua, letrina y esta ubicada en la Barrio Patascachi del Distrito D. Unicachi, provincia D. Yunguyo. El negocio que tiene la señora Liberata es la elaboración D. Soga o cahuiya, también hace redes, desD. hace 20 años , que los venD. en las ferias Tinicahi y Yunguyo. Paralelamente, también venD. chuño y papa en las ferias. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Pedro D. Unicachi”. Con este crédito D. S/. 300.00, que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará redes y soga al por mayor. Su anhelo es que sus hijos sigan trabajando, cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo que viaja a Lima para comprar redes por mayor, esperan seguir trabajando.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale nets and ropes

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala tiene 66 años D. edad, no pudo estudiar, ella vive sola es separada D. su esposo , con quien tuvo cuatro hijos, son independientes y radican tanto en Lima como en Tacna. La casa donD. vive esta ubicada en Barrio Marccajja, tiene luz y letrina el agua es consumida D. un pozo común. Del Distrito D. Unicachi. La señora Pascuala se dedica a la venta D. comida en el comedor popular “Maria Parado D. Bellido” del distrito D. Unicachi a esta actividad se dedica desD. hace 15 años atrás. Es integrante del Banco Comunal “San Pedro D. Unicachi” donD. saco un crédito inicial D. S/. 300.00 comprando víveres. Con este crédito D. S/. 1,000.00 soles, que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará diversos insumos y víveres para el negocio y dos ovejas. Ella es beneficiaria del vaso D. leche, estando en el banco comunal aprendió a ser solidaria en la atención que brinda es muy amable. Esta agradecida con el crédito, porque le permite trabajar y salir adelante.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Sra. Pascula is 66 years old, separated from her husband and has 4 children who are all living independent in Lima or Tacna; she was unable to study as a child. The house where she lives is located in the Marccajja Neighborhood and has electricity, a latrine and water that comes from a community reservoir. Sra. Pascuala sells food in the market “Maria Parado D. Bellido” in the Unicachi District where she has been working for 15 years. She is also a member of the Banco Comunal “San Pedro D. Unicachi” where she initially took out a loan for 300 soles to buy supplies. With this loan of 1000 soles (which will be paid in 4 payments) she will buy a number of diverse supplies for her business and two sheep. She is also a beneficiary of the organization “Vaso D. Leche” and via this experience has learned that the Communal Bank provides good service and she has also become supportive of them. She is very thankful for this loan because it allows her to work and to get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and livestock (sheep)

loans.name: Abu-Bakarr's Group

texts.en: The 4 members of this group are: Abu-Bakarr D., Anthony S., Lansana C. and Abdulai L.. They are all members of the army. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000.00 to  use for farming. One member will invest his share in building a house. As monthly wage earners, their paymaster will be deducting their monthly repayment to SMT  from their salaries at the end of each month.

loans.use: To buy seed rice, cassava and yams for farming

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja tiene 37 años de edad , estudio hasta sexto de primaria , habla aymará y poco castellano , es madre soltera tiene una hija que esta estudiando en el colegio del distrito de Unicachi . su domicilio cuenta con luz, agua, esta ubicada en barrio Lajje del distrito de Unicachi . Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal San Pedro de Unicachi. Se dedica a la venta de mallas de diferentes medidas, que ella adquiere por paquete de 1200 kilos , los cuales vienen en retazos muy grandes que ella los cose con hilo numero 12 alquitranado y lo vende por metros o kilos a los compradores que vienen de Bolivia, Yunguyo; con este negocio esta hace 8 años. Su hermana menor es la principal proveedora de la mercadería porque ella lo trae desde lima, también vende a las demás personas que se dedican a este negocio. Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mallas al por mayor. En fechas nos dice que se reúnen todas y comparten un plato que ellas mismas preparan, aprendió y dice que las mujeres podemos trabajar. Ella recibe el poyo de su hermana que viaja a Lima. El gran anhelo que ella tiene es comercializar malla por mayor viajar a Lima y que su hija sea profesional.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Mrs. Maruja is a 37 year old woman who studied up until 6th grade, speaks Aymara and some Spanish, and is a single mother with a daughter who is studying in a high school in Unicachi. Her home has water and electricity and is located in the Lajje neighborhood of the Unicachi district. She belongs to the Banco Comunal San Pedro de Unicachi and works selling cloth in different sizes. She buys it in packages of 1200 kilograms each and then she sews them by hand and sells the cloth by meters or kilos to buyers who come from Bolivia and Yunguyo. She has been doing this for 8 years. Her younger daughter is the principal provider of the merchandise since she brings it from Lima; she also sells to other people who work in this same business. With her loan of 1500 soles (which will be paid off in 4 installments) she will buy more cloth at a wholesale price. She also receives help from her sister in Lima. Her ultimate dream is to commercialize the sale of this cloth and also be able to support her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: Puchase of cloth at wholesale price

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
Giovanna, es la presidenta del banco comunal Unión 28 de Julio del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, tiene 31 años de edad, logro estudiar secundaria completa, es madre de dos hijos varones menores de edad. Desde hace once años atrás se dedica a la venta productos de confitería y de abarrotes su negocio esta ubicada Av. Brasil el cual es la casa de su madre. Es una de las tiendas bastante concurridas debido a que es una de las pocas tiendas que hay y está alejadas de la plaza. Para poder ampliar su negocio se asocio al Banco Comunal Unión 28 de Julio, accediendo inicialmente a un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero con el que ha invertido en la compra de leche, atunes, dulces, chocolates, arroz, fideos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 3 meses, comprará diversos productos de abarrotes, esta muy agradecida por el crédito, porque con él ayudará a incrementar su ingreso familiar. Manifiesta que aprendió a administrar su negocio de una manera muy ordenada que le permite ver las ganancias de su negocio. El gran anhelo que ella tiene es tener una tienda grande para poder vender por mayor y adquirir una casa propia y de esa manera que sus hijos sigan estudiando, sean profesionales.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Giovanna is the president of the Communal Bank in the District of Yunguyo. She is a 31 year old who completed her high school education, and is the mother of two young boys. She opened a grocery store and began selling confectionary products 11 years ago in the house of her mother, located on Av. Brasil. It is one of the most visited stores since it is one of the few that exists and is also a bit far from the main square. In order to help her business grow she became a member of the Communal Bank and began with an initial loan of 300 soles, which she invested in the purchase of milk, tuna, sweets, chocolate, rice and pastas. With this loan of 1700 soles, which will be paid in 3 months, she will buy a variety of different grocery products; she is very thankful for her credit because it has helped her increase her family’s income. She states that she has learned to administer her business in a very ordered manner that allows her to track the earnings. Her biggest goal is to have a large store in order to sell at wholesale and also obtain her own home so that her children may continue studying and become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase products at a whole sale price

loans.name: Serra's Group

texts.en: The 4 men in this group are:Mohamed Kamara, Abu S., Foday Turay and Borbor Samura. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,600,000.00. They are all members of the army and at the same time engage themselves in other forms of income generation activities like agriculture or business (usually through their wives). Through this extra income generation activities, they are able to meet most of their economic needs.

loans.use: To buy seed rice.

loans.name: Sine Safou Group

texts.fr:
The Sine Safou Group consists of women from Palmarin Ngallou (Senegal), who are busy processing local soap after having undergone training and gained experience in this field. Given the high cost of local soap, we are requesting a loan to buy the soap ingredients (myrrh oil, caustic soda, shea butter, scents, dyes etc) as well as equipment (buckets, valves, molds, mixers), in order to process the soap properly and be able to sell it to  people and thus combat dermatological diseases. 
 Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.
Le groupement Sine Safou est un groupement de femmes de Palmarin Ngallou qui s'active dans la transformation du savon local après avoir subi une formation tout en ayant de l'expérience dans ce domaine. Vu la cherté du prix du savon moderne, nous sollicitons un prêt pour acheter les composants du savon (huile de myrrhe, soude caustique, beurre de karité, parfums, colorants etc) mais aussi du matériel (seaux, vannes, moules, malaxeurs) afin de faire une bonne transformation du savon et pouvoir le vendre  aux populations tout en luttant contre les maladies dermatologiques.

loans.use: Processing and sale og local soap

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza- Grupo 4 Group

texts.en:
Teodora A. is a kind and gentle older lady who has used her loans from Esperanza Internacional for a little over one year now to sustain and grow her business. She owns a shop specializing in the sale of food and drink items, such as bread and various kinds of juice, and therefore uses her loans for the operation of the store, primarily purchasing goods to sell. Ms. A. is the mother of four children, three of whom are still her dependents. When not doing work for her store, she enjoys watching television and has a particular love for various juices. In the future she hopes to see her business grow and progress to better the lives of herself and her family.

In the picture provided, Ms. A. is with her loan group, but she is just one of 20 members of a micro-bank called Nueva Esperanza, or New Hope in English. Her story is just one among many of this group of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of the micro-credit loans of Esperanza. This group has come together with a common vision of a better life, with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans paid back in a group to reduce the risk of any one person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag so as to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business whether it be selling bread and various kinds of juice or cutting hair. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue. It is your concern and efforts that are able to bring a difference to the lives of these wonderful people.

loans.use: purchasing items such as clothing to sell or materials to operate a restaurant, etc.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha Lorena works in a trade she learned from her family, making videos and taking photos. Her husband is a photographer and she has been working together with him for 16 years. They have 3 children in school and they will continue to support them until they complete college. The loan will be used to purchase a professional video camera so they can work with more clients and offer better service. They hope to renovate all of the equipment they use in their photography business.

Martha Lorena siguió los conocimientos enseñados por su familia, se dedica a la grabación de videos y a la toma de fotografía a domicilio. Tiene 16 años de dedicarse a esta actividad junto a su esposo que es fotógrafo. Tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar y a quienes planean seguir apoyando hasta que éstos terminen sus carreras universitarias. El préstamo solicitado lo usarán en la compra de una cámara de video profesinal para así atender a más clientes y brindarles un mejor servicio. Esperan poder renovar todo su équipo usados en las grabaciones y tomas de fotos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A PROFESSIONAL VIDEO CAMERA FOR THEIR PHOTOGRAPHY BUSINESS, SO THEY CAN EXPAND THEIR CUSTOMER BASE AND OFFER BETTER SERVICE.

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es:
Johana lives in a neighborhhood called Villa Reconciliacion. She is married and has 4 children, only one of them is still studying in school and dependent on her. Johana has worked selling clothing for 24 years. Her husband helped her by selling an old business he had so that she could start her business. She has had ups and downs in her work, especially when customers don't pay their bills and she sells on credit.

She would like to grow her business and increase her sales. She will use the loan to purchase more women's clothing, which is always in great demand.

Johana habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente uno depende de ellas, está estudiando. Johana se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 24 años, su esposo le ayudó dándole la liquidación de un antiguo trabajo para que ella pudiera iniciar el negocio. Johana tiene temporadas buenas y malas, su trabajo se le hace díficil cunado tiene clientes que no le pagan a tiempo ya que ella vende al crédito. Sus planes son poder extenderse en su negocio y así incrementar sus ventas. El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de ropa de damas, que siempre es la más demandada por sus clientes.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS, ESPECIALLY WOMEN'S CLOTHING WHICH IS ALWAYS IN GREAT DEMAND.

loans.name: Dionisio Guadalupe

texts.es:
Dionisio has a taxi business which supports his family. He began this business 18 years ago with his own money. He would like to add another taxi to his business and rent it out, generating more income and growing his business. The loan will be used for maintenance on his vehicles.

Dionisio is married and has 4 children, 3 of them are now grown up and one is still in school. His wife works in a shop selling clothing and shoes to help with their household expenses.

Don Dionisio tiene una unidad de taxi en la que trabaja diariamente para llevar el sustento a su familia. Hace 18 años vendió un patrimonio familiar y con ese dinero compró el vehículo para usarlo en el servicio de taxi. Sus planes son adquirir otra unidad de taxi, la cual alquilará para generar más ingresos para su familia. El dinero será utilizado para darle mantenimiento al vehículo y así asegurarse que no le vaya a fallar. Don Dionisio es casado, su espsos es comerciante de ropa y zapatos y le apoya en lo económico. Tiene 4 hijos, 3 ya son independientes, y uno todavia está estudiando.

loans.use: TO PAY FOR MAINTENANCE ON HIS VEHICLES AND INVEST IN HIS TAXI BUSINESS.

loans.name: Zunilda's Group

texts.en:
Zunilda B. F. D. J. has a wonderful heart and ambitions for the growth of her business. She has used her loans to start a hair salon that has been functioning for about three years now with the help of loans. When asked about her business, she kindly smiles and offers to give me a haircut in the near future. Ms. B. F. D. J. has used her loans for purchasing materials for daily operation such as mirrors, scissors, clippers, chairs, and hair accessories. She is married with six children, three of whom live at home with her. She enjoys spending her free time with her grandson and visiting with people in her neighborhood. When asked about her favorite food, she laughs and says that she’s Dominican so she must like “la bandera”, which is a traditional dish consisting of rice, beans, and meat. Also, when she’s not working in her shop, she dedicates her time to her church and the upholding of her home. Ms. B. F. D. J. would like to see her business grow in the future to help proviD. for her and her family.

Ms. B. F. D. J. is one of a group of 5 persons, 'Grupo 1', that is part of a micro-bank called Miramar Femenina which consists of 35 members (other members of Miramar Femenina are seen in the photo). Her story is just one of those of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of the micro-credit loans of Esperanza. Together, this group has united with a common vision of a better life, with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans repaid in a group to reduce the risk of any one person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag so as to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business whether it is a barbershop or a restaurant. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue. It is your concern and efforts that are able to bring a difference to the lives of these wonderful people.

loans.use: scissors and mirrors for a hair salon, cooking supplies for a restaurant, etc.

loans.name: Lleni

texts.es:
La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Azucenas II, ubicado en el Jr. Mariano Melgar AA.HH Ucayali Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hermosos hijos, es madre soltera. Lleni con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió seguir implementando su fuente de soda. En la actualidad vende variedad de gaseosas así como también queques, golosinas, gelatinas y por las noches vende salchipapas , pollo brosther en su propia casa atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y siempre con mucha alegría. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,400 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 paquetes. de gaseosas de diferentes tamaños y marcas, 3 paquetes de yogourt. También lo invertirá en la construcción de la vereda de su casa. Lleni se siente muy contenta de pertenecer a un banco comunal de Manuela Ramos, ya que es un gran apoyo para las mujeres y que les ayuda a fortalecerse como persona y gracias a ello su negocio va creciendo.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Sra. Gloria belongs to the Banco Comunal Azucenas II located in the District of Yarina Cocha in the Department of Ucayali. She is 46 years old and is the mother of 2 beautiful children as a single mother. With the first loan of 300 soles she received from Manuela Ramos she decided to continue setting up her soda fountain. She currently works from her home and sells several varieties of sodas as well as cakes, candies, jello and at night french fries, hot dogs, and fried chicken; she always serves customers with great kindness and happiness. With the loan of 2400 soles (which will be paid in 5 months) she will buy 5 parcels of sodas in different sizes and brands, as well as 3 packages of yogurt. She will also invest in the construction of a sidewalk in front of her home. She is very happy to belong to the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank since it is a great support for women as it helps them to become stronger people and thanks them for helping her business continue growing.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks and yogurt. Construction of a sidewalk.

loans.name: María Marina

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces” domiciliada en el Jr: Francisco de Orellana Nº 139 del Distrito de Callería en el Departamento de Ucayali tiene 25 años, no tiene ni hijos ni esposo. Desde los 18 años es independiente, trabaja en sitios eventuales es por eso que no tiene estabilidad económica. Con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la compra y venta de productos medicinales y productos de belleza. En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio en su propio domicilio María se levanta muy temprano para organizarse y aprovechar mejor el tiempo dado que también es promotora de ventas de pasajes, todo el día esta fuera visitando, ofreciendo sus productos regresando a su casa a descansar a las 10 pm. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses. Invertirá en la compra de 5 potes de productos medicinales, 10 frascos de té, 25 formularios y 30 carpetas para implementar para la venta de pasajes. La experiencia de la vida hace de María una joven muy comprometida y responsable. Se siente segura por el inmenso respaldo brindado por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Maria belongs to the Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces” located in the District of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali. She is 25 years old and is neither married nor does she have children. Since she was 18 she has been independent and has worked in many jobs, leading to her economic instability. With the first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in the buying and selling of medicinal and beauty products. The business is currently in her own home. Maria gets up very early to organize herself and make best use of her time given that she is also working as a promoter to sell tickets and also selling her other products meaning that she does not return home until 10pm. With her most recent loan from Manuela Ramos of 1500 soles, which will be paid in 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of 5 pots of medicinal products, 10 bottles of tea, 25 forms, and 30 folders to implement the sale of tickets. Maria’s life experiences make her a very committed and responsible person. She feels very confident for the immense support given by the Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of medicinal products. Purchase of forms and folders

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan lives in a neighborhood about 15 miles from the main highway of Ticuantepe. He is 27 years old and married with two children who attend school. His wife is a stay at home mother and takes care of the family. Juan has a bicycle repair business, which he's been running for 3 years now. With the loan he is requesting he wants to invest in his business, increase his income and be better able to provide an education for his children.

El Sr. Juan habita en el barrio Km. 16 ½ de la carretera a Ticuantepe, tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y sus hijos están estudiando, su esposa es ama casa. El trabajo del Sr. Juan es técnico en reparación y tiene tres años de experiencia. El dinero que está solicitando es para incrementar el negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes incrementar las ventas y educar a sus hijos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: INVEST IN EQUIPMENT FOR HIS BICYCLE REPAIR BUSINESS, INCREASE HIS INCOME AND BE BETTER ABLE TO PROVIDE AN EDUCATION FOR HIS CHILDREN.

loans.name: Leyda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Leyda is 21 years old and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is married and has a young daughter who attends pre school. Her husband's work helps cover their household expenses. Leyda works selling cosmetics from her house, as well as door to door. She's been working in this business for 5 years, starting it on her own.

With the loan she is requesting, she would like to invest in her business by purchasing a variety of cosmetics to help her expand her customer base, increase her income and be able to pay for an education for her daughter.

Leyda tiene 21 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, es casada y tiene una niña en preescolar, su esposo es comerciante y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Leyda se dedica a la venta de cosmétcios en su casa de habitación y también ambulante, tiene cinco años de experiencias, inició con esfuerzos propios. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertir más en el negocio y así captar más clientes, comprará variedad de cosméticos. Para un futuro quiere diversificar sus productos y obtener mejores ingresos, y educar a su hija.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER COSMETICS BUSINESS, INCREASE HER CUSTOMER BASE AND INCOME, AND BE ABLE TO PROVIDE  A GOOD EDUCATION FOR HER DAUGHTER.

loans.name: Fanny Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Fanny is 30 years old. Her husband works in refrigerator repair which helps cover household expenses. They have a young son who attends school and they live in the neighborhood called La Borgona. 6 years ago, Fanny started a clothing business with her own money. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business, offer her customers more styles and variety, and grow her sales.

Doña Fanny tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio la Borgoña, tiene un hijo que esta en la primaria y su esposo trabaja como técnico en refrigeración y aporta en los gastos del hogar. La Sra. Fanny vende ropa y tiene seis años de experiencia en las ventas y comenzó con dinero propio. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertir más en las ventas y así ofrecer a sus clientes diversos estilos y variedades.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS

loans.name: Maria Hermelinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria is 43 years old, lives in the Ticuantepe neighborhood, is married and has three school-aged children. Her husband works as a bricklayer and Maria is a businesswoman who sells used clothing. She has three years experience and started her business on her own efforts. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of packaged clothing in bulk so that she can improve her income. In the future she will grow her business and attract more clients, allowing further education to her children.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el barrio de Ticuantepe, es casada y tiene tres hijos estudiando, su esposo trabaja como albañil. Doña Maria es comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tiene tres años de experiencia e inició con esfuerzos propios. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar una paca de ropa para el negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos. A futuro es incrementar el negocio y captar más clientes y brindar más educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of packaged clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela never imagined that her noble craft would provide such opportunities to improve her life and that of her family. This diligent woman began this work about 20 years ago at the suggestion of her mother, who saw in her knitting a true work of art. Adela began knitting articles of clothing by hand, and then after raising capital she acquired her knitting machine, which is an indispensable tool which allows her to streamline the production of her garments which are sold twice weekly at the San Jose market in Juliaca. Her valuable knowledge has been passed to her daughter Ruth, for whom Adela desires to provide a university education so that in the future she may enjoy the best opportunities in life. Adela needs your economic support in order to acquire wool and to continue knitting together her dreams and those of her daughter, who is the main reason she continues working so hard. Adela is placing her hope on you, and is eagerly awaiting your response.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Adela nunca imaginó que su noble labor de artesana le brinde la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, esta diligente mujer inició con esta labor hace a aproximadamente 20 años, por sugerencia de su madre quien veía en sus tejidos una verdadera obra de arte.Adela inició tejiendo manualmente sus prendas de vestir, luego de juntar capital adquirió su máquina de tejer, indispensable herramienta de trabajo que le permite agilizar la producción de sus prendas que son vendidas dos veces a la semana en el mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca. Sus valiosos conocimientos también los trasmite a su hija Ruth, a quien desea ofrecerle una carrera universitaria para que en el futuro pueda gozar de mejores oportunidades de vida.En esta oportunidad Adela requiere de vuestro apoyo económico para adquirir materia prima (lana) y seguir tejiendo ágilmente sus sueños y la de querida hija quien es la principal razón que la impulsa a perseverar en su oficio.Con la esperanza depositada en vosotros Adela se encuentra en espera de su pronta respuesta.

loans.use:
To acquire wool for the creation of garments.

Adquirir materia prima, lana, para la confección de sus prendas.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
In the community of Chimpa Jaran, about 15 kilometers from the city of Juliaca, the humble home of Filomena can be found. She is an exemplary mother who is very loving and dedicated to her loved ones. Filomena did not have the opportunity to go to school because she came from a family with few economic resources. But that was no reason to give up. With great priD. she decided to follow in the footsteps of her parents, who taught her farming and cattle production from a young age. Thanks to this noble work which she carried out together with her late husband she was able to proviD. her family with peace, security, and above all, an education for her dear children, of whom she is now very proud and feels very accomplished as a mother. Filomena's harvest of forage crops for her animals was affected this year by the cold weather that appeared throughout the country. For this reason she is requesting your collaboration in order to buy alfalfa to keep her dear animals well-fed and maintained.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

En la comunidad D. Chimpa Jaran, a unos 15 kilómetros D. la ciudad D. Juliaca está ubicada el humilD. hogar D. doña Filomena, madre ejemplar, amorosa y muy dedicada a los suyos, Filomena no tuvo la oportunidad D. seguir estudios primarios ni secundarios porque provenía D. una familia D. bajos recursos económicos, pero eso no fue razón para dejar D. lidiar, es por ello que con mucho orgullo decidió sacar adelante el oficio que sus padres desD. muy pequeña le enseñaron, la agricultura y producción D. ganado, gracias estas nobles labores que en todo momento desempeñó junto a su difunto esposo pudo brindarles tranquilidad, seguridad y sobre todo, educación a sus queridos hijos D. quienes actualmente se siente muy orgullosa y realizada como madre.Filomena, en esta fuerte temporada D. helada por la que atraviesa su país se ve afectada en la cosecha D. forraje para sus animalitos, por ello requiere D. vuestra colaboración para adquirir alfalfa y mantener bien alimentados a sus tiernos animales.

loans.use:
Purchase of alfalfa for her cattle. Due to the cold weather the forage crop harvest has been affected.

Compra de alfalfa para su ganado, ya que por helado clima, se ven afectadas sus cosechas de forraje.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
The entire family of Delia is involved in handicrafts and this diligent young woman could never set aside this noble work. The talent she inherited is flourishing in the lovely garments she sells wholesale in the San Jose Market in the city of Juliaca. In addition to this work, Delia also has a small grocery stand inside the Plaza las Mercedes in the same city. Thanks to the good management of these activities she is able to enjoy tranquility along with her humble parents. Due to the cold season orders for her beautiful knit clothing have increased greatly and in order to take advantage of this opportunity she wishes to receive a loan in the amount of 1000 Peruvian Soles ($350 US), which she will invest in acquiring a wide assortment of wools with which she will be able to continue her beautiful art.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Toda la familia de Delia siempre se dedicó a la artesanía y esta diligente joven no podía dejar de lado esta noble labor, es por ello que el talento que heredó viene aflorando en sus bellas prendas de vestir que son vendidas al por mayor dentro del mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca. Adicionalmente a esta labor Delia tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de abarrotes al interior de la Plaza las Mercedes de dicha ciudad, gracias al buen desempeño en estas actividades puede gozar de tranquilidad junto a sus humildes padres.Por esta temporada de frió, los pedidos de sus hermosas prendas tejidas se ha incrementado de una forma descomunal y para aprovechar este fenómeno desea obtener un préstamo por el monto de 1000 soles, dinero que invertirá en adquirir una infinita gama de lanas con el que podrá continuar con su bello arte.

loans.use:
Purchase of various types of wool for the knitting of garments, which due to the intense cold in the area has increased in demand.

Compra de variedades de lana para el tejido de sus prendas, ya que por el intenso frío en la zona se ha incrementado la demanda.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a loving father who responsibly cares for his household. Since he was a child his parents taught him the true value of work and the dignity it brings to one's life. This is why he is diligently prospering with his small clothing shop of jackets, backpacks and handbags, merchandise which they transport and sell in the city of Cuzco. In this manner Juan continues to get ahead together with his three young employees to whom he is able to offer secure jobs. This diligent man and his dear wife would like to expand their shop in order to make it one of the biggest in the area. They are sure that with your helping hand their dream will come true in no time!

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Juan es un amoroso padre que toma las riendas de su hogar muy responsablemente, desde niño sus padres le enseñaron el verdadero valor del trabajo y cuan dignificante es en la vida de una persona, por ello, que diligentemente viene prosperando con su pequeño taller de confección de casacas, mochilas y maletines, mercadería que transportan y venden en la ciudad del Cuzco, de esta forma Juan viene saliendo adelante y junto a sus 3 jóvenes empleados a quienes les ofrece un trabajo seguro.Este diligente hombre y su querida esposa tienen en mente ampliar su taller hasta convertirlo en uno de los más grandes de su localidad, están seguros que con tu mano amiga podrán cristalizar en corto tiempo este gran anhelo.

loans.use:
Raise investment capital for the expansion of his clothing shop.

Incremento de capital de inversión para la ampliación de su taller de confecciones.

loans.name: Román

texts.es:
Román, 41 years of age, is the owner of a vehicle with which he provides public transportation service in his hometown of Juliaca. His daily performance and perseverance have allowed him to improve his financial situation and the quality of life for his beloved family. During this time, Román has been associated with a transport company called “Las Maravillas”, providing service on one of the city’s designated routes. In all his years of work, his vehicle, an indispensable tool of the trade, never gave him any mechanical trouble, but now Román wants to provide thorough maintenance in order to ensure peace of mind for his passengers and his family. He looks forward to your support of this intention.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Román, de 41 años de edad es propietario de una movilidad con la que presta servicio de transporte urbano en su ciudad natal, Juliaca, su desempeño y constancia diaria le están permitiendo mejorar su situación económica, permitiéndole así, mejorar la calidad de vida de su amada familia.Durante este tiempo, Román, estuvo asociado a una empresa de transporte denominada “Las Maravillas” de la línea 5 de su ciudad, durante estos largos años de trabajo su indispensable herramienta de movilidad no le causó ningún problema mecánico, pero Román desea brindarle un mantenimiento completo para asegurar la tranquilidad de sus pasajeros y de su familia, Román espera contar con vuestro apoyo para este propósito.

loans.use: Perform thorough maintenance of his vehicle which he uses to provide public transportation

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja, a diligent and exemplary mother, has made her main income from her business of selling take-out food. Her six children have given and still give her the strength to persevere. After being abandoned by her partner and the father of her children, Maruja took control of the household and decided to adapt a small space in her house for her business. She sells salchipapa (fried potatoes), salchipollo (a chicken and fried potato dish), and rice with eggs. These delicious dishes sell at prices so affordable that she has been able to increase the number of her clients enormously. She still has the courage and strength to persist in the expansion and improvement of her business and thereby increase the quality of life for her sons. She dreams of providing them with a good education so that they will grow up to be good men with better opportunities. This loving mother needs your financial support, support which will be invested in renovating her place of business and acquiring food staples at wholesale prices. Let’s grant the request of this selfless mother.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta ejemplar y diligente madre ha hecho de su negocio su principal ingreso económico y la de sus 6 hijos, quienes le dieron y le dan la fuerza suficiente para seguir perseverando, aún después del abandono de su pareja y padre de sus hijos, desde entonces, Maruja tomó sola las riendas de su hogar, para ello decidió adecuar un pequeño espacio de su vivienda y vender comida al paso tales como: Salchipapa, salchipollo y arroz con huevo, estos deliciosos platos los vende a precios sumamente cómodos por lo que se ha incrementado enormemente la cantidad de clientes, pero doña Maruja sigue teniendo suficiente coraje y fortaleza para persistir en la ampliación y mejoramiento de su negocio y por ende la calidad de vida de sus hijos, a quienes sueña ofrecerles una buena educación para que el futuro sean hombres de bien con mejores oportunidades. Esta amorosa madre requiere de tu apoyo económico, apoyo que será invertido en hacer refaccionar su puestito de venta y adquirir insumos de primera necesidad al por mayor. Posibilitemos la petición de esta abnegada madre.

loans.use: The renovation of her place of business and the purchase of  food staples at wholesale prices

loans.name: Genith

texts.es:
Genith is 35 years old and has four children who are her reason for living. She is the owner of a motorcycle which is used by one of her sons to provide transport. She also runs a business with her partner selling frozen drinks in a bar in Pichis Palcazu. They both work hard to provide what is necessary for their children. Genith would like to improve her motorcycle, the tool of her trade. This would require buying spare parts and taking it into the shop for repairs. As she is the sustaining force for her family, she has set a goal to save money toward renovations to her bar that would provide a more welcoming reception to clients and would in turn increase her income. She needs capital to achieve her objective. With your help Genith will reach her goal in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Genith de 35 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, los mismos que son la razón de su vida, ella es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que maneja uno de sus hijos. Muy aparte, también cuenta con un local de venta de bebidas heladas (Bar) en Pichis Palcazu, el que se encuentra a cargo de su pareja, ambos trabajan duro y parejo por brindarle a sus hijos lo justo y necesario.Genith quiere mejorar su herramienta de trabajo, para ello requiere comprar repuestos y mandarlo a reparar, ya que es el sustento para su familia, ella se trazó una meta, que es ahorrar dinero para más adelante refaccionar algunos pormenores de su local y así desde luego, brindar una mejor acogida a sus clientes y desde luego incrementar su economía. Ella necesariamente requiere de un capital para lograr su objetivo. Con tu ayuda la señora Genith logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts with which to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Marja

texts.es:
Marja is 38 years of age and is the owner of a motorcycle that her brother drives for work. Marja also works in textile art, which provides supplemental income. Her partner Daniel works as a miner, and when he is able to he supports her in her work. Marja does everything for her two children and wants to give them all they will need to become professionals. At this time, she needs to improve the condition of her motorcycle and to purchase another engine, for which she needs a loan. Marja awaits your help.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Marja tiene 38 años de edad, es propietaria de un motocarro que maneja su hermano, a quien de esta manera le brinda un trabajo, muy aparte Marja se dedica al arte textil, que es un apoyo económico extra. Su pareja, Daniel, se dedica a la extracción de minas y cuando puede le brinda apoyo en su trabajo. Marja hace todo esto por sus 2 hijos a quienes desea brindarles lo necesario hasta que sean profesionales. Ella en la actualidad necesita mejorar las condiciones de su motocarro, como también, comprar otro motor, sin embargo para ello necesita de un préstamo para lograr lo que realmente quiere. Ella espera de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Make repairs to her motorcycle

loans.name: Liz Lery

texts.es:
Liz pertenece al Banco Comunal Solidaridad, Jr. Cayetano heredia Mz b Lt 11, del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años y es madre soltera de 1 niño. Vive con sus padres. Para no depender de sus padres decide poner un negocio que consiste en comprar fierros y calaminas para fabricar canaletas, ventana de fierro, para ello hace un préstamo a Manuel Ramos el monto de S/. 300.00 En la actualidad tiene una mini empresa de fabricación ubicada en su propio domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo de su padre y él dirige la obra. Liz se dedica a la atención de sus clientes todo el día para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am., al mismo tiempo que se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, a partir de las 8:00 am hasta las 6: 00pm atiende su negocio. . Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,100, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 30 fierros, 20 planchas de calaminas y 5 baldes de pintura. Liz esta muy feliz, se siente muy bien porque así puede educar a su hijo, esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda su padre y la confianza que pone Manuela Ramos en ella.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Liz belongs to the Banco Communal Solidaridad located in the District of Yarinacocha in the Department of Ucayali. She is 30 years old and is a single mother with one child; she currently lives with her parents. In order to not depend on her parents she decided to open a business in which she buys iron and tin to manufacture gutters and iron framed windows. In order to continue this she is asking for a loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles. She currently has a mini manufacturing company located in her home where she is supported by her father who directs the work. Liz focuses on caring for her clients all day long from 8am to 6pm; in the morning she gets up at 6am and does household chores until it is time to care for her business. With her most recent loan from Manuela Ramos of 1100 soles (which will be paid in 5 months) she will buy 30 iron rods, 20 sheets of tin and 5 buckets of paint. Liz is very happy because she will be able to educate her child; she is very grateful for the support offered by her father and the trust that Manuela Ramos places in her.

loans.use: Purchase of iron, tin and paint

loans.name: Geovana

texts.es:
Geovana is 31 years old, the mother of two children and is pregnant with a third. She wants to give her best to her children while they need her. After selling groceries and everyday necessities for quite a while in her little general store, Geovana decided to look in the commercial district for a busier location for her business. Her partner, Segundo, is a mechanic working for a well-known company in the area. He supports Geovana in everything, above all in her business. Geovana is committed to expanding her business and improving the condition of her store. However she needs capital in order to achieve her goals. Support this hard-working mother; she will not disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Geovana tiene 31 años, vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace mucho tiempo, en su pequeña bodega, se decidió por este negocio al encontrarse ubicada en una zona comercial y muy concurrida, ella es madre 2 hijos y actualmente está embarazada, su pareja, el señor Segundo es mecánico y trabaja en una empresa muy reconocida en la zona, y es quien la apoya en todo, sobre todo en su negocio. Ella espera darle a su hijos lo mejor hasta el momento que necesiten de ella. Geovana se prometió implementar, ampliar y mejorar los ambientes de su negocio, sin embargo para todo esto que ella desea hacer estima de un capital para lograr su objetivo. Apoya a esta madre que trabaja duro, ella no te defraudara.

loans.use: Expansion and improvement of her general store

loans.name: Reyna Amanda

texts.es:
Reyna is a member of the "Lilies II" Communal Bank, located at AA.HH 11 of Julio Psje. Fraternidad 189 in the Callería District of the Ucayali region. She is 49 and has 3 children; her husband is a carpenter. With the first loan of S/ 300 she received from Kiva field partner Manuela Ramos, she began a business in grocery sales.

Reyna has a fighting spirit, seeking income where she can. As such, she also serves lunches at the local sawmill and works nights selling meals with the help of her daughter.

With the currently requested loan of S/ 1,200, which is to be re-paid in 5 months, she will buy 3 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 1 box of milk, packages of noodles, half a box of soap, and various snacks.

Reyna is very enterprising and works incessantly. She has many projects to complete, one of which is to finish the 2nd floor of her house. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the endorsement they have offered her.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Reyna pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el AA.HH 11 de Julio Psje. Fraternidad 189, Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y tiene 3 hijos y su esposo es maderero. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 implementó su negocio en abarrotes.

Reyna es una mujer muy luchadora, ya que busca su ingreso económico por todo lado tal es así que también da almuerzo en un aserradero y por las noches vende comida con el apoyo de su hija.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 sacos de Arroz, 2 sacos de Azúcar, 1caj. Leche, paquetes de fideos, 1/2 caj. Jabón y variedad de golosinas.

Reyna es muy emprendedora de tal manera que ella trabaja sin cesar por que tiene muchas cosas que realizar uno de ello es terminar de hacer su casa el 2do piso y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el respaldo brindado.

loans.use:
Wholesale purchase of groceries
Compra al por mayor de diversos productos (abarrotes)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Her daily work, says Sadith, is to provide good customer service and to offer products at prices that suit every pocketbook. Sadith sells fruit, bananas, cassava and fish. She is 36 years old and the mother of two. Her sons are in school and are her motivation for getting ahead. Her partner Artur, who works as a sharpener at a sawmill, always looks out for Sadith and her sons, especially when it comes to business decisions that Sadith proposes. Her wish now is to continue to build her business. Let’s help this hard-working mother to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Su labor diaria es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y sobre todo ver que sus productos estén al alcance de sus bolsillos, nos cuenta la señora Sadith, quien vende fruta, plátano, yuca y pescado. A sus 36 años es madre de 2 hijos que estudian y son su motivo de salir adelante, su pareja, el señor Artur, trabaja en un aserradero, es afilador y siempre está al pendiente de ella y de sus hijos, sobre todo con las decisiones de negocio que se propone la señora Sadith. Su deseo ahora es seguir creciendo en su negocio, ampliar e implementar. Apoyemos a esta madre que trabaja duro por salir adelante.

loans.use: Expand her business in food sales

loans.name: Martha Odile

texts.es:
Martha C. is 48 years old, and the single mother of 4 adult children who are now independent of her. Martha has a store in her home where she supplies part of the Casimiro Sotelo neighborhood with products of basic consumption, such as clothing and cosmetics. She has had this business for 7 years and found it very difficult to count on the small amount of capital she makes for investing. Her initial sales were of firewood and soft drinks, but her business has since grown. Martha desires to improve her standard of living with this business. With this loan she will try to invest in basic grains, packaged clothing and cosmetics in order to obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Martha C. tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos que ya son independientes a ella. Martha tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación donde abastece a parte del barrio Casimiro Sotelo de productos de consumo básico, así como también ropa y cosméticos. Tiene 7 años de tener este negocio, en el cual ha encontrado la dificultad de contar con poco capital para poder invertir. Sus ventas iniciales fueron de leña y refrescos, pero ahora su negocio ya ha crecido. Martha desea mejorar su nivel de vida con este negocio. Con el préstamo pretende invertir en granos básicos, paca de ropa y cosméticos para adquirir más ganacias

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, packaged clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Mr. Rodolfo is 45 years old and has been working in transportation for many years. His wife, Keyla, supports him in his decisions and agrees with his goals. To Rodolfo, the most important thing is working hard so that he can provide everything necessary for his children who are students and the center of his life. Rodolfo owns a motorbike, but would like to purchase another and hire another person to drive it to increase his income. However, Rodolfo need to purchase replacement parts for his current motorbike that is in disrepair. With your help Rodolofo will be able to achieve his goal in a very short time. Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Rodolfo tiene 45 años y labora en el transporte de pasajeros desde hace muchos años, su esposa Keyla lo apoya en todas sus decisiones y está de acuerdo con sus metas trazadas. Para él lo más importante es trabajar duro, ya que de antemano quiere brindarle todo lo necesario a sus hijos que estudian y son su razón de ser. Rodolfo es propietario de un motocarro, pero desea comprar otro, para lo cual empleará a otra persona que lo maneje, y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Sin embargo, su moto requiere de una reparación urgente y la compra de repuestos. Con tu ayuda haremos cumplir el propósito de Rodolfo en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for this motorbike.

loans.name: Sehllyn Lisseth

texts.es:
Sehllyn is 28 years old, lives in the Casmilo Ortega neighbor, and is married. Her husband is and architect and supports her economically. She has one young son. Together they try to improve their living conditions. Sehllyn has a small store where she sells clothing, cosmetics, and home electronics. She has 5 years experience and started the business with S. of used clothing. She wishes to improve her business, and this loan will be used as investment capital in order to achieve better income.

Sehllyn tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el barrio Casimilo Ortega, es casada, su esposo es Arquitecto y le apoya económicamente. Tiene un hijo que es menor de edad. Junto a su familia pretenden mejorar las condiciones de vida. Sehllyn tiene una pequeña tienda donde ofrece ropa, cosméticos y electrodomésticos, tiene 5 años de experiencia e inició el negocio con venta de ropa usada. Desea ampliar más el negocio, el préstamo será usado en inversión de capital para lograr mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Investment capital for her business.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene entered the field of textiles at a young age, and her great experience and practice has made her into a textile-producing "machine," as her quality work is in high demand. She is 34 years old, and is the mother of 3 children. Marlene and her husband, who is a construction worker, work hard to offer their children quality education and happiness, as they are still students. To compliment her income, Marlene is learning how to decorate fabric, and her goal is to have her own workshop one day. To do so, she wants to increase the types of fabrics with with she works, and later enlarge and improve her small business. To achieve this goal Marlene hopes that you trust her and offer her the loan that she is seeking.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Marlene se inició en el arte textil desde muy temprana edad de forma empírica, sin embargo la experiencia y la práctica hicieron de esta mujer una máquina de trabajo, ya que es muy solicitada por su buena labor. A sus 34 años es madre de 3 niños, que aún están estudiando, por la que ella y su esposo Néstor, quien trabaja en la construcción, dan todo su esfuerzo por brindarles una buena educación y felicidad.Para complementar su negocio, Marlene está aprendiendo decoración de telas, su meta es tener su propio taller, pero para ello quiere implementarse con diversos materiales y posteriormente ampliar y mejorar el lugar donde tiene su pequeño negocio, para realizar esta meta espera que confíes en ella brindándole el préstamo que solicita.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and rent space for her workshop.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel works in transportation. He began as a driver and now owns a motorbike. Fidel is 41 years old and has 4 children, whom motivate him to push forward. His wife, Elsa, agrees with what Fidel proposes, and lovingly supports him. Fidel also plants and cultivates corn, yuca, and plantain among other crops, which he sells in the local market. The important thing right now is educating his children so that in the future they will be good fathers and husbands. Fidel wants to prosper as a taxi driver, however, his motorbike is in disrepair, and need to purchase replacement parts and pay a mechanic. Please support this father who eagerly works to finish on top.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

El transporte de pasajeros es la actividad diaria que hace el señor Fidel, empezó como chofer y ahora es propietario de un motocarro, el mismo que maneja, a sus 41 años es padre de 4 hijos, los mismos que son el motivo para seguir adelante, su esposa, la señora Elsa está de acuerdo con lo que él se propone y lo apoya amorosamente. Fidel también se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de maíz, yuca, plátano, entre otros productos, que los lleva a vender en el mercado de su localidad. Lo importante ahora es educar a sus hijos para que en un mañana ellos sean buenos padres y esposos.Fidel quiere prosperar en el ámbito del transporte, sin embargo, ahora necesita tener en buenas condiciones su motocarro, para ello requiere comprar repuestos y mandar a repararlo, ya que presentó fallas mecánicas. Apoya a este padre que trabaja con mucho ahínco por salir adelante.

loans.use: Comprar repuestos y mandar a reparar su motocarro.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is 26 years old and the mother of two school-age sons. Thanks to the education and strong values that Elizabeth has taught them, her sons are intelligent and well-mannered. Her husband works in the river transportation business and supports Elizabeth in her business. For the past few years, Elizabeth has sold sweets, drinks and ice cream, as well as running a small car wash. Due to her charisma, Elizabeth has attracted a steady stream of customers. Now she would like improve her business, because of which she is requesting a loan. With your support Elizabeth will achieve her goal in no time.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth (26 años) es madre de 2 niños que aún están estudiando, gracias a la educación y las buenas costumbres que ella les imparte son unos muchachos muy listos y educados. Su esposo se dedica al transporte fluvial y apoya a Elizabeth en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas heladas y cuenta también con un pequeño lavadero de motos y autos desde hace ya tiempo, debido a su carisma cuanta con gran concurrencia de clientes. Ahora se encuentra en la necesidad de implementar su negocio, por ello que solicita D. dinero que pide en préstamo. Con tu apoyo la señora Elizabeth logrará pronto su objetivo.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Guirmen

texts.es:
Guirmen is a hardworking man who has been working in the transportation business for the last number of years. He owns three motorbikes, one of which he drives himself, and the other two he lends to his cousins. Guirmen is 37 years old and the father of two school-age sons that love him very much. His wife sells food at night. The most important thing for Guirmen is to make his sons study so that they will be able to become professionals. At the moment he needs to purchase replacement parts for his motorbikes so that he can repair them. Later, Guirmen wants to support his wife in opening a corner store in which she can sell food. For these reasons Guirmen is asking you for a loan, which he promises to repay soon.
