Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Guirmen es un hombre trabajador que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace varios años atrás, es propietario de tres motocarros, uno de ellos lo maneja el mismo y los otros por dos de sus sobrinos a quienes les brinda trabajo de esa forma. Guirmen tiene 37 años y es padre de 2 hijos los cuales estudian y lo quieren mucho, su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches. Lo más importante para Guirmen es hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que logren ser buenos profesionales.Ahora necesita comprar repuestos para sus motocarros y darles un mantenimiento completo, posteriormente quiere apoyar a su señora mandando a construir un kiosco para la venta de comida, porque actualmente lo hace de manera ambulante. Esto son los motivos por los que Guirmen recurre a ustedes para solicitarles un préstamo, que promete pagar de manera puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for his motorbike so that he can repair them.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
Jimmy is as 28 year old father of a small boy, and works as a taxi driver. He is the owner of 2 motorbikes with which he is able to support his family. Jimmy's goals is to be a responsible parent and to be able to offer his son an adequate education. Because of this, Jimmy wants to repair one of his motorbikes that is in disrepair. This is why Jimmy wants a loan, in order to buy replacement parts to fix his motorbike. In the future, Jimmy would like to open a shop that would be run by his wife. Let's help this father who demonstrates a desire to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Jimmy tiene 28 años y es padre de un pequeño niño, él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es propietario de dos motocarros con los cuales da el sustento diario a su hogar. La finalidad de Jimmy como todo padre responsable, es brindarle a su hijo una adecuada educación, por ello en motivo de su esfuerzo.Jimmy desea reparar uno de sus motocarros ya que se encuentra en un mal estado, para ello requiere del préstamo que aquí solicita, para comprar repuestos y algunas piezas que harán que funcione su herramienta de trabajo; aparte del sus motos, en adelante Jimmy quiere abrir una bodega que pueda ser administrado por su esposa. Apoyemos a este padre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts and fix his motorbike.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Mr. José is 60 years old. He is the father of 3 children that have their own families and makes enough to support Mrs. Estela, he wife. José is the owner of a motorcar and he works providing transport to passenger as he has for quite some time, and he works hard to give his wife the things she needs to live securely and happily. Previously José raised chickens but he gave up that work due to health reasons, and now he would like to sell groceries and staple products. José is a dedicated and enterprising father and he would like to continue his family's financial growth but he needs a loan to complete his objectives such as fixing his motorcar. With your help, Mr. José will realize his goals in no time at all.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

El señor José tiene 60 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos, los mismos que ya tienen su propia familia, su esposa la señora Estela lo apoya bastante. José es propietario de un motocarro y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde ya tiempo atrás, él trabaja duro por brindarle a su esposa lo necesario y ambos vivan felices y tranquilos.Anteriormente José se dedicaba a la crianza de pollos, pero lo dejó por motivos de salud, y ahora quiere vender abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. José es un padre emprendedor y decidido que quiere seguir creciendo, sin embargo, requiere de un préstamo para cumplir su objetivo, como también arreglar su motocarro. Con tu ayuda el señor José logrará su meta en el tiempo menos esperado.

loans.use: To repair his motorcar and to start a small store

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex is 26 years old. He is a young father who earns money through the transport of passengers in his motorcar as well as through the care and maintenance of a small shop in his spare time. Together with his wife, Alex strives to provide for the care and education of his small children. Alex needs to buy spare parts for his motorcar and to get it repaired so that he can be sure it works every day, and little by little, he would like to expand and offer more and improve his shop. For this he turns to you to ask for this loan promises to pay it back punctually. Alex knows the strength of his youth and this helps him to set new goals for himself. He hopes that you put your confidence in him.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Alex es un joven padre de 26 años, dedicado al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro, y en sus momentos libres al cuidado y mantenimiento de su bodega. Junto a su esposa se esfuerzan para cumplir con el cuidado y la educación de sus pequeños hijos.Alex necesita comprar repuestos para su motocarro y mandarlo a reparar para seguir trabajando diariamente, y poco a poco ir ampliando e implementando más y mejor su bodega, por ello que recurre a ustedes para solicitar un préstamo, que promete pagar puntualmente. Alex sabe que las fuerzas de su juventud lo ayudan a emprender nuevas metas, y espera que pongan su confianza en él.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair the motorcar he uses for passenger transport and to improve his shop

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is a member of the "Audacious Women" Communal Bank located at Jr: Bolívar Nº 453 in the Callería District in the Ucayali area. She is 48 and separated. She is the mother of three children, two older and one younger; all are students. Her responsibilities are great and her income was insufficient to meet her needs. For this reason, she chose to invest in a catering business with her first loan of S/ 300 from Kiva field partner Manuela Ramos. Additionally, she sells medicinal products.

She runs her business from her home. She takes incoming orders and also solicits business from parties who might be interested in her services.

She is currently requesting a loan through Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/ 2,000 that is to be repaid within 5 months. With this loan, she will invest in 24 acrylics, 80 meters of colored fabric for decorating, and ten containers of various medicinal products.

Adela is a very creative and upbeat person. She is happy with her business and with the fact that it allows her to help her children, who are the reason for her existence. She is grateful for the opportunity and the confidence being given to her by the Manuela Ramos Movement.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Adela pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces” domiciliada en el Jr: Bolívar Nº 453 del Distrito D. Callería en el Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 48 años, es separada y madre D. 3 hijos, 2 son mayores y 1 menor, todos estudian. La responsabilidad es mayor y los ingresos no alcanzan, es así que con el primer préstamo D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300 soles deciD. invertir en la preparación D. tortas para fiestas, buffet y arreglo D. locales. Paralelamente venD. productos medicinales.

En la actualidad cuenta con su negocio en su propio domicilio. Adela atienD. pedidos así como sale para ofrecer a diferentes personas que les podría interesar este servicio

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra D. 24 acrílicos, 80 metros D. tela D. colores para la decoración D. locales, 10 potes variados D. productos medicinales.

Adela es una persona alegre y muy creativa donD. se siente muy feliz por el negocio que tiene pues podrá ayudar a sus hijos, que son la razón D. su existencia agradece por la oportunidad y confianza brindado por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of acrylics, fabrics, and medicinal products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier is a young man who has wanted to devote himself to the breeding and care of animals since he was only a teenager. Through this work he could gain personal satisfaction and could help his parents with living expenses at a time when they were experiencing severe financial problems. Now this activity not only serves to help his parents, but also allows Javier to save money for when he starts his own family. He is saving for a place to live, a place to start a household, by the grace of GOD. For this, Javier needs $175 to buy animals to increase his heard and improve his livestock, in order to make the sale of his animals more profitable. Thus Javier presents his request to you in order find the support he needs to keep his business growing and so that he can soon start a family.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Javier es un joven que desde que era sólo un adolescente se entregó de lleno en la siembra y cuidado de animales, con lo que pudo obtener grandes satisfacciones y ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar, en una época donde estaban pasando severos problemas económicos. Ahora, esta actividad no sólo le sirve para ayudar a sus padres, sino también a ahorrar para cuando él tenga su propia familia, un lugar donde pueda vivir y donde pueda formar un hogar con el favor de DIOS.Por ello, requiere de 500 soles para adquirir animales para aumentar su ganado y mejorar la raza, para hacer más rentable la venta de sus animales. Javier presenta su pedido ante usted, con la finalidad de encontrar un apoyo para seguir creciendo y formar prontamente un hogar.

loans.use: To buy breeding animals to improve the quality of his livestock

loans.name: Virgen Elena

texts.es:
Virgen is a loving mother of 3 children who are already adults. Now she only supports her youngest daughter who is at University and Virgin wishes to continue this support so that her daughter completes her studies. Virgin sells clothing which she offers, house to house, to her friends and also to the neighborhoods around her. She is able to sell her merchandise at low prices and on credit. This is how she is able to support herself, but she has in her mind a plan to open her own juice stand and to rent a shop space for clothing sales. That way she will no longer have to walk door to door and she will be able to attend to all of her business. The loan that she asks for is for the rental of the store area and to buy ingredients for making juice. We hope that you can help Virgin to start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Virgen es una dulce madre de 3 hijos que ya son mayores y sólo vela por el cuidado de su última hija quien cursa estudios universitarios y desea seguir a apoyándola para que concluya estos. Virgen se dedica a la venta de ropa, que ofrece de casa en casa a sus vecinos y amigos y también por los alrededores de su localidad, con el fin de poder dejar su mercadería a precios módicos y a crédito.De esta forma es como se gana la vida, pero tiene en mente un proyecto para abrir una juguería y alquilar un local para la venta de ropa, así ya no tendría que caminar por las calles y podría atender desde cerca ambos negocios. El préstamo que solicita es para el alquiler del local y la compra de insumos para la fabricación de los jugos. Esperamos que usted pueda ayudarle a doña Virgen a realizar su negocio.

loans.use: To rent a shop area for the sale of clothing and to buy supplies for a juice stand

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza is a member of the "Lilies II" Communal Bank, located at Jr. 3 de Octubre / Jr. Contamana, in the YarinaCocha District of the Ucayali area. She is 34 and single. With the first loan she received through Kiva partner Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/. 300, Martiza invested in a business selling treats/snacks.

Maritza runs her business very carefully as it represents her only source of income. The proceeds of her business are also helping her pay for her advanced studies.

The loan currently requested is in the amount of S/. 1,500 and is to be repaid in 5 months. With this loan, she will buy snacks, sodas and essential groceries.

Maritza is happy to receive an endorsement by Manuela Ramos that has not been extended to her by any other institution; no other institution has has had confidence in her or counted on the products guaranteed by their loans, but Manuela Ramos did.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maritza pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el Jr. 3 de Octubre / Jr. Contamana, D. Distrito de YarinaCocha D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años y es soltera. Maritza con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de golosinas.

Maritza atiende su negocio con mucho cuidado y esmero dado que por el momento es su único ingreso. También esta costeando sus estudios superiores.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará golosinas, gaseosas y abarrotes (alimentos de primera necesidad).

Maritza esta feliz porque se siente respaldada por Manuela Ramos y ninguna otra institución ha confiado en ella dado que no cuenta con bienes que garantice sus prestamos, pero Manuela si lo hizo.

loans.use:
Purchase of treats and general grocery items
Compra de golosinas y artículos en general (abarrotes)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth works as a farmer and is the mother of two small children to whom she wishes to give everything needed for their growth and development, especially with regards to their education. Agriculture is an activity that is very important to her in such a way that she values and takes care of her land because the economy of her household depends on it. Elizabeth's problem is the price increase of compost and fertilizer. It is for this she asks for a loan so that she may prepare her land for sowing. Elizabeth hopes that you are able to help her so that harvest time is favorable for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura, es madre de 2 hijos pequeños a quienes desea brindarle todo lo necesario para su crecimiento y desarrollo, sobre lo referente a su educación. La agricultura es una actividad muy importante para ella, de tal forma que valora y cuida sus tierra porque de ellas depende la economía de su hogar. El problema de Elizabeth es el incremento de los precios de los abonos y fertilizantes, por ello solicita este préstamo, para poder así preparar sus tierras para la siembra. Ella espera que usted pueda ayudarla para que el tiempo de cosecha sea favorable para su familia.

loans.use: To buy compost and fertilizer for the preparation of her farmland

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María is a humble housewife who dedicated her time to construction work, working without concern for how hard and tiring this activity is. She does this because one has to put everything else aside when you have a sick child in the house and must pay for their treatment and medicine. For María, the day that her son suffered an accident in her house was the start of many long days of concern and expensive treatments. Her son now requires a CT scan and for this María works hard to save enough money for her son's CT scan. María believes that this additional work will earn enough money to cover her son's treatment expenses. Support María so that her work is prosperous and makes the money that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Doña María es una humilde madre de familia que dedica su tiempo en obras de construcción, trabaja sin importarle lo duro y cansado que pueda ser esta actividad, y lo hace porque todo queda de lado cuando se tiene un niño enfermo en casa y hay que pagar los tratamientos y medicinas. Para María, el día en que su hijo sufrió un accidente en su propia casa fue el comienzo de muchos días llenos de preocupación y costosos tratamientos. Su hijo requiere ahora de una tomografía, por ello que María trabaja duramente para ahorrar el dinero suficiente para la tomografía de su hijo. María confía que son esta labor adicional pueda completar los gastos del tratamiento de su hijo. Apoya a María para que su actividad sea próspera y obtenga buenas ganancias, tan necesarias para ella.

loans.use: Capital investment to purchase clothing to sell in areas near her home

loans.name: Amador

texts.es:
Amador is the humble father of 3 children who depend on him economically and who are his driving force in life, Don Amador leases farming land for seasons, since he does not own land, he cultivates his crops and then sells them, but his profit decreases due to the land payments. Therefore, Amador wishes to quickly acquire his own land, where he can sow his crops calmly and improve his revenue at home. To make that a reality, he needs to increase his production and especially the quality of his products to make them more profitable in the marketplace. This will bring better profits and then will be able to acquire a plot of land. The amount required by Amador at the moment is 600 soles for the purchase of fertilizers and compost; we hope that you will be of great help to this hard working father.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Amador es un humilde padre de 3 hijos quienes dependen de él económicamente y quienes son su motor en la vida, don Amador arrienda terrenos de cultivo por temporadas, ya que no cuenta con tierras propias, cultiva sus productos y luego les vende, pero la ganancia es recortada por el pago del terreno. Por ello, Amador desea adquirir prontamente un terreno propio, donde pueda sembrar con tranquilidad y mejorar los ingresos en su hogar. Para que esto se haga realidad, necesita incrementar su producción y sobre todo la calidad de sus productos, para que sean más rentables en el mercado, esto le traerá mejores ganancias, para luego adquirir un terreno propio. La suma que requiere Amador en estos momentos es 600 soles para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos, esperamos que usted sea de gran ayuda para este padre trabajador.

loans.use: Purchase compost and fertilizers to improve the quality of his products, obtain better earnings and power to buy his own land.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina is a woman dedicated to her children, although they are older she always tries to ensure their well being while they are unmarried, as any mother would. Because of them she was able to recover from various difficult situations that she went through with her partner who abandoned her 2 years ago and left her with nothing. Since that moment she has invested her time and little money to buying dairy products which she sells from home, all her neighbors support her and place yogurt orders. Guillermina realized that her business is very profitable and wants to increase her capital to continue making and selling yogurt, and for that reason requests a loan. With the profits she wants to buy crates of fruit and begin the sale of such products, but for now, supports Guillermina for its yogurt continue to reach more homes and have higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermina es una mujer muy entregada a sus hijos, a pesar de ser ya mayores siempre trata de velar por ellos mientras estén solteros, como toda madre. Por ellos pudo reponerse de las diversas situaciones difíciles que pasó con su pareja quien hace dos años la abandonó dejándola sin nada, desde ese momento ha invertido su tiempo y el poco dinero que tiene en la compra de lácteos los cuales vende dentro de su localidad, todos sus vecinos y vecinas la apoyan y le hacen pedidos de yogurt. Guillermina se dio cuenta de que su negocio es muy rentable y por ello desea incrementar su capital para continuar en la fabricación y venta de yogurt, y es para ello que solicita el presente préstamo. Con las ganancias del mismo desea comprar cajones de fruta e iniciarse también en la venta de estos producto, pero por el momento, apoya a Guillermina para que su yogurt sigan llegando a más hogares y tenga mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Increase in capital to buy milk and yogurt to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.es:
Rosemarie is the mother of a 5 year old boy who motivates her move forward day to day, despite the difficulties of being a single mother and having suffered the abandonment of her partner. She managed to open a small shop where she positioned a small area for arcade games for the entertainment of children and teenagers who meet regularly to play. But now Rosemarie has encountered certain difficulties due to broken game machines and wants to be able to repair them and that is why she requests a loan. If she has broken arcade games then it results in less daily income for her home. We hope that you can be very helpful to Rosemarie; she has shown she can succeed despite adverse circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosemarie es madre de un pequeño niño de 5 años quien la motiva día a día a salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que tiene por ser madre soltera y haber sufrido el abandono de su pareja. Logró abrir una pequeña tienda donde también acondiciona un pequeño espacio donde tiene unas máquinas de juego para la diversión de los niños y jóvenes quienes concurren habitualmente. Pero ahora Rosemarie tiene ciertas dificultades por las fallas de sus máquinas y desea poder repararlas y para ello solicita un este préstamo. Ya que si tiene sus máquinas malogradas es un menor ingreso diario para su casa. Esperamos que usted pueda ser de gran ayuda para Rosemaria, ella ha demostrado se puede salir adelante a pesar de las circunstancias en contra.

loans.use: Repair arcade games.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles is a first time father, his daughter has become the engine of his daily work. He grows potatoes, and maize, work with which he is hopeful of making progress and provide what is necessary for his young family that needs it. For that reason he wants to invest in his production, expand his crop fields and improve the quality of his products. Achiles knows that if he takes care of his land and works diligently he will reap excellent products that will have a better reception in the marketplace. The request Achiles makes is to purchase fertilizers necessary for his land. Support this new father so his effort is worthwhile.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Aquiles es un joven que acaba de ser padre por primera vez, su hija se ha convertido en el motor de su trabajo diario, él siembra papas, alverjas y maíz, trabajo con el cual tiene la esperanza de progresar y ofrecer lo necesario a su joven familia que tanto lo necesita. Por ello desea invertir en su producción, ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos y mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Aquiles sabe que si cuida de su tierra y la trabaja con esmero podrá cosechar excelentes productos que tendrán mayor acogida en el mercado. El pedido que hace Aquiles es para la compra de los abonos necesario para sus terrenos. Apoya a este nuevo padre para que su esfuerzo, al final, valga la pena.

loans.use: Purchase compost for his fields.

loans.name: Olson

texts.es:
Olson is 20 years old and has been working with his family in agriculture since he was a teenager. He works hard on his agricultural land, which he will inherit from his parents; this will help cover the costs of his university studies. Although he receives support from his parents there are times when the money is not enough due to the costs of various books and homework from the university. The request Olson makes is for the purchase of compost and fertilizers so that his production improves in quality and brings higher profits, which will cover the student costs. It is very difficult to work and study at the same time, but this does not matter to Olson because his biggest wish is to finish his schooling. Help this young student improve his agricultural products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Olson es un joven de 20 años que desde adolescente trabajo con su familia en la agricultura, él trabaja con esmero en sus terrenos de cultivo, lo que heredé de sus padres, actividad que le ayuda a solventar los gastos de sus estudios universitarios. A pesar de recibir el apoyo de sus padres hay momentos que el dinero no le alcanza por los diversos libros y tareas de la universidad. El pedido que hace Olson es para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para que su producción tenga una mejor calidad y esto le traiga mayores ganancias, las que solventarán los gastos estudiantiles, es muy difícil trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo, pero a Olson no le importa porque lo que más desea es terminar su carrera. Ayuda a este joven estudiante con la mejora de sus productos agrícolas.

loans.use: Purchase compost and fertilizers for his cultivos.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is a mother of 3 school age children and is the wife of a mototaxi driver that who supports her work. She sells breads and snacks to a variety of friends and neighbors who place their orders biweekly and who Olga responds to politely. Besides this activity, she also sells chickens at various markets which she does to periodically supplement her daily earnings and above all for the cost of educating her children. Therefore, now wants to increase sales of her products and this requires an amount of money that would help to soon become a distributor and sell at wholesale. Olga looks to you in search of this economic support she needs. .

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es madre de 3 hijos quienes aún son escolares y es esposa de un esforzado chofer de mototaxi a quien apoya con su trabajo, ella vende panes y bocaditos que ofrece a diversas amistades y vecinos quienes quincenalmente hacen sus pedidos y doña Olga los atiende amablemente. A parte de esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de pollo en los mercados, lo que realiza periódicamente como un apoyo adicional en los ingresos diarios de su hogar y sobre todo para los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. Por ello, ahora desea incrementar la venta de sus productos y para ello requiere de una cantidad de dinero que le ayudaría a convertirse pronto en distribuidora y vender al por mayor. Olga recurre a usted en busca de ese apoyo económico que necesita.

loans.use: Increase in capital to buy additional merchandise to sell at wholesale.

loans.name: Lesly

texts.es:
Lesly is a nineteen year old young woman who is studying clothing manufacturing; thanks to her work as a moneylender, she has been able to pay for her classes and her school expenses. She began lending money to people in her community one year ago, charging minimal interest rates, in order to help her with her expenses. It is a very risky activity, but she hasn’t had any major problems with it so far.

Lesly always did her moneylending as a side job while she finished her studies, as her true desire is to open her own sewing shop in her home and start a business with her parents. In order to do so, she needs to buy various equipment and tools which is why she is seeking a loan of $175 to invest in her future workshop.

She hopes that her wish can be granted soon since she is almost done with her studies and she has this great desire to open her own shop. Hopefully you can be a part of bringing this desire to its fulfillment.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Lesly es una muchacha de 19 años que cursa estudios de confección industrial y gracias a su actividad como prestamista puede pagar sus estudios y solventar los gastos que tiene en ello. Es así que desde hace un año se dedica a prestar dinero a las personas de su comunidad con mínimos porcentajes de interés, lo que le ayuda en sus gastos, esta actividad es muy arriesgada pero no ha tenido ningún inconveniente hasta el día de hoy, Lesly siempre tomó esta labor como provisional, mientras concluye sus estudios, el verdadero deseo de Lesly es abrir un taller de costura en su hogar e iniciar un negocio junto a sus padres, pero para ello requiere la compra de diversa maquinaria y útiles, para ello solicita un préstamo de 500 soles para invertirlo en su futuro taller de costura. Ella espera que usted pueda atender a su solicitud ya que se encuentra a punto de concluir sus estudios y tiene este anhelo de tener su propio taller, anhelo del cual usted puede ser participe de su cumplimiento.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment and tools in order to start her own sewing business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys is a very hard-working woman who chose to work in sales since she considers herself a very good saleswoman, which she has proved as her business has improved over time.

Gladys sells baked goods like breads and cookies. She began offering her products to her friends and neighbors, but now she has a large list of customers, many of whom make large orders. In order to accommodate the large orders, Gladys uses a moto-car (a small enclosed, motorcycle-like vehicle) to deliver her products; this vehicle has become a key part of her business.

Gladys is seeking a loan in order to repair her moto-car which currently has various mechanical problems; without the moto-car, Gladys cannot deliver her products rapidly to her customers. With a thankful heart, Gladys hopes to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys es una mujer trabajadora, eligió dedicarse a las ventas, porque considera que es muy buena vendedora, y el paso del tiempo y la mejora de su negocio lo han demostrado. Lo que Gladys vende son productos de repostería, como panes y galletas. Ella se inició ofreciendo a sus vecinos y amigos, pero ahora tiene una gran lista de clientes, que el hacen grandes pedidos, por lo cual Gladys decidió utilizar un motocarro para el reparto de sus productos, este vehículo se ha convertido en pieza clave para su negocio, y es el motivo del pedido que hace ahora, solicita un préstamo para repararte dicho motocarro, que tiene desperfectos mecánicos, y sin él, Gladys no puede repartir con rapidez sus productos. Con el corazón agradecido, Gladys espera que le brinden el préstamo.

loans.use: Repair her moto-car which she used to deliver the merchandise she sells

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov C. is a villager in Snam Pok Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer who harvests her crop twice a year. During the rainy season Mrs. Pov C. cultivates rice, and she grows vegetables in the dry season. Her husband, Mr. Phal Noeurn, assists his wife with the farming.

Mrs. Pov C. is 32-years-old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school. The youngest is too young to work or study. Her family lives under poor conditions because Mrs. Pov C. and her husband currently make a small income. Their house is old. Thus, she is now requesting a loan to buy equipment to build a new house. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy equipment to build a new house.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeurn C. and his wife, Mrs. Im Thaong, are farmers in Snam Pok Village in Kampong Speu Province. Mr. Saroeurn C. now faces an obstacle because he does not have enough cows to plow his rice field. Thus, Mr. Saroeurn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to plow the field.

Previously, Mr. Saroeurn C. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy an old cow and he has paid back this loan. Mr. Saroeurn C. is 57-years-old and the father of five children, four of whom are employed in different business activities. The remaining one is enrolled in school. Mr. Saroeurn C. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow the field.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon P. is a farmer in Snam Pok Village in Kampong Speu Province. During the rainy season she cultivates rice, and in the dry season she grows vegetables. Since her business activity cannot support her family well, Mrs. Phon P. wants to start a grocery business. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery goods to start this business.

Mrs. Phon P. is a 37-year-old widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. The other three are studying at state school. Previously, Mrs. Phon P. had obtained a loan to buy watermelon seeds for cultivating and she succeeded in paying off this loan.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to start her new business to improve living conditions.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi D., 40 years old, has 2 children who are still going to school. She joined the TYM Fund since 1997. At first, she used the borrowed money in planting vegetables. However, this activity did not bring her a large amount of profit. She then switched to investing in a general store. After 10 years of membership, she has helped improving her family economy. She is able to furnish her house with tables, closets...Her children are sent to good school. This time, she wants to borrow 1150 USD to buy more merchandise for her store. Her average income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Doãn năm nay 40 tuổi. Hiện gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học.Chịtham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Các vòng vốn đầu chị vay để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi trồng trọt song nhận thấy các dự án này mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế không cao chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển và ổn định hơn. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn và tiết kiệm trong chi tiêu chị đã mua sắm được một số trang thiết bị như tủ,bàn ghế và một số vật dụng khác .Các con của chị được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để mua thêm hàng tạp hoá về bán cho người dân địa phương. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: general store

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan S. owns a small grocery store in Snam Pok Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, she is a farmer. Her husband, Mr. Oem Un, assists in the farming business. Even though they have two businesses, they still cannot support the whole family.

Mrs. Yan S. is now requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Yan S. has four children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. The remaining two are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Yan S. had obtained a loan to start her grocery business and she paid off this loan. Mrs. Yan S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. H. is 43 years old. She joined the TYM Fund since 1999. Since the beginning, she used the borrowed money in raising animals. She was raised in a family with agricultural tradition; therefore, she has a lot of experience in breeding animals. After 9 years of membership, her farm is expanded. She went from having 2-3 pigs to having 25 pigs. Currently, breeding animals is Mrs. H. and her 2 children’ responsibilities. Her husband is a carpenter, earning 100 USD/month. This time, she wants to borrow 1075 USD to fix the breeding facilities and buy more pigs. Her average income is 225 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Huyên năm nay 43 tuổi. Chị bắt đầu tham gia vào quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Ngay từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay vốn và sử dụng vào dự án chăn nuôi. Với truyền thống gia đình làm nghề nông nên gia đình chị đã có rất nhiều kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi. Đến nay qua 9 năm sử dụng vốn có hiệu quả mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã được mở rộng hơn. Từ chỗ chỉ nuôi 2-3 con lợn đến nay gia đình chị đã có đàn lợn 25 con. Hiện tại công việc chăn nuôi tại gia đình do chị và 2 con đảm nhiệm, chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm thợ mộc cho thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 18.000.000đ để sửa sang chuồng trại và mua lợn về nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi N., 42 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2002. At first, she borrowed money to invest in raising animals but her project did not go well. However, she had the determination to borrow more money to invest in a general store. Her income mainly comes from this store. Besides, Mrs. N. also raises chickens and does some agricultural activities. With a stable income from the agricultural activities and the general store, her family economy is much better now. Her 2 children are well-raised. This time, she wants to borrow 850 USD to invest more in her general store. Her income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Ngọ năm nay 42 tuổi, chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi song dự án không mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao.Tuy vậy chị đã không nản lòng và mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư mua hàngtạp hoá về bán cho người dân địa phương. Đến nay thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình dựa vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. N.ài ra gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn gà và làm nông nghiệp. Nhờ có nguồn thu nhập ổ định từ chăn nuôi trồng trọt và kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá kinh tế gia đình chị hiện nay đã ổn định hơn, hai con của anh chị đều được chăm sóc đầy đủ. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay 14.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào cửa hàngtạp hoá. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in grocery

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Mr. Saroeurn P. and his wife are farmers in Svay Pok Village in Kampong Speu Province. They have five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while three others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Mr. Saroeurn P. does not have enough cows to plow his field, thus, therefore he has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more cows. On his plantation, Mr. Saroeurn P. has had to deal with a drought in the past few years that has reduced his crop size. Previously, Mr. Saroeurn P. obtained a loan to buy zinc to cover his house roof. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow the rice field

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mrs. Mean H. and her husband, Mr. Mi Pheon, are farmers in Trapaing Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, Mr. Mi Pheon transports soil by motorbike to sell in the village. They have three children, two of whom are attending school, while another is too young to work or study. Although Mrs. Mean H. and her husband have two businesses, they cannot afford a new house. Thus, Mrs. Mean H. has decided to ask for a loan to build a new house in order to live separately from her parents. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi N., 39 years old, has 2 children who are going to school. She joined the TYM Fund since 1998. Living in a family that has agricultural tradition, she used her money in breeding and planting vegetables. After 10 years of membership, she now has more savings and more experience to be able to expand her farm. She and her husband are investing in a fish-raising project because she has a large pond at home. Besides, she is raising 100 chickens. She earns about 200 USD/ month from raising chickens and fishes. Her family living conditions have improved. This time, she wants to borrow 1075 USD to buy more fishes, chickens and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị N. năm nay 39 tuổi. Gia đìnhchị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Vốn là gia đình thuần nông nên khi vay vốn về chị sử dụng đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và trồng trọt.Qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương cùng với số vốn vay tăng đần và vốn kinh nghiệm được tích luỹ qua quá trình chăn nuôi hiện nay mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã được mở rộng hơn, Hiện nay vợ chồng chị đang đầu tư vào dự án chăn nuôi cá. Với diện tích ao sẵn có tại gia đình, vợ chồng chị N. đã đầu tư vốn để mua cá giống về nuôi. Ngoài ra gia đình đang nuôi 100 con gà thịt. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng từ việc chăn nuôi gà, cá điều kiện sống của gia đình chị đã được cải thiện và tăng lên rõ rệt. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 18.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thức ăn nuôi cá và mua thêm gà, cá giống về nuôi.

loans.use: Raising chicken and fish

loans.name: La Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. La Thi T., 48 years old, has two children who are still going to school. In 1999, she joined the TYM Fund. At first, she invested in breeding animals but the profit was not high. Therefore, she later invested the borrowed money in general store. Her store is full of merchandises such as candies, fruits…Besides, she also sells fertilizer to assist local people with agricultural activity. Being helped by her husband and her children, she does not have too many difficulties in her businesses. This time, she wants to borrow 900 USD to invest more in the general store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lã Thị Thành năm nay 48 tuổi.Gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học.Năm 1999 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương. Vòng vốn đầu chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi song hiệu quả dự án đem lại cho gia đình không cao. Vì vậy các vòng vốn sau chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Cửa hàng nhà chị hiện kinh doanh rất nhiều mặt hàng như bánh kẹo, hoa quả...Ngoài ra để phục vụ nhu cầu sản xuất nông nghiệp tại địa phương gia đình chị còn kinh doanh thêm phân đạm. Do nhận được sự hỗ trợ từ chồng và các con nên công việc kinh doanh của chị đang gặp nhiều thuận lợi và ngày càng phát triển. Vòng cốn tới chị monmg muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hoá của gia đình. Thu nậhp 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Investment in general store

loans.name: Toan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Toan Thi Q. has been a TYM partner since 2000. She used the first loan of 500,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in a live-stock farming project, whose benefit was 150,000 Vietnamese Dong. Since then, besides farming, her family has also been planting many kinds of fruit trees, which are highly productive and beneficial such as orange and longan. At the moment, the benefits from farming and planting reach 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. With the stable family income, the couple managed to support their children and acquire valuable family facilities. She plans to borrow the next loan of 12,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy fertilizer and more pigs to breed, expanding the family finance.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Quách Thị Toàn tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Với số vốn vay đầu tiên là 500.000đ chị đã sử dụng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, dự án cho thu lãi là 150.000đ. Kết hợp với dự án chăn nuôi hiện nay gia đình chị còn trồng thêm một số loại cây ăn quả. Tận duụngdiện tích đất vườn của gia đình, chị đã trồng thêm một số loại cây cho năng suất và hiệu quả kinh tế cao như cây nhãn, cam. Đến nay thu nhập của gia đình chị từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt đạt 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Với thu nhập ổn định chị đã nuôi được con trưởng thành và mua sắm thêm được một số đồ dùng gia đình có giá trị. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua phân bón và mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

loans.use: Raising and growing

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mrs. Uk M. is a 33 year old mother of one who lives in Trapaing Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Hoeurn Suk, transports soil by motorbike to sell in different villages. Their family has just built a new house but they have not yet completed it because Mrs. Uk M. does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Uk M. has decided to ask for a loan to build a banister for their home. Previously, Mrs. Uk M. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer for her field which she successfully paid off. Mrs. Uk M., her husband and their child are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a banister for house

loans.name: Hang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hang Thi D. is a 49 year old woman. She is living with her husband and her 2 children, who are going to school. Before her participation in TYM program, like many other local families, her family income is mainly from farming and live-stocks. In 2001, she first borrowed money to invest in live-stock. Then she switched and courageously invested in grocery retailing. At the moment, the family main income is from her grocery store. Her husband, while not working on the farm, is the one to go and purchase goods from wholesalers. Thanks to the stable income, they managed to improve their living condition and support their children’s education. She plans to borrow the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy grocery goods.
The family’s income is 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong.
 Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.
Chị Đỗ Thị Hằng năm nay 49 tuổi, chị đang sống cùg chồng và 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi  tham gia Quỹ tình thương, cũng như các gia đình khác tại địa phương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Năm 2001 chị bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Nhưng vốn là người phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Hiện nay nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là từ kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.Ngoài thời gian làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi tại gia đình chồng chị còn đi lấy hàng từ các đại lý lớn về cho chị bán. Nhờ có thu nhập ổn định gia đình chị đã có điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Vòng vốn tới chị mong uốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng gia dụng phục vụ cho bà con địa phương.
Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Grocery retailing

loans.name: Hung Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hung Thi B. is a 58 year old woman. Her 2 children have grown up. At the moment, she is living with her husband in Kim Dong, Hung Yen, in 1998, she first participated in TYM program and borrowed 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in live-stock; the project’s benefit was 100,000 Vietnamese Dong. For 10 years, because of her clever use of the loans, her family’s income has increased remarkably. Her husband is a retiree, who receives monthly pension, which also contributes to the family’s budget. Besides, live-stock farming, the couple makes use of their broad yard to plant fruit-trees. In her garden now, there are many kinds of seasonal trees such as orange, longan. With her knowledge of fertilizer and constant observation of new method to improve the trees’ productivity, the return from her garden has always been remarkable. She plans to borrow the next loan of 10,000,000 Vietnamese Dong and use a large proportion of the loan to buy new plants and fertilizer; the rest of the loan will be used to buy more pigs. The family’s income is 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Hưng năm nay 58 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 2 con đã trưởng thành.Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng tại huyện Kim Động tỉnh Hưng Yên.Năm 1998 chị thma gia Quỹ tình thương và sử dụng vốn vay vòng 1 là 300.000 đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, dự án cho thu lãi 100.000đ. Đến năm 2008, qua 10 năm sử dụng vốn vay đúng mục đích và hiệu quả kinh tế của gia đình chị đã trăng lên đáng kể. Chồng chị là cán bộ hưu trí vì thế hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ lương hưu của chồng vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Hiện nay ngoà đầu tư cho chăn nuôi, gia đình chị còn tận dụng đất vườn rộng để trồng cây ăn trái. Vườn nhà chị hiện đang trròng rất nhiều loại cây theo mùa như cam, bưởi, nhãn. Nhờ biết cách chăm bón và không ngừng học hỏi các phương pháp mới nhằm nâng cao hiệu quả và năng suất vườn cây nhà chị vụ mùa nào cũng cho thu nhập cao. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay 10 .000.000đ đ để mua cây giống và phân bón phục vụ dự án trồng cây ăn quả. Chị cũng dự định dùng một phần nhỏ vốn vay lần tới để mua thêm lợn về nuôi.

Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising and growing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ky Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ky Thi N. is a 47 year old woman. She has been participating in TYM program since 2002. She invested the first loan of 500,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in a live-stock project, whose benefit was 200,000 Vietnamese Dong. With the next loans, she continued to invest in live-stock and, besides, started rice-milling. Every day, she buys paddy rice and mills it to sell. This business, to her family, is relatively financially beneficial. At the moment, her husband and children are in charged of farming, while she spends more time on rice-milling. Besides income from those sources, they also receive her husband’s monthly pension; therefore, her family’ financial situation is relatively good in the local area. She plans to borrow the next loan of 18,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy more inventory paddy rice. The family’s income is 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Kỳ năm nay 47 tuổi. Chị Kỳ bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 500.000đ và sử dụng để chăn nuôi. Kết thúc dự án chị thu được 200.000đ tiền lãi. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị vay vốn để tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và làm thêm nghề hàng sáo. Hàng ngày chị đi mua thóc về sau đó say thành gạo để bán. Công việc này cũng đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao cho gia đình. Hiện nay chồng và các con của chị đảm nhiệm công việc chăn nuôi còn chị đầu tư thời gian và vốn vào nghề hàng sáo để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và buôn bán hàng tháng chồng chị còn có thêm nguồn thu ổn định từ lương hưu vì thế gia đình chị là một trong những hộ có kinh tế khá tại địa phương. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 18.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thóc về dự trữ và sát gạọ bán dần.

Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Rice-milling

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia baji, the wife of Mr. Z., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan since her childhood. She owns a three-room mud house and is the mother of two sons. Her elder son, Ali Raza, is 5 years old and in kindergarten. She recently successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Her husband is a fruit seller and now she is applying for a loan to buy more fruit for his business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Maryam baji wants a loan for her shoe business; Shamshad baji wants to buy wood for her furniture business; Suraiya baji wants to purchase a sewing machine, while Samina baji wishes to buy fruits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ngoc Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngoc Thi T. is a 37 year old woman. She has 2 children, who are going to school. She participated in TYM program in 2004 and used the first loan to raise pigs, but was not successful. As she could see that cow raising was more beneficial, the next loans were invested in breeding cows. At the moment, in family’s stable, there are 4 cows. In order to improve the family budget and support their children’s education, her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver. The family’s income is 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to borrow the next loan of 8,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy more cows and food for them

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc T., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị TrầnThị Ngọc năm nay 37 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Vòng vvốn đầu tiên chị sử dụng để chăn nuôi lợn nhưng nhận thấy công việc chăn nuôi bò thịt tại địa phương đang phát triển và cho thu nhập cao hơn nên các vòng vốn sau chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bà thịt. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang nuôi 4 con bò. Để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình và có điều kiện đầu tư cho con cái ăn học, hàng ngày chồng chị đi làm nghề xe ôm. Thunhập hiện nay của gia đình chị đạt 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Để có vốn mua thêm bò và thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 8.000.000đ

loans.use: Buy cow and invest in raising

loans.name: Tham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tham Thi Nguyem is a 46 year old woman. She has 3 children, 2 of whom are going to school. Before her participation in TYM program, her family faced many financial difficulties because the finance depended only on farming and they did not have money to invest in businesses. In 1999, she borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. For 9 years, thanks to her intelligent use of the loans, the family’s business has been expanding. At the moment, they are taking care of 10 pigs and 100 chickens. She plans to borrow the next loan of 7,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to renovate the farm and buy more pigs and chickens. The family’s income is 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thắm năm nay 46 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 người con trong đó có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đìnhchị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do kinh tế chủ yếu dựa vào làm nông nghiệp và thiếu vốn làm ăn.Năm 1999 chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Có thêm vốn vay gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào mua lợn về nuôi.Đến nay qua 9 năm sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã được mở rộng và quy mô hơn. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang nuôi 10 con lợn và khoảng 100 con gà. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 7.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại va mua thêm gà, lợn để nuôi.

Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in raising

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Mrs. Thol H. is a farmer in Trapaing Angkrorng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Phan Rim, uses transport soil by motorbike to sell in different villages. They have three children who are too young to work or attend school. On her plantation, Mrs. Thol H. faces a small problem because she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Thol H. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to help her plow her field. Mrs. Thol H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to help plow field

loans.name: Zuhran's Group

texts.en:
Zuhran baji, the wife of M.H., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan since her childhood. She owns a two-room brick house, and her husband grows and sells cotton. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy seeds for her husband’s cotton business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Musarat baji wants to buy wood for her furniture business; Sharifan baji and Naseem baji desire a loan for their grocery shop, while Riaz baji wants a loan for her fruit business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Thi Thuoc

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thuoc, 54 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 1999. Before that, her family's income came mainly from farming. Therefore, she used the first loan to invest in raising livestock. However, the income from that project did not bring about a significant increase in income. As she is skillful and sensitive in doing business, she discussed with her husband and decided to borrow and invest in growing decorative plants. Together with raising livestock and farming, this project has brought about increasing income. Currently, she has many decorative plants with high values. This time round, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to grow more decorative plants to sell in the coming Lunar New Year. Her family's monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 250USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thược năm nay 54 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Vì vậy khi được vay vốn vòng 1 gia đình chị đã sử dụng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Nhưng hiệu quả từ dự án chăn nuôi lại không mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Với bàn tay khéo léo và sự nhanh nhẹn trong việc nắm bắt nhu cầu thị trường vợ chồng chị đã bàn bạc và quyết định vay vốn để đầu tư vào dự án tăng thu nhập mới đó là dự án trồng cây cảnh. Với dự án này kết hợp với chăn nuôi, trồng trọt, thu nhập của gia đình chị đã rất ổn định và ngày càng phát triển.Trong vườn nhà chị hiện nay đang có rất nhiều cây cảnh có giá trị kinh tế cao. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư cho việc trồng cây cảnh để bán trong dịp Tết Nguyên đán tới. Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in  growing decorative plants

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Seeran's Group

texts.en:
Seeran baji, the wife of K. M., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 50 years. She owns a five room brick house and is the mother of eight children. Her first two sons are in 7th standard (grade). She recently completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), using the funds to buy a vehicle. She is now applying for a new one on behalf of her husband, a driver by profession, who wants to repair his truck.

She is joined in her loan group by four members: Khursheed baji wants a loan to purchase car seat covers to resell; Nasreen baji, Bashiran baji and Hafizan baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Thi Xoa

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Xoa, 38 years old, has 2 school-going children. She owns a general store and an eatery. Her business goes well due to her husband's tremendous help. Everyday her husband purchases the foods and goods for her to sell. With reasonable price and friendly atmosphere, her stores always attract many customers, thus her monthly income always reaches 3,000,000VND (about 190USD). This time, she would like to borrow 8,000,000VND (500USD) to purchase more foods and goods for her business so that she can increase her family's income.
 Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.
Chị T. Thị Xoa năm nay 38 tuổi. Gia đình chị  có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang có cửa hàng kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá và bán hàng ăn. Công việc kinh doanh của chị có nhiều thuận lợi do chị nhận được sự hỗ trợ rất đắc lực từ chồng. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi lấy hàng về chế biến cho chị bán cho khách hàng. Với thái độ niềm nở, giá cả hợp lý nên cửa hàng nhà anh chị lúc nào cũng đông khách vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị luôn đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000đ  đầu tư mua thêm đồ dùng và thực phẩm để phục cụ cho công việc kinh doanh tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: Invest in eatery and general store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Tip

texts.en: Mr. Tip P. and his wife, Mrs. Soeurn Yem, are farmers in Sarekakeo Village in KamP. Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, Mr. Tip P. is a bed maker. They have six children, two of whom are attending school, while the remaining four are too young to work or study. Mr. Tip P. now faces an obstacle because he has insufficient number of cows to plow his rice field; therefore Mr. Tip P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy another cow to help him plow his field. Previously, Mr. Tip P. obtained a loan from Prassac Co., Ltd to buy a cart which he successfully paid off. His wife, Mrs. Soeurn Yem, is currently sick and Mr. Tip P. spends $250 for her health costs. For this reason, Mr. Tip P. does not have enough money to buy a cow to plow his field. Mr. Tip P. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy another cow to plow field

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji, the wife of F. H., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 20 years. She owns a four room brick house and is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her sons finished their education at the 10th standard (grade) while her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She recently successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and now is applying for a loan to buy more shoes to resell in her husband’s shoe shop.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Anwar baji wants to buy garments to resell locally; Rashda baji seeks a loan for her grocery shop; Nadia baji wants a loan for her stove to make and sell nan (bread), while Majeedan baji wishes to buy oil to cook her Punjabi food (samosas, pakodas, etc.), which she then sells.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Thi Vinh

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Vinh, 52 years old, has 5 children, 1 of whom is still schooling. Her husband works as a barber with the monthly income of 1,000,000VND (about 64USD). In 2003, she discussed with her husband to join the TYM Fund to invest in raising livestock. With the help from her husband and her 4 grown-up children, her pig-breeding plant alway has high yield. This time, she would like to borrow 15,000,000VND (900USD) to renovate the pig sty and purchase more pigs. Her monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 193USD)
 Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.
Chị Nguyễn Thị Vĩnh năm nay 52 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 5 người con trong đó có 1 con đang tuổi đi học. Chồng chị làm nghề cắt tóc cho thu nhập 1.000.000đ/ tháng. Năm 2003 để phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Cùng với sự giúp đỡ của chồng và 4 người con đã trưởng thành dự án chăn nuôi lợn của gia đình chị luôn cho hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn về nuôi
Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Breeding pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Thu

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thu, 36 years old, lives with her husband and her 3 school-going children in Nghi Loc, Nghe An province. As she was from a farming family, after marriage she and her husband mainly did agricultural work to earn a living. In 2003, she discussed with her husband to join the TYM Fund to borrow and improve her family's economy. With the loans obtained she invested in breeding pigs to sell. With the experienced acquired through the years, how her breeding plant is increasingly effective. Besides breeding pigs at home, she also has a retail business to increase income so that her children can go to school. This time, she would like to borrow 17,000,000VND (1,025USD) to invest in breeding pigs. Her monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 190USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thu năm nay 36 tuổi. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con đang tuổi đi học tại huyện Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An. Vốn xuất thân từ nhà nông nên sau khi lập gia đình và ra ở riêng vợ chồng chị chủ yêú làm nông nghiệp. Năm 2003 chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Có thêm vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào nuôi lợn thịt để bán. Với kinh nghiệm chăn nuôi đã được tích luỹ qua nhiều năm đến nay dự án chăn nuôi cuả gia đình chị ngày càng hiệu quả. Ngoài thời gian chăn nuôi tại gia đình chị còn tranh thủ đi buôn bán để tăng thêm thu nhập, tạo điều kiện cho các con ăn học. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 17.000.000 đ để đầu tư vào nuôi lợn. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Breeding pigs

loans.name: Thi An

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi An is the owner of a general store. She is 45 years old and has been a member of the TYM Fund for 5 years. She has 6 children, 2 of whom are adults. Previously, her family's income came mainly from agriculture. After joining the Fund, she decided to invest in a general store. At first, she only had a small store with limited goods as she was new in the business. However, until now, she has expanded her store and added in a wide variety of goods to satisfy the local people's demand. Together with her family's income from agriculture, the income from the general store has improved her family's economy. This time, she would like to borrow 16,000,000VND (975USD) to invest in her general store. Her monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 190USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị An hiện là chủ cửa hàng tạp hoá. Chị An năm nay 45 tuổi và đã là thành viên của quỹ tình thương được 5 năm.Gia đình chị có 6 người con trong đó có 2 người con đã trưởng thành.Thu nhập của gia đình trước đây chủ yếu là do làm nông nghiệp. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để tăng thêm tthu nhập cho gia đình chị đã quyết định đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá. Lúc đầu do mới làm quen với công việc buôn bán chị chỉ buôn bán nhỏ với một số ít mặt hàng. Đến nay gia đình chị đã có một cửa hàng với rất nhiều mặt hàng phục vụ nhu cầu rất đa dạng của người dân địa phương. Cùng với thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và nguồn thu ổn định từ cửa hàng tạp hoá kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 16.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào cửa hàng tạp hoá Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in general store

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwar baji, the wife of M.A., has been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 20 years. She owns a two-room mud house and is the mother of seven children: four daughters and three sons, all enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband has a business changing oil in automobiles, so she is applying for a loan to buy more oil and other supplies for his enterprise.

Anwar baji is joined in her loan group by four other members: Zubaida baji wants a loan for her grocery shop; Tahira baji wishes to buy buffalo for her livestock business; Imtiaz baji wants a loan for her shuttering business (renting wooden beams for people to use temporarily to support their roofs), while Ayesha baji has a mobile phone shop that she wishes to expand.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Thi Hang

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi Hang, 35 years old, has 2 school-going children. In 2005, she joined the TYM Fund to borrow and invest in her general store. She was inexperienced in doing business at first so the store was small with few goods. However, now the store has expanded with a wide variety of goods to meet the customers' demand. Besides managing the store, her family also raises livestocks, thus the family's economy has increased over time. This time round, mrs. Hang would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to invest in her general store. Her family's monthly income is 2,500,000VND (about 161USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đinh Thị Hằng năm nay 35 tuổi. Gai đình chị hiện có hai con đang tuổi đi học. năm 2005 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hoá. Lúc đầu do mới làm quen với công việc buôn bán chị chỉ buôn bán nhỏ với một số ít mặt hàng. Đến nay gia đình chị đã có một cửa hàng với rất nhiều mặt hàng phục vụ nhu cầu rất đa dạng của người dân địa phương. Ngoài bán hàng tạp hoá gia đình chị vẫn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà. Cùng với thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và nguồn thu ổn định từ cửa hàng tạp hoá kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào cửa hàng tạp hoá Thu nhập 2. 500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: invest in general store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Bibi baji, the wife of S. M., a daily wage laborer, has lived in Raiwind, Pakistan for the last 50 years. She is the mother of four sons. Her first two sons are daily wage laborers, while the next eldest works in a factory. Bibi baji has a livestock business and successfully completed three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for her livestock business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Khursheed baji wants a loan for her grocery shop; Shamim baji wants to buy a buffalo for her milk business; Saira baji wishes to buy more material for her garment business, while Naseem baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji, the wife of M.S., lives in Raiwind, Pakistan, where she owns a two room brick house. She is the mother of five children: four daughters and one son, all enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband works in a factory, while Nusrat baji has a milk business. She successfully completed three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Naziran baji wants a loan for her embroidery business, while Rashda baji, Razia baji and Sabra baji want to buy a buffalo for their milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of Z. A., a daily wage laborer, and has lived in Raiwind, Pakistan for the last 25 years. The mother of three sons, Razia baji has a milk business. She successfully completed three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Irshad baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business; Najma baji wants to buy more material for her grocery shop; Haleem baji wants to repair her auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle), while Bashiran baji wants a loan to purchase animals to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so that if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is the wife of A. Rahman and has lived in Raiwind, Pakistan for the last 45 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her daughter makes embroidered dresses; her elder son is a government servant, while the next eldest works in a petrol pump. Her husband is a government servant. Sakina has a milk business, but she also does household work. She successfully concluded previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a new one to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Bashiran baji wants to buy an animal to resell; Zahida baji wishes to purchase a buffalo for her milk business; Sajida baji wants a loan for her embroidery business, while Parveen baji wishes to buy more products for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan whose funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Nurkhon

texts.en:
Nurkhon M. is 32 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. 
Her husband is a businessman. Nurkhon is the head of the Health Center in the village of Hamid Aliev. Since the salary of Nurikhon and her husband was not enough for their family expenses, two years ago she started her own business. Nurkhon  raises cattle.  She buys  small cattle on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. Her elder son is also involved in this business. Nurkhon works hard in order to make the business successful and to generate a stable income for the family.  
Nurkhon is planning to purchase cattle for her household for raising and further selling. With this purpose she requests $500 for the term of 12 months. As this is her first loan, Nurkhon promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for raising and selling.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba M. is 56 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Her elder son is going to university. When her husband passed away, she was left without steady income. Supporting her large family on her own was very difficult. Matluba is a market vendor. She started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and health related expenses.  She is working hard as she is the only bread-winner in the family. Matluba sells shoes for women. She has been in this business for nine years. Matluba is trying to diversify the range of goods to satisfy the needs of clients with the various levels of income. Her son helps Matluba with deliveries. The business is stable allowing Matluba to be able  to provide the best future for her children and to make them well-educated. Now Matluba is planning to purchase  new shoes for women for the summer season in order to meet her clients' demand. With this purpose she requests $700 USD for the term of 10 months. With the profit from the loan Matluba is planning to get medical treatment as she is very  ill. Matluba thanks all those supporting her and promises to  repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing  new women's  shoes to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo N. is 23 years old. She’s married. Her husband recently graduated from the university. Dilrabo is a hard-working woman and she owes it to her dear parents who forged in her an attitude of determination and dedication for self-improvement. Dilrabo has run her business for almost two years. She purchases  young cattle in the local market, fattens and sells in the local markets. Her husband helps Dilrabo with the business. Thanks to this activity she is supporting her family. Today Dilrabo is applying for a loan of $400  for the term of 12 months. With the help of the loan she is planning to purchase more small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Riskiniso

texts.en: Riskiniso U. is 36 years old. She’s married with four children. Because of  difficult family financial conditions, a year ago her husband  left for Russia to find work.. The difficult circumstances and hardships in Riskiniso's life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 5 years she has been purchasing  young cattle in the local market then fattening  and reselling them at the best price. Riskiniso is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She started this occupation because of the recommendation and teaching of her beloved father. Thanks to this activity she is supporting her children and ensuring that they receive a good  education. Riskiniso wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves. With this purpose she is requesting a loan of $400 for the term of 12 months to buy a calf in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Vosidjon

texts.en: Vosidjon O. is 38 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a housekeeper. Vosidjon is a market vendor. He sells  shoes for men in the local market. After 10 years of working at the market, Vosidjon already has got enough experience to do his work successfully. He has clients who always buy from him. Vosidjon is trying to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. He works very hard to give his children a good education and to make them happy. Vosidjon is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new summer shoes for selling. With this purpose, Vosidjon requests $950 for the term of 10 months. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing  new goods for selling.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak R. is 35 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her husband is a cook. Because her husband was not able to earn enough for the family expenses,  Muborak decided to open her own business. She began five years ago selling shoes for women. She is delivers the goods by herself. Muborak is working hard in order to keep her children educated and to ensure them with the best future.
Today she requests a loan  of $950  as she is planning to expand her business and to support her elder son who is entering the University. Muborak promises to repay the loan in 10 months and expresses her gratitude to everyone for trusting and supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for expanding the business.

loans.name: Joyce Mwambene's Peacock Group

texts.en:
Joyce M., age 47, is married with three children (ages 26, 23 and 5). She has had cattle business since 1995. She has also opened a salon in 2002. She works from 7AM to 9PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $520.

Joyce hopes to take a loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to expand both businesses. She will share this loan with her group, Peacock, which totals 17 members. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Joyce is second from right in the back row.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en:
