Tuti F. is 48 years old. She is a widow with four children. After the death of her husband she was depressed and couldn’t find a place for a long time. Now 3 months has passed since her husband died of a heart attack and she has decided to continue her life for the sake of her children. For about ten years Tuti has been selling clothing for kids and women. As she had always liked sales, it went well after the business was started, and she has continued selling clothing since then. From the profit of her business, she takes care of her  children. She tries to choose various goods of good quality and attractive prices which allows her to keep her clientele. 
Today Tuti requests a $900 loan  for the term of 12 months. She will use the loan to purchase  new summer goods for kids and women. This purchase will enable her to restore her business, to earn money, and to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: Purchasing of  new summer clothing for kids and women to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Caroline Walele's Moven Pick Group

texts.en:
Caroline W., age 48, is a widow with two children (ages 20 and 17). She sells second-hand clothes from door to door. She began this business 6 months ago. She works whenever she is ready to move or is called by customers to bring them the clothes and she is able to make a monthly profit of around $109.

Caroline hopes to take a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She will share this loan with her loan group Moven Pick, which totals 19 members. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Caroline is in the middle of the first row.

loans.use: Buy more used clothes for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ilhomiddin

texts.ru:
Ilhomiddin B. lives in the town Tursun-zoda. He is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has a bachelor's degree. He is in the business of cattle breeding. He purchases calves for resale. He would like to obtain a credit so he could purchase a calf. After feeding it for a period of time, he sells it at a better price. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоев Илхомджон житель города Турсун- заде. Возраст 44 года ,женат и имеет четверых детей.имеет высшее образование. В данный момент пенсионер. Занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков для перепродажи. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить бычка. После откормки он продает их на базаре по более прибыльной цене. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat Zoirove lives in the town Tursun-zoda. She is married and has 3 children. She is in the business of sales. She doesn't have a permanent location, but she travels to villages. She goes from home to home and offers her goods. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She would like to obtain a credit and purchase school uniforms by the beginning of the season. School season is highly profitable, and for that reason, she needs to get a loan for 2500 somoni for 10 months as soon as possible.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Зоирова Мухаббат жительница города Турсун-заде. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается торговлей . Торговую точку не имеет . Торгует покишлакам. Ходит из дома в дом и предлагает товар. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. К школьному сезону хочет получить кредит и закупить школьную форму. Школьный сезон очень прибыльный , поэтому она должна срочно получить кредит в размере 2500 сомони, сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru:
Habibullo U. lives in the town Tursun-zoda. He lives there with his family. He is married and has 4 children. His occupation includes farming and animal breeding. He feeds calves for a period of time and then sells them on a market. He plans to obtain a credit so he could purchase a cow. This will help him further breed his animals. He will be paying off his credit within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Юсупов Хабибулло житель города турсун-заде. Живет со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается земледелием , а так же животноводством. Откармливает бычков и продает их на рынке. Запланировал получить кредит с целью покупки коровы. Она ему нужна для разведения своих бычков. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Maqsuda

texts.ru:
Maqsuda A. lives in the town Tirsun-zoda. She is 33 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her main occupation is farming. She grows vegetables and sells them on a market. She would like to obtain a credit so she would be able to purchase qulaity seeds and fertilizers. This will give her an opportunity to collect high quality crops. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Эшбуриева Максуда жительница города Турсун-заде. Возраст 33 года . Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Занимается земледелием . Выращивает овощи и продает на рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить качественные семена и удобрения. Это даст возможность получить качественный урожай. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kunti

texts.en:
Kunti A., 40 years old, is a tailor in the town of Koteshwor in the Kathmandu district.  She opened her tailoring shop 6 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses. 
Before starting her own business, Kunti took a 6 month training course in tailoring near her town. Six year ago, her husband, Puspa Raj A., died and now she is the sole responsible for her 3 children.She has two daughters and one son.  Her older daughter is studying for her BBS level and her younger daughter passed 12 level this year. Her son is in grade 8.
She plans to use the $300 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She is having difficulty fulfilling  the basic needs of her family. So she needs the loan to expand her business to earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Sumina

texts.en:
Sumina T. lives in a joint family with her mother-in-law, husband and two children. Her husband  Raj Kumar T. is a farmer. Their son is studying for his BBS (Bachelor in Business Study) and  their daughter has  received her SLC (School leaving Certificate) this year. 
Sumina sells cow's milk in Sainbu-Bhaishapati. She already owns two cows and she has been selling milk in that area. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutrition.
Sumina lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells milk door to door daily in the morning and evening.  Because of the rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production so she seeks a $225 loan to purchase a young milk giving cow.

loans.use: To buy young milk giving cow

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi K. is a 26 year old lady who lives in SainbuBhaishepati. She has four members including herself in her family. Her husband, Pradan is a land broker. Their daughter is studying for her BBS (Bachelor in Business Studies) and their son is studying in grade 12.
Kanchi started selling cow's milk a year ago to raise the living standard of her family. She already owns two cows. She usually sells cow’s milk door to door in the morning. Now she is requesting her third loan of $300 to buy another young cow. She lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. In Nepal people love to drink cow's milk so demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. Phal Y. owns a small grocery store in Trapaing Taing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is also a successful pig breeder who would like to expand her pig breeding business is doing well. Therefore she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

Mrs. Phal Y. is a 39-year-old widow with three children, all of whom are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Phal Y. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy a cart whilch she has fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeurn K. sells second-hand clothes in Kampong Os Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Aside from this business activity, she is a tailor. Since her businesses are going well, Mrs. Saroeurn K. would like to expand them by asking for a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to increase her inventory. Mrs. Saroeurn K. is a 51-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is working in a NGO, while the other is attending school.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Shyam Kumari

texts.en:
Shyam Kumari T. M. lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and two sons. Her father-in-law is a retired officer. Her husband works in his own mobile repairing shop. Her sons are studying in grade 7 and 4 respectively. Shyam Kumari  opened her beauty parlor four years ago to help her husband to improve the living standard of her family in SainbuBhaishapati. Before opening her own business she took a year training course from beauty parlor training institute for beauty parlor work. Her service is only for ladies. Now Shyam Kumari is requesting a loan of $450 to buy various types of cosmetics goods for her shop.

Shyam Kumari wants to save her income to provide a good education for her sons because the cost of education is very high in Nepal.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic goods

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sangita T. lives in Bhatkepati. Bhatkepati is one of the developing villages located in Kathmandu dristict. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. Sangita has three members including her self in her family. Her husband Mr. Share Bahadur T. works in private office and her son is in primary school. 
Mrs. Sangita opens her cosmetic shop five years ago in the town of Koteshwor. She sells different types of cosmetic goods in her shop like glass bangles, cream powder, etc in her shop. Now due to high competition she needs to increase verities of cosmetic items in her shop. So Mrs. Sangita T. is requesting a$225 loan to buy different varieties of cosmetic items.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Cheikh Tidiane

texts.fr:
This young man is the owner of a film and photography reporting studio. With more than 5 years experience in the field, he wants to enhance his studio and increase his revenue by reporting on the popular football championship “Navétanes” and the marriages that precede Ramadan. Mr. C. is married and has three children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Ce jeune est propirétaire d'un studio de reportage photo et caméra. Fort d'une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans le secteur, il veut renforcer son studio et augmenter ses revenus avec le championnat populaire "Navétanes" et les mariages qui précédent le Ramadan. Avec ses affaires C. est marié et pée de trois enfants.

loans.use: Photography studio enhancement

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon S. is a farmer in Kouk Penh Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Ra Oeur, is a coal seller and pig breeder. They do not have any children. Mrs. Phon S. faces an obstacle with her plantation since she cannot transport fertilizer to the field. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow cart which she will use for her farming transportation needs. She will also use part of her loan to buy piglets for her husband's business. Mrs. Phon S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow cart and piglets

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita B. lives in Koteshwor, Nepal one of the very busy cities located in the Kathmandu district. She has two daughters and one son. Her daughters got married and live separately and her son is studying in the  BBS level. Most of the people in this region are engaged in their own businesses. Sita  and her husband  Shankar opened their bag manufacturing factory 5 years ago. They manufacture different varieties of bags like school bags, ladies bags and so on. They have a few workers in their factory. They supply the bags to the bag shops in the market at the wholesale rate. 
Now Sita is requesting a loan for $375 to buy different types of raw material which are required for their work.

loans.use: To buy raw material for their business

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Mrs. Von S. lives with her husband and their two young children in Thmei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a chef who cooks food for laborers, while her husband, Mr. Mit Chea, is a construction foreman. Even though Mrs. Von S. and her husband have different income activities, they still cannot afford to repair their old house. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Von S. has decided to ask for a loan to build a new house. In the past Mrs. Von S. has already obtained a loan from AMK that she successfully paid back. She and her husband are pictured inside the frame of their new house.

loans.use: To build a new house
